loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 24 years old, a married man, and has two children who live in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a grocery store in the town market in his area. He sells a variety of basic household products. He has a good reputation and is very accessible. His business is a well-established business and many people come to it because they always find what they are looking for. He is very well-known and many people provide good references for him because he is noted for being an entrepreneurial man who is committed to his work. 

Ali has taken the decision to invest in his business so that he can keep it well stocked and attract more customers. This will allow him to increase his sales levels and his income, thereby enabling him to enjoy better living conditions. He has decided to request a youth loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to invest in his business, buying products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt and other products his customers would like. He hopes to expand his business to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt and other products

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a very hard-working person who is always looking to provide a better life for his family. He is 23 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a taxi driver who is focused on earning more money. He hopes in this way to have a better standard of living. 

Eager to get his business going, he is hoping for a youth loan from AMB to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi. As well, he hopes that with his earnings he can buy another taxi and own a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Shdad

texts.en: Shdad is a 27-year-old, single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a bachelor graduate. He is innovative and full of ideas. His relationship is good with people. He works hard to accumulate money. He applied for a youth loan of YER 200,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy a laptop for personal use. He looks forward to improving his living conditions and opening a savings account to collect money to open a business store.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for personal use.

loans.name: Hael

texts.en: Hael is 27 years old and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been working hard to manage his retail shop. He started his business as a worker in another retail shop. Then he saved a limited amount that he provided himself to open his business. To help expand his business, he has requested a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to buy canned food, mineral water and other products. The loan will help him to generate greater profits. He hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy canned food, mineral water and other products for his business.

loans.name: One Word Association Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the One Word Association Group. They are small-scale businesswomen, based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. 

This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) and Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and, consequently, improve upon their standards of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Mabinty. Mabinty is age 39. She was born in Kenema city, where she is currently residing, together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For many years now, Mabinty has been selling fried food. With her share of this loan, she will buy foodstuffs in bulk, in order fry more food to sell.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs in bulk, in order fry more food to sell.

loans.name: Mao

texts.es: Mao, de 35 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo con quien vive en una casa alquilada.Mao, tiene como actividad principal la compra y venta de madera, a diario se dirige a los principales madereras ubicadas en los alrededores de la ciudad para conseguir madera de buena calidad, tiene clientes que siempre solicitan su mercancía para transformarlos en cajas usadas en el transporte de encomiendas de frutas o animales. Eventualmente él mismo también transforma la madera, pero por lo general vende la madera en trozos o en tablas para una mejor manipulación. Trabaja de lunes a viernes generalmente durante las mañanas. Realiza este negocio desde hace 2 años y en este corto tiempo  ha logrado establecer 2 locales de trabajo en el que desempeña su labor con ayuda de otros obreros. Agradece que las cosas le están yendo muy bien ya que tiene buenos clientes que a diario lo buscan por la calidad de madera que ofrece, espera seguir trabajando de esta manera y más adelante abrir un negocio mucho más grande. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará madera al por mayor para seguir fabricando sus cajas.
texts.en:
Mao, 35, is married and has a son he lives with in a rented house.  Mao’s main activity is buying and selling lumber.  

He heads out to the main sawmills around the city to get the best quality lumber. He has customers that always request his merchandise to turn it into crates used to transport fruit loads or animals.  Sometimes he transforms the lumber himself but generally sells it in pieces or boards so they can be manipulated better.  He works Monday to Friday usually mornings.  He’s been in business two years and in this short time has succeeded in establishing two work sites where he does his work with help from other laborers.  

He is grateful that things are going very well because he has good customers that seek him out daily because of the quality of the lumber he offers.  He hopes to continue working this way and later on open a much larger business.  

On this occasion, he will request 1,000 soles and he’s grateful for the financial support he’s getting to continue moving ahead.  On the other hand, he commits to make his installment payments.  He will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy lumber at wholesale to continue manufacturing crates.

loans.use: to buy lumber at wholesale.

loans.name: Marvt

texts.en: Marvt is a 24-year-old single woman who lives in Taiz, Yemen. She has applied for a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB for further expansion of her tailoring business. She has great skills in her work and her clients are very satisfied. With the loan investment she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to run her business on time and increase her profits. She is very hopeful that she could improve her living standards and opening a sewing store.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is taking a loan of 600 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a bigger business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better after she applied for her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, second-hand shoes, and second-hand bags

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es una persona de 46 años de edad, casada y con cinco hijos. Actual mente vive con su esposo y su familia, la cual esta conformada por 5 hijos, para los cuales tiene que realizar una lucha constante para brindarles lo necesario. Se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde una temprana edad; ya que para su mamá era prioridad que se desempeñara de buena manera en esté ámbito y su propósito se logro ya que actualmente lo desempeña excelentemente.

Tomando en cuenta las condiciones de su comunidad ella, ha tomado la iniciativa de comprar un molino de nixtamal, ya que en la zona no se dispone de ese servicio y estima que además de llevar ese beneficio a la comunidad le representaría una fuente de ingreso.

Además, de abastecer su necesidad personal, llevara muchos beneficios a los habitantes de su comunidad, ya que se evitaran de caminar grandes distancias para tener el servicio de molida de maíz. Pretende con la inversión, llevar otra alternativa de ingresos a su casa, también mantener en un proceso constante de trabajo y aprendizaje a sus hijos tal como se lo enseñaron sus padres para alcanzar sus objetivos de mejora en la vida.

Su propósito es educar a sus hijos mediante su esfuerzo, darle las condiciones que ella personalmente no pudo tener y sobre todo tener éxito en la nueva actividad que pretende ejecutar.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46 is married with five children.  She currently lives with her husband and family consisting of five children for whom she must strive constantly in order to provide them with what’s needed.  She’s been doing domestic chores since a very young age since her mother’s priority was that she develops well in this area and she reached her goal for she does so excellently.

Taking into account her community’s condition, she’s taken the initiative of buying a ‘nixtamal’ [corn dough for tortillas, tamales, etc.] mill because her zone does not have this service and she figures that in addition to providing this service to the community it would also mean a source of income for her.

Also, in addition to meeting her personal need, it will bring many benefits to local residents because they would avoid having to travel great distances to find corn milling service.  She intends to use this investment to create another source of household income and to maintain a constant work process and apprenticeship for her children just like her parents did with her so that they can reach life improving goals.  Her objective is to educate her children by means of her effort, to give them the conditions she was unable to have personally and above all to be successful in this new activity she intends to execute.

loans.use: to buy a corn mill.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 37 years old. She has sold retail items for the past two years. She is married to a businessman and they have two children. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 31 years old. She owns a boutique and has been in the business for the past ten years. She wants the loan to buy more sugar, rice, soaps and salt for sale. The profits from the business  will be used to buy a place instead of renting.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, soaps and salt for sale

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo es un hombre de 43 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio, un bar que inició hace aproximadamente 18 meses, aún sin tener experiencia en esta actividad lo ha manejado bien y ha adquirido experiencia y conocimiento, simplemente porque la necesidad económica lo motivó a independizarse y buscar opciones para salir adelante, adicionalmente, complementa la actividad en el bar con la venta de comidas rápidas para aumentar el nivel de utilidades. El titular solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la mejora de su negocio, pues debe hacer unas mejoras en el local y pintarlo, para darle una mejor imagen y así atraer más clientes, que aumenten sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos, de esta manera podrá seguir luchando para cumplir el sueño de tener su negocio en un local propio, que le permita tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Guillermo’s a 43-year-old single man with no children.  He currently works tending to his business, a bar he opened about 18 months ago.  Though having no experience in this activity he’s managed it well and has gained experience and knowledge simply because economic need motivated him to become independent and seek options to get ahead.  In addition, he complements the bar business with fast-food sales to increase his profits.

He’s requesting the loan to do some site improvements because he must do some improvements to the locale and to paint it to improve its image and attract more customers that way that will increase sales and thus his profits.  In this way he will continue striving to reach his dream of having his business in a site of his own that will lead him to have better quality of life.

loans.use: to paint his bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a cooking course.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to shop every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and motor oil, motorcycle tires and other things. She has been involved in business activities since 2006. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Domingas independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar, coffee and motor oil, motorcycle tires and other things

loans.name: Moumine

texts.fr:
Mr MOUMINE  est né en Avril 1968 à Diabasso Cercle de Sikasso. Il vie à Diabasso un village de la commune rurale de Koumankou dans le cercle de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali), dans une famille traditionnelle élargie.
Il mène des activités agricoles depuis  20 ans. Il collabore avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, il y’a 2 ans, le prêt précédent a été bien remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 90 kg de semences certifiée de maïs, 12 sacs d’urée, 5 sacs de complexe céréales et payer les frais de  labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à Koumankou, à Kignan ainsi qu’à  Sikasso. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 700 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. MOUMINE was born in April 1968 in Diabasso, in Cercle de Sikasso. He lives in a traditional extended family located in Diabasso, a village in Commune Rurale de Koumankou, in Cercle de Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been farming for twenty years. He has collaborated with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years. The previous loan was indeed paid back.

This new loan will enable him to purchase 90 kg of certified corn seeds, 12 sacks of urea, and 5 sacks of grain complex and to pay the cost of plowing to maintain 4 hectares. 

The produce is sold in villages, in Koumankou, and in Kignan, as well as in Sikasso. He plans on making an average profit of 700,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable him to pay back the loan with interest and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs, seeds, and plowing

loans.name: Marleny Del Socorro

texts.es: Marleny, a sus 53 años de edad, es viuda y quedó a cargo de sus tres hijos. Hace 23 años se dedica a atender su negocio, una cafetería donde ofrece mecato, gaseosas, galletería y otros productos,  con lo cual ha podido generar ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Ella aprendió esta actividad sin el apoyo de nadie, simplemente con muchas ganas y esfuerzo, lo logró, porque las necesidades económicas la hicieron pasar por momentos difíciles en la vida. Ella manifiesta que algunas veces se presentan problemas de orden público en el sector, que afectan el buen desarrollo de su actividad comercial, pero esto no la detiene para seguir adelante. Requiere apoyo con el crédito que solicita, para invertirlo en la compra de materiales (tejas, madera, clavos) para el arreglo del techo de su negocio, pues cuando llueve se le filtra el agua afectando y deteriorando sus productos, de esta manera el negocio tendrá mejor imagen y los clientes se sentirán más cómodos. Es así, como Marleny desea avanzar, para cumplir el sueño de poder brindarle una estabilidad económica y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 53 years old and is a widow who takes care of her 3 children.  She has had this business for 23 years, which is a cafeteria where she sells cakes, soda, cookies, and other goods.  She has been able to earn income to help sustain her home.  She learned this profession without anyone else's help and achieved it by relying on her own desires and efforts.  Financial troubles made her go through difficult times in life.  Occasionally there has been civil unrest in her sector of the country which affects the development of her business, but this hasn't kept her from moving forward.

She is in need of support via the loan that she is asking for.  She will use it to buy supplies (fabric, wood, and nails) to repair her business' roof.  When it rains, the roof leaks and damages her goods.  In this way, her business will have a better image and her customers will feel more comfortable.  In this way, Marleny hopes to progress so she can fulfill her dream of offering financial stability and a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: buy materials to repair her business' roof.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es: Carmen, a sus 64 años de edad está casada y es madre de 3 hijos. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de leche, queso y quesito que ella misma produce, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre ya que vivían en una finca donde tenían ganado lechero. De esta forma, Carmen ha obtenido los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Carmen es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedica muchas horas al día en la elaboración de sus productos y luego los vende para generar ingresos. Actualmente solicita el crédito para realizar unas mejoras en el espacio donde trabaja, comprar una mesa en acero inoxidable y una nevera para almacenar los productos elaborados, mientras los distribuye. Es así como Carmen día a día, busca la oportunidad de alcanzar su principal sueño que es mejorar la estructura de su hogar, de esta forma podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
Carmen, 64, is married and mother of three children.  Since a very young age she’s worked selling milk, cheese and ‘quesito’ [Colombian soft cheese] that she makes herself.  She learned this activity from her mother since they lived on a dairy farm.  In this way, Carmen has earned income sufficient to provide daily sustenance at home and to move her children forward.

Carmen’s a very hardworking woman who spends many hours a day manufacturing her products to then sell and earn income.  She’s currently asking for the loan to do some site improvements to the space she works in, to buy a stainless steel table and a refrigerator to store the products she makes prior to selling them.  This is how Carmen seeks opportunities day to day to reach her main dream of making home improvements to have better quality of life and a tranquil old-age.

loans.use: to buy a stainless steel table, a refrigerator and to make site improvements.

loans.name: Zayron Olmedo

texts.es:
Zayron tiene 40 años, vive en unión libre, y tiene tres hijos.  Vive en el cantón de Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

El socio es  miembro de la ventanilla rural Aso. 10 de Septiembre que esta ubicado en Lechugalito   es un recinto que pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  Son 21 socios en total, es una comunidad Agrícola y Pecuaria en su mayoría.

Zayron trabaja en la agricultura  y crianza de gallinas para incrementar la economía de la familia.  Los cultivos que más sobresalen son el maíz, y arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas en la casa los productos vende en la casa y lo que siembra vende en el mercado de Mocache.
A Jairo  le gusta hacer deporte en la comunidad.

El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos.  Su meta es mejorar su situación  económica. Los desafíos que enfrenta es tener una casa decente.
texts.en:
Zayron, 40, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children.  He lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.

He's a member of the 10 de Septiembre communal bank, located in Lechugalito in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  There are 21 members in all.  It's primarily a farming and ranching community.

Zayron works in agriculture and raising chickens to increase his family's income.  His main crops are corn and rice.  He also raises chickens at home.  He sells the products at home, and sells what he grows in the market in Mocache.

Zayron likes to play sports in the community.

He's requesting the loan to buy inputs, fertilizer, and soil amendments.  His goal is to improve his economic situation.  The challenge he faces is having a decent house.

loans.use: to buy inputs, fertilizer, and soil amendments

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi est âgé de 23ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant en charge. Afin d’assumer ses besoins, il revend au marché des habits (friperie). Son premier prêt l’aidera à s’approvisionner en marchandises afin d’ouvrir plus tard une boutique et fonder une famille.
texts.en: Mr. Koffi is 23 years old, unmarried, and without any children to support. To see to his needs, he resells clothing (used) at the market. His first loan will help him to stock up on merchandise in order to open a store later on and start a family.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is taking a loan of $600 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She has a shop to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She feels better since she applied for her first loan. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes, secondhand shoes and secondhand bags

loans.name: Jesús Nelson

texts.es: Jesús, a sus 43 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de 3 hijos. Desde joven aprendió las labores del campo, donde ha vivido siempre, gracias a las enseñanzas y herencia de sus padres. Actualmente se dedica a cultivar café en la finca donde vive, pues allí tiene 30.000 palos del grano sembrados, los cuales ha cultivado con dedicación, paciencia y esfuerzo; habitualmente trabaja solo, pero cuando se va a recoger la cosecha contrata a varias personas para que lo apoyen en esa labor, luego vende el café y es así como obtiene los ingresos para pagarle a los colaboradores y para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Jesús solicita el crédito para comprar abonos y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, pues las inclemencias del clima y la roya han causado daños a los palos de café y requiere controlar la situación para no perder la cosecha. De esta manera, Jesús busca opciones que le permitan seguir adelante para poder cumplir el sueño de brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y una excelente educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jesús, 43, is married and father of three children.  He learned to work in the fields when very young; he’s always lived there thanks to his parents’ teaching and inheritance.  He currently works growing coffee on the farm where he lives.  He has 30,000 coffee plants planted there that he cares for with dedication, patience and effort.  He usually works alone but when it’s harvest time he hires several people to help him with this chore.  He then sells his coffee and that’s how he earns income to pay his workers and to provide sustenance at home.

Jesús is requesting the loan to buy manure and fertilizer for his crop because the bad weather and “La Roya” [fungus] have damaged the coffee plants and he needs to control the situation in order not to lose the harvest.  In this way, Jesús seeks options that will allow him to continue forward and to be able to reach his dream of providing the best well-being for his family and an excellent education for his children.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es: Manuel es un hombre de 39 años de edad, es soltero y aún no tiene hijos. Desde muy joven comenzó a realizar las labores del campo, cuando se iba a recolectar café con su padre y sus tíos; gracias a eso, él actualmente se dedica a cultivar café, fríjol, maíz y hortalizas en un pequeño lote que su padre le dejó como herencia cuando falleció, al vender la cosecha de sus productos obtiene ingresos para el sustento diario. Manuel es un hombre con empuje, paciente y trabajador, a pesar de las dificultades que se le han presentado en el transcurso de la vida, él siempre busca opciones que le permitan seguir adelante, por esto se motivó a solicitar el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, fungicidas) con el fin de cuidar sus cultivos para cosechar productos de excelente calidad y poderlos vender más fácil en el mercado, así logrará tener ingresos y seguir avanzando en busca del cumplimiento de sus sueños, especialmente mejorar su calidad de vida para tener la oportunidad de conformar una familia y tener hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel, 39, is single and has no children yet.  From a very young age he started to work in the fields helping his father and uncles pick coffee.  Thanks to this, he now works growing coffee, beans, corn and vegetables on a small lot he inherited from his father when he died.  When he sells his crops he earns income for daily sustenance.

Manuel is a man with drive; he’s patient and hardworking.  Despite the difficulties that have arisen in his life he always seeks options that will allow him to continue forward.  This is what motivated him to request a loan to buy agricultural supplies (manure, fertilizer, pesticide, fungicide) to provide crop care so he can produce excellent quality products to sell more easily in the market thus earning income and continue advancing toward reaching his dreams, especially to improve his quality of life and to have the opportunity of forming a family and having children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Damas De Agua Fría  (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del cantón Santa Ana, lugar conocido por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son un gran atractivo turístico del cantón y la provincia misma, allí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Damas de Agua Fría

Este es un grupo formado por 10 mujeres y 1 hombre que desde hace algún tiempo vienen recibiendo la ayuda que les brindan los créditos con los cuales pueden salir adelante. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Miriam, tiene 33  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 13 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y en escuela. El marido trabaja en una granja avícola.
 
Doña Miriam es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ayudarle a su marido a solventar  los gastos del hogar, para ganar sus ingresos ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales así como también zapatos por catálogos, tiene sus clientes que siempre le encargan sus productos sobretodo los productos naturales ya que son muy buenos, lleva 1 año con este negocio el mismo que empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que gracias a sus ganancias ella le paga ciertas cosas de los estudios de sus hijas.

Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales y zapatos por catálogos ya que tiene varios encargos por entregar, lleva un año en el Banco Comunal y le gusta ya que gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es darles la mejor educación a sus hijas. 

Las fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
In Ayacucho Parish in Santa Ana Canton, a place noted for its beautiful fresh water resorts that are a great tourist attraction in the canton and province, the “Damas de Agua Fría” (Ladies of Agua Fría) communal bank  meets every fifteen days.  This is a group consisting of 10 women and one man who have been getting support from loans that help them continue moving forward for some time now

One of the members of this group is Miriam, 33.  She’s married and has two daughters who are 13 and 10 years of age and attend secondary and primary school.  Her husband works on a chicken farm.

Miriam’s a woman who likes to manage on her own and help her husband cover household expenses.  To earn her own income she sells natural products as well as shoes via catalog.  She has customers that always order from her, especially the natural products because they are very good.  She’s been in this business for a year having started it with the very first loan she got from the bank for which she’s very grateful because thanks to her profits she pays for certain things related to her daughters’ schooling.
 
This loan will be used to buy natural products and shoes by catalog since she already has several pending orders to fill.  She’s been in the communal bank for a year and likes it because she started her business thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to provide the best education for her daughters.

The small photos are of two members who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy natural products and shoes.

loans.name: Fasso Yiriwa 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Fasso Yiriwa 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Tikindola. dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits equipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, de payer la main d’œuvre pour le sarclage des champs, les membres du groupe  intègrent  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1èr  cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Ya (deuxième femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo,) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de Tikindola.Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour s’acheter des  semences, des intrants agricoles à Ségou, des petits équipements chez les forgerons locaux, payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten women of "Fasso Yiriwa 1" are all married in traditional families, and they average 42 years of age and three children each, all living in the village of Tikindola, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through their rainy season farm work and through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They grow peanuts, millet, and rice. 

With the goal of paying for sundry equipment, labor, and weeding and stocking up on farm inputs, the group joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first farm loan cycle. 

Ms. Ya (sitting second from the left in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Tikindola. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds and farm inputs in Ségou and sundry equipment from local blacksmiths, as well as to pay young people to do weeding. 

At the end of the rainy season, the produce is sold in cash to repay the loan and then to have the income to take care of the children with some left for the family.

loans.use: to pay for sundry equipment, seeds, farm inputs, labor, and weeding.

loans.name: Fasso Yiriwa 2 Group

Ms. Sitan (sitting first from the right in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Tikindola. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds and farm inputs in Ségou and sundry equipment from local blacksmiths, as well as to pay young people to do weeding.

loans.name: Essoyomewe

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 28ans, Essoyomewe est marié à une revendeuse et ils ont 01 enfant de 03ans en charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il a démarré la vente des portables et de ses accessoires à domicile depuis 2006. Dans l’intention d’agrandir et d’ouvrir d’autres ateliers, il demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des portables. Le profit tiré lui permettra d’atteindre ses objectifs : celui d’étendre son activité et de parvenir aux moindres besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Essoyomewe, age 28, is married to a reseller. They have a 3-year-old dependent child. To support his family, he started to sell mobile phone and accessories from his home in 2006. 

He is seeking his first loan from WAGES to stock up on mobile phones in an effort to expand his activity and open more store locations. The profits earned with the help of this loan will allow him to achieve his goals of business expansion and providing for his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Narcisa De Las Mercedes

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradable.

En este lugar vive señora Narcisa, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijas los cuales ya son mayores de edad y están casadas,  con ella viven tres nietos de 21, 18 y 14 los mismos que estudian en universidad y colegio. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Doña Narcisa es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Entre lo que más vende están los cosméticos, cremas, perfumes y ropa de damas, ella empezó este negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco con el cual ella sale adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de mujer. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos y por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. 

Su sueño es arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The members of the “Juntas Creceremos” (We Will Grow Together) communal bank meet every fifteen days in the sector known as Cadí in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the “City of Royal Tamarinds.”

Narcisa, 54, lives here.  She’s married and has five daughters who are all married adults now.  Three grandchildren who are 21, 18 and 14 and who attend university and secondary school live with her.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Narcisa’s a housewife who in order to earn her own resources works selling clothes by catalog and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She works three days a week and sells on credit collecting weekly or biweekly according to customers’ wishes.  Among what she sells the most are the cosmetics, creams, perfume and women’s clothes.  She started this business with the first loan she got from the communal bank which helps her get ahead.

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and women’s clothes.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and likes it because interest is very low and because the terms for getting loans are easy.  Her dream is to make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and women's clothing.

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes de Benkadi 1 sont toutes mariées dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Sokolobala, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Ms. Rokia (sitting second from the right in the photo) is a great leader of rainy season farm work in the village of Sokolobala. She intends to use her loan to purchase seeds and farm inputs in Ségou, and sundry equipment, as well as to pay young people to do weeding.

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2012, Rafiatou demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Elle voudrait avec le profit, ouvrir une boutique car elle le fait de façon ambulante et fonder une famille financièrement stable. Elle est âgée de 24ans.
texts.en: Rafiatou, age 24, has been an itinerant vendor of pagnes since 2012. She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to stock up on merchandise. She would like to use her profits to open a store and to start a family that could be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for sale.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul, a 38-year-old married father from Talibon, Bohol, has two children ages one and seven years. Engaged in crab fishing to earn a living for five years now, he is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing materials including crab nets to increase his catch as well as his sales in the community.

In the future, Raul would like to expand his fishing to better provide his family with proper nutrition and finance his children's education.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials including crab nets

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a responsible housewife. A 33-year-old mother of two children, she and her husband aim to improve their family's living standard in order to educate their children. Maribel cooks and sells meals and snacks in their community to generate income.

Maribel wants to expand the variety of meals she sells and so is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy meat, vegetables, chicken, bananas and other ingredients. She is hoping that through this loan, her simple business will be improved.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, chicken, bananas and other ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Jesuwame 8 Group

texts.fr: JESUWAME 8 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres ont un lien de parenté. La représentante du groupe,  (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 37 ans et vit au Bénin. Modukpè Pauline est mariée à un certain Félix et est mère de trois enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés, mais tous sont à la charge du couple. Modukpè Pauline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Modukpè Pauline a très peu fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs dix huit ans que Modukpè Pauline fait le commerce des produits de quincaillerie (peinture, colle, pointe, etc.) au Bénin. Modukpè Pauline achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C'est la première fois que Modukpè Pauline bénéficie de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa cliente, Modukpè Pauline ambitionne augmenter son fonds de roulement et rehausser le niveau de son activité, afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Modukpè Pauline envisage acheter une parcelle à l'avenir.
texts.en:
The group JESUWAME 8 consists of three people who are related. The group’s representative is Modukpè Pauline, age 37, whose hand is raised in the photo. She lives in Bénin and is married to a man named Félix. They have three dependent children, some of whom go to school. Modukpè Pauline lives with her husband and their children. 

Modukpè Pauline received minimal schooling. She started to sell hardware supplies (paint, glue, nails, etc.) in Bénin about 18 years ago. She buys her stock at a market in Bénin. 

This is her first loan cycle with ALIDé. With customer demand steadily increasing, Modukpè Pauline wants to bolster her working capital and strengthen her activity to achieve customer satisfaction. In the long term, she would like to buy some land.

loans.use: to buy hardware merchandise such as paint, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Hidelia

texts.en: Hidelia has a kiosk to generate income for her family. Now requesting her first loan of $600.00, she will buy some additional store supplies such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotion and biscuits.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
From the town of Alicia, Mary Ann, 37 years old, is single and has been managing her own general store for more than a year, earning approximately PHP 500 each week. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads and condiments to sell.

Mary Ann believes that patience and hard work in managing her business will lead to an improved standard of living. She hopes that lenders will grant her this loan so that she can make her store more productive.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted breads and condiments to sell

loans.name: Jessica Mariana

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradable.

Aquí vive la señora Jessica,  tiene 33 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 14 y 5 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela.  Su marido es comerciante.

Doña Jessica junto al esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos se desplazan hasta el cantón Santa Ana y 24 de Mayo los sábados y domingos ya que en estos días son las ferias y es cuando más personas salen a realizar sus compras, ellos venden arroz, azúcar, manteca, detergentes, especias, entre otros víveres de consumo masivo, en estos días instalan un pequeño local en la calle, lugar donde les permiten trabajar y donde muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, allí trabajan todo el día aunque ellos también los otros días venden en su casa a los vecinos de la localidad. Tienen este negocio más de 13 años el cual les permite salir adelante honradamente.

Este crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar, manteca, detergentes y todo tipo de víveres que ellos venden. Está en el Banco Comunal 6 años  y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su negocio. 

Sus sueños son tener un camión y una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
Members of the communal bank "Juntas Creceremos" (We Will Grow Together) meet every 2 weeks in the region known as "El Cadí."  It is within the city of Portoviejo, the capital of the Manabí province.  For many years it has been known as the city of the royal tamarinds and is a very beautiful place whose citizens are very friendly.

This is where Jessica lives.  She is 33 years old and lives in a free union, within which she has two children.  They are 14 and 15 years old and are both studying in school.  Her partner works as an entrepreneur.

Jessica and her husband work in sales.  They travel to the Santa Ana and 24 de Mayo cantons (regions) on Saturdays and Sundays, since these are market days and is when most people are out to do their shopping.  They sell rice, sugar, lard, detergent, spices, and other goods in bulk.  On these days, they set up a small shop on the street in an area that allows them to work and where many salespeople sell their products.  They work there all day, even though they also sell to their neighbors during the rest of the week.  They have had this business for more than 13 years and it allows them to make an honest living.

This loan is to buy rice, sugar, lard, detergent, and the other kinds of goods that they sell.  They have been part of a communal bank for 6 years and they like it because they are able to fund their business thanks to the loans they receive.

Their dreams are to have a truck and a well-stocked store.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, lard, detergent, and other supplies.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena con 66 años de edad, vive con su esposo y es madre de 2 hijos. Siempre ha vivido  en el campo, donde ha aprendido todas las labores agropecuarias y actualmente, en compañía de su esposo tiene cultivos de varios productos en la finca donde reside, y para obtener los ingresos para su hogar, ella vende los productos que cosechan. La titular es una persona trabajadora, dedicada y luchadora, a pesar de las dificultades económicas, ella siempre busca opciones que le permitan avanzar, por eso se motiva para solicitar el crédito, pues desea invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes) y también comprará 2 terneras de levante, para complementar su actividad agrícola con la ganadería, de esta forma se abrirá más oportunidades para obtener los recursos y seguir aportando con el sustento de su hogar, además sueña con ampliar sus cultivos y aumentar las cabezas de ganado, ya que cuenta con suficiente terreno para tenerlo. Así, Magdalena podrá ir mejorando el bienestar y la calidad de vida de toda la familia.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 66 years old, lives with her husband, and is the mother of 2 children.  She has always lived in the country, where she has learned all the farming disciplines.  Together with her husband, she currently has various kinds of crops on the farm where she lives.  To obtain income for her home, she sells the products that they harvest.  

She is described as being a hardworking, dedicated, and hardworking person.  In spite of financial difficulties, she has always sought ways that allow her to advance.  For this reason, she is inspired to ask for this loan, which she wants to use to buy farming supplies (manure, pesticide, and fertilizer).  In addition, she will buy 2 calves and complement their farming activities with raising cows.

In this way, more opportunities will be opened for her to obtain income and continue providing for her home.  In addition, she dreams to expand her crops and increase her head of cattle, since she has plenty of land to do so.  In this way, Magdalena will be able to improve the well-being and quality of life of her entire family.

loans.use: buy farming supplies (manure, pesticide, and fertilizer) and 2 calves.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is very thankful for the years of help that she is receiving from Kiva and CCT. Her variety store is continuously growing and expanding as she increases her loan. As of now, she and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in more profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercedita hopes that her product inventory will continue to increase, and she dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her store

loans.name: Lorena Floridalba

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradable.

En este lugar vive la señorita Lorena,  tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de los padres.

Ella es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que a base de su esfuerzo quiere salir adelante, trabaja en un centro comercial en la ciudad de Portoviejo, pero además de esto ella también  se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta en sus ratos libres, deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días.  Lleva en este negocio 2 años el mismo que empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que con sus ganancias ella ayuda a sus padres y está adquiriendo artefactos para cuando le toque formar su hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar camisas, pantalones, blusas, ropa de niños, entre otras prendas. Lleva cuatro años en el Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the area known as Cadi, in Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the city of Reales Tamarindos, the members of the communal bank Juntas Creceremos meet every fortnight. It is a very beautiful place and the people are very nice.

Lorena lives in this place. She is 22 years old, single and lives with her parents.

She is a very hard working young woman, who wants to succeed through her effort. She works at a shopping centre in the city of Portoviejo and she also sells all types of clothing. She does door to door sales in her spare time, sells on credit and charges every eight days.

She has been doing this for two years and it began with one of the loans received from the bank. She is very thankful for it, since she helps her parents with her earnings and is buying things for when she builds her own home.

This loan will be used to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, children's clothing and other items. She has been with the communal bank for four years and she enjoys the benefits provided by the institution.

Lorena's dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, children's clothing and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. 

She feels better that she applied for her first loan $1,000;  she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as vegetables. 

She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) because it offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Ashley

texts.en:
“As a small business owner, you have not only an obligation to lead in your field, but an obligation to your community as well,” shares Ashley.  “It is your community that supports your business, and it is only fair that you reciprocate.” This is the philosophy that guides all aspects of Ashley’s business, Mind Body Pilates and Wellness.  Ashley understands the importance of one-on-one support with her clients, and this mindset has garnered their appreciation.

Previously a personal trainer, as well as the operator of a fine art gallery, Ashley says that her last seven years as a pilates instructor are a stark contrast from her previous endeavors. “I knew I could run an art gallery, but my heart wasn't in it … now it’s about my clients, not myself,” she shares. Ashley believes that her studio is not just a place for her customers to work out, but a place to explore the body, both mentally as well as physically.

Although she has only moved into her studio recently, she is excited by the demand she has seen for her instruction thus far. Mind Body Pilates and Wellness caters primarily to senior citizens, and until recently, her business has relied solely on word of mouth. She hopes that the use of social media marketing, as well as numerous positive reviews online, will continue to fuel her growth.

Being the sole proprietor of a pilates studio open seven days a week is challenging, but Ashley feels that it is the least she can do. “I am open in the future to hiring employees as my client base increases, but for now, I prefer to be the face of the business.” 

Ashley plans to use her $7,800 Kiva loan to purchase additional pilates equipment to increase her client capacity and grow her business. If growth continues to increase, she dreams of someday increasing the size of her studio and sharing the health benefits of this high-intensity workout with even more people.

loans.use: to purchase additional pilates equipment to increase her client capacity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the physical improvement of her stall, and also to buy vegetables, meat and other raw ingredients for cooking foods.

loans.name: Marce

texts.en:
Marce is a 33-year-old lady and is married to Nitanel, a 35-year-old man. They’re blessed with two children: Vicky, 12, first class of junior high school, and Aurel, 4. 

Marce has been running a kiosk business for almost two months. She sells basic needs, such as cooking oil, coffee, salt, cereal and also vegetables. The income that she earns from the business enables her to help her husband in covering her family's daily needs. 

Currently Marce dreams of improving her business by adding more stock at her kiosk, but she does not have the capital to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. This loan will be spent on more kiosk stock, such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks. 

Marce is expecting that her business will get better through the loan provided by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase more kiosk stock, such as sugar, rice, biscuits, cigarettes and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is using her loans on her business, hence the result is gratifying. Her business is flourishing and her family's needs are met. She is very thankful and she is happy for the changes in her life. Aside from her direct-selling business, she also sells doormats. She continues to work, together with her husband, to provide for their family.

Jolly would like to apply for another loan, in the amount of PHP 30,000 to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on-hand, the better. More items to sell should result in greater profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jolly dreams to continuously expand her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. These fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to increase her product inventory.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
This is Tessie. She previously obtained a 40,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy ready-to-wear clothing (called "RTW" in the Philippines), to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this one in the amount of 55,000 PHP. She will use the new loan to again buy RTW merchandise, like ladies' wear, to expand her product inventory. The more items she has on display, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness, and thankfulness in her heart.

Tessie hopes to have a department store someday, and dreams of always having good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear merchandise, like ladies' clothing, to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 56 years old, and married to Basilio. She and her husband work hand-in-hand, cultivating rice for their livelihood. She is from the village of Aurora, Alicia, and has been engaged in rice production for almost 10 years. She earned PHP 25,000 from her last crop.

She is again requesting a loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for the maintenance of her rice production business. Through farming, Mercedita hopes to give her children a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her rice production business

loans.name: Ul

texts.en:
Ul, aged 40, is a hardworking woman. She has been involved in the farming business for years, and this has been the family’s main source of income. Ul grows rice and corn on her own farmland, located in a fertile land area in Kompong Cham province. Ul is able to generate KHR 20,000 per day, which she uses to provide for the basic needs of her family. 

Ul is now requesting a loan of KHR 1,000,000. She will use the loan to pay for labor to prepare the land, and seeds for sowing corn. She knows that the loan will be a big help, not only for the growth of her business, but also for the entire family. In years to come, she aims to expand growing rice and corn, in order to gather good harvests in each season.

loans.use: to pay for labor to prepare the land, and seeds for sowing corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: use in buying hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise in her pigpen.

loans.name: Yergly Johan

texts.es: Johan a sus 21 años de edad ya es padre de un hijo de 1 año y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde que era niño, él comenzó a aprender las labores del campo y sobre los cultivos de café, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y sus tíos, pero, por una enfermedad, su padre no pudo continuar cuidando su negocio, es por ello que desde hace 12 años Johan se dedica a cuidar los cultivos de café que tiene en la finca donde vive y ahora cuenta con 2000 palos del grano que son de su propiedad. Cuando se va a realizar la cosecha, contrata varias personas para que lo apoyen con esta labor, para luego ser vendida y así consigue el sustento para su familia. Johan es un hombre enérgico, activo, dedicado y luchador, siempre está en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, es por eso que solicita su primer crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para los cultivos de café y para pagar la nómina de las personas que le colaboran en la cosecha, con esto podrá proteger sus cultivos de la roya que es la principal amenaza de su negocio y podrá seguir contando con el personal para nuevas cosechas. Con esto, logrará fortalecer sus cultivos y sacar una cosecha de muy buena calidad que pueda ser vendida a un mayor precio y así tendrá más oportunidades de aumentar sus ingresos para comprar su casa propia en un corto plazo y brindarle una excelente educación y bienestar a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Johan is 21 years old and already has a 1 year old son.  He lives in a free union with his partner.  When he was a child, he started learning how to work the fields and how to grow coffee thanks to the teachings of his father and aunts and uncles.  Due to illness, his father couldn't continue to maintain his business.  For this reason, Johan has been growing coffee on the farm where he lives since he was 12 years old.  He currently has 2,000 coffee trees.  When it's time to harvest, he hires various people to help him with the work.  Later, he sells his harvest and in this way obtains income for his family.

Johan is an energetic, active, dedicated, and hardworking man.  He is always looking for ways to help him progress.  This is why he is asking for his first loan; so he can pay those that he hires to help him with the harvest.  This will allow him to protect his crop form rust fungus, which is the main threat to his business.  He will also continue to hire workers for his new harvests.  He will be able to strengthen his crops and obtain a good quality harvest which can be sold for a high price.  In this way, he will have more opportunities to increase his income, buy his own house as soon as possible and offer his young son an excellent education and quality of life.

loans.use: buy manure and fertilizer for his coffee crop and pay his workers.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es: Gustavo es un hombre de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa y con sus dos hijos de 1 y 7 años. Desde hace 25 años comenzó a realizar las labores del campo, actividad que conoció gracias a su padre y que hoy le brinda los ingresos para el sustento diario de su familia. Actualmente tiene cultivos de fríjol, arveja y tomate de árbol en la finca donde reside y para obtener ingresos, él vende las cosechas en la plaza del pueblo. Gustavo, es un señor trabajador, activo y dedicado, siempre está en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por esa razón solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas fungicidas) para continuar con el cuidado de sus cultivos y así poder cosechar unos frutos de excelente calidad, para aumentar los ingresos por las ventas de los productos. Todo esto, le ayudará a Gustavo a cumplir uno de sus principales sueños, que es ampliar sus cultivos para poder generar mayores ingresos que le brinden una estabilidad económica, bienestar y calidad de vida a su familia y una excelente educación a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en: Gustavo is a 38-year old man.  He lives with his wife and their two children, who are 1- and 7-years old respectively.  Gustavo started doing agricultural work 25 years ago, which he learned thanks to his father.  Today, the work provides his family's income.  Currently, Gustavo has bean, pea and tree tomato plants on the farm where he lives.  To earn an income, he sells his harvest in the town center.  Gustavo is a hard-working, active and dedicated man.  He is constantly looking for opportunities that will allow him to get ahead.  That is why he is requesting a loan- to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizers, pesticides and fungicides).  With these supplies, he will be able to continue caring for his crop and harvest excellent quality produce, which will increase his sales and his income.  All of this will help Gustavo to meet one of his main goals, which is to expand his crop in order to generate more income.  This would give him more stable finances and provide his family with greater well-being and a better quality of life.  It would also provide an excellent education for his young children.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (compost, fertilizer, pesticides, fungicides).

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
This is Avelina, 54, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Pedro, and they have children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She works hard, to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Avelina operates the buy-and-sell business of her family. What she does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and resells the items with a little profit. Her products include shirts for men and women. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, weekly.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear clothing items, like shirts for men and women.

Avelina dreams of expanding her business and hopes that her whole family will always be healthy. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothing items, like shirts for men and women, to resell to customers

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Despite the hardship of living, Genoveva and her husband are still doing their best and are never disgusted with the kind of life their family was into. Working hand-in-hand towards the improvement of their living status is their way of battling against life's difficulties to give their family a better living, especially their children, by fulfilling their education. 

Genoveva is 41 years old and has three school-age children. She manages a hog-raising business, while her husband is into upland farming. To improve her business, Genoveva is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise, so that her piggery will be more progressive. 

Optimistically, Genoveva will able to improve her business through hard work, strong determination, and financial support from the lenders, of course. She hopes that they will give her a chance.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
This is Merlinda, 49, a resident of Batasan, Quezon CIty, Philippines. She is married to Samuel, a construction worker, and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Merlinda operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Merlinda's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Merlinda dreams of business expansion and hopes to be successful in life and have a deeper relationship with God. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is engaged in a hog-raising business and her husband operates their motorcycle as a transport business in their village to also generate a daily income. They live happily in a rural community with their four children. Two of them are still studying and they want them to earn a degree someday thus they are working hard to support them in their studies. 

For this reason, Regina is requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy hog feed, vaccines and piglets to raise in her piggery. She hopes that she will be given a chance of borrowing money to further maintain or eventually improve her livestock raising business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccines and piglets to raise in her piggery business.

loans.name: Thinh's Group

texts.en:
Thinh is aged 55 years and married. She resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, in Battambang province. She has eight children. To support the family, she and her husband have been engaged in pig raising for fifteen years. The current business earns her family about 30,000 KHR per day, which she uses to meet her family’s needs.

Thinh has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles already. She successfully used the profits of her previous loans to better support her family, supplying them sufficient food. Now she and her group members are applying for a new loan. As the leader, Thinh is going to use her portion of the loan to buy more pigs, and pig feed for nourishing them. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: To buy more pigs, and pig feed for nourishing them

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas , está en su ciclo  5° ciclo del programa de comité, donde cada una se está esforzando al máximo por ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gloria  quien está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y se encuentra en el nivel 2, lo que quiere decir que tiene ingresos medios.  Ella vende sábanas, colchas fundas y venta de productos argentinos que trae ya que son más baratos y de mejor calidad. Ella es una persona con muchas ansias de crecer y de salir adelante.
La Sra. Gloria solicita  este crédito para la compra de sábanas, colchas fundas, etc, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas e ir mejorando día a día sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank called "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United) is in its 5th cycle with the committee's program.  Each of them contributes as much as they can to the group's effort toward improving their lives and that of their families. 
One of the members is Sra. Gloria.  She is doing the poverty elimination survey and is at Level 2, which means that she has a mid-level income.  Sra. Gloria sells sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases and Argentinian products, which are cheaper and higher quality, that she brings in.  Sra. Gloria is a person who is anxious to grow and get ahead. 
She is requesting the loan to purchase sheets, bedspreads, pillowcases etc. which will help her to continue with her sales and improve her income a little every day.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, bedspreads, pillow cases etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 сыновей. Она более 10 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Халима шьёт разнообразные фасоны женских одежд. Она имеет большой опыт и знает все тонкости своего бизнеса. Она заботится о своих детях и всегда думает об их образование. Халима считает, что образование стоит выше всего. Один из ее сыновей учится в гимназии, который находится в другом городе их области. Халима должна оплатить за учебный договор гимназии, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты обучения сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Halima is a hardworking woman.  She is 40 years old, married and has five sons.  For more than 10 years she has offered services as a seamstress.  She sews a variety of women's clothing styles.  She has much experience in this arena and knows all the ins and outs of the business.  She takes care of her children and always thinks about their education.  Halima believes education should be valued above all else.  One of her sons studies at a high school in a different city.  Halima must pay his tuition but she doesn't have enough money.  She is asking for a loan to pay for her son's studies.  She awaits your kindness and relies on your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for her son’s education at school

loans.name: Kholidin

texts.ru: Холидин заботливый муж и отец пятерых детей, проживающий в деревне района Шахритус. Ему 52 года. У него трое дочерей и двое сыновей. Его сыновья уже женаты и имеют по одному ребенку. Все они живут вместе в доме отца. Старший сын Холидина работает мигрантом в России, одна дочь занимается дома шитьем, а две невестки работают учительницами в сельской школе. Сам Холидин вместе со вторым сыном занимается сельским хозяйством. У них имеется 0,5 га земельного участка для посева сельскохозяйственной культуры, а также имеется пастбище размером о,3 га. В домашнем хозяйстве Холидина, как и у многих жителей села есть скот, молоко и мясо которого используется для нужды семьи. Сейчас Холидин намерен начать животноводческий бизнес. Он хочет заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он накопил сбережение в размере 960 TJS и обратился за кредитом. Холидин хочет купить двух голов крупно-рогатого скота и начать свой семейный животноводческий бизнес.
texts.en: Kholidin is a caring husband and father to five children.  He lives in the Shahituz region of Tajikistan.  He is 52 years old.  He has three daughters and two sons.  His sons area already married and each have one child.  They all live together in one home.  Kholidin's oldest son is a migrant worker in Russia, one daughter works as a seamstress out of the home, and two daughters-in-law work as teachers at a rural school.  He himself works with his second son in agriculture.  He has half a hectare of land were he grows crops.  He has an addition third of a hectare of pasture.  Kholidin, like most people in the country, has cows from which he receives milk and meat for his family.  Now he wants to start a new livestock business.  He wants to sell cattle.  He has 960 TJS in savings and is now taking out a loan.  Kholidin wants to buy two head of cattle to start this new, family endeavor.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle to start a family livestock business

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao is 53 years old, married and has five children. They live in Anglong  Snouk village, Kompong Cham where most of the residents are dedicated to farming as their main source of income. Kao has been working in this business for many years, and the experience she has gained from it has enabled her to further develop her production.

To make her plans become a reality, she would like to borrow KHR 2,000,000, which will be used to pay for the labor cost for preparing the land and buy fertilizers and seedlings for growing cassava. ​​​​In the future, she hopes to become a successful entrepreneur and keep saving funds for future family emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost for preparing the land and buy fertilizers and seedlings for growing cassava.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a mat weaver from the town of CPG, Bohol. Rosalie is a married woman and has five young children. She has been in the business for more than 10 years now. 

Rosalie is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like 'romblon', dye, and straw. With this, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving like 'romblon', dye, and straw

loans.name: Rose Shely

texts.en:
Rose Shely is a 27-year-old hard-working businesswoman. She is recognized as a paint dealer in the town of Alicia; she has been in business for more than a year. She earns a net income of PHP 7,000 each week, and she uses it to provide some of their needs and bank savings; most of it was rolled into the business. 

Rose Shely wanted to have stock of goods to sell in her business stall, thus is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more paint, paint brushes, and  hardware products. A part of it will be used in the physical improvement of her current business stall. 

She hopes that in every step in managing the business, she will able to succeed with every offered opportunity. Furthermore, she  is looking forward to the expansion of her business. Rose Shely is happy that somehow, she can then provide employment to others in her very simple way.

loans.use: to buy more paint, paint brushes and hardware products

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn, 48 years of age, is married to a bus driver and they are blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a restaurant near the school campus for almost 4 years, and with this business she's earning a net income of about Php 2,000. Due to insufficient funds she decided to request a loan amounting to Php 30,000 to purchase raw meat, food ingredients and other materials needed in her restaurant. She's hoping that her business will improve and be more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase raw meat, food ingredients and other materials needed in her restaurant.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
This is Romeo, 33, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. He is married to Joy, a housewife and mother of his children. Together they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Romeo operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries, factories and others of the like. Romeo's  regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors.

Romeo dreams of expanding his business and hopes to have a house renovation. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.en:
Fortunato is a 22-year-old student living in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines with his family. His parents provide the needs of the family.  Fortunato also works at a part-time job in a private company to earn a living.
