Despite hardship experiences, he has never given up but continues his dream of finishing his studies. 

He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy school supplies and study materials. 

He hopes to have better living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and study materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to update lawn care equipment and offer more servivces.

loans.name: Sn

texts.en:
Sn is shown in the photo in front of her own house in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is 48 years old and a widowed mother of a child. To make a living, she has been farming for more than 20 years, and it has become the sole source of her family’s income. She manages to cover some of the household expenses and keep some savings for the future growth of her farming business.

She is requesting a loan amounting to KHR 2,000,000 to buy some needed supplies like seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the labor cost of plowing her paddy fields. She hopes to have better results from this harvest, and thereby increase her annual income.

loans.use: to buy some needed supplies like seeds and fertilizers, and to pay the labor cost of plowing her paddy fields.

loans.name: Lord David

texts.en:
Lord David is a long way from his hometown of Nigeria.  He moved to the United States for a better life and has continued to do just that.

Lord David operates Dan & Bishop, a tire shop in Houston, Texas.  He sells, repairs, ships tires overseas, and offers a full tire shop for customers.  Since December 2010, Lord David has been in business and continues to grow.  One day, a friend informed Lord David about the nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas Inc.  
 
After applying for a microloan, Lord David received approval for $5,450 Promise Loan for his business.  He used the Accion loan to pay for a tire repair machines, payroll operations for his four employees, and purchasing additional tire products for the store.  

“My business would not have grown without the Accion loan,” said Lord David when he was asked how the loan helped his business.  Currently, he continues to operate his business and look for opportunity to expand, and he plans to hire two more full-time employees in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repair, payroll and purchase tire products

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 32 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells a variety of fresh vegetables in his shop after purchasing them from the field. Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. 

Therefore his wife Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase vegetables from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables from the field to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fruits like oranges, bananas, etc

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en:
After successfully repaying the previous loan, Ni Ketut and the Putri Mandiri group decided to continue the loan with each getting 1,5M IDR. With full support from her husband, because it was considered beneficial to the family economy, Ni Ketut plans to use this loan to buy 4 piglets. With her own money, she will purchase pig feed for 6 months.

Ni Ketut is hoping to gain more profit than with the previous loan. The loans help Ni Ketut to develop the business, and of course to increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy 4 piglets.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
This is Elenita, 54, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Enrique and a mother to her children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.
                           
Elenita operates a buy-and-sell business. What she does is buy various spices and then pack them in smaller, plastic packets. She uses her bicycle in selling her products.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every day.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of various spices, which she will resell in her business. Elenita hopes to expand her business and dreams of helping other people. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work. This is where she grows in her relationship with God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of various spices, which she will resell in her business.

loans.name: Mehr

texts.en:
Mehr is a 45-year-old woman. She is providing tailoring services in her community to help her husband in generating income, as his net income is insufficient to meet the household needs. He owns a fruit shop in the market. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. 

Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to their expenses he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife Mehr has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

In the future, her husband wants to grow his business. Mehr is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the field to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a thirty-seven-year-old single woman, a mother of three children. She has a 'matatu' transport business and has been doing this for one year now. She gets a monthly income of seventy thousand shillings.

This will be Lucy's first loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy four new tyres for the 'matatu'. In future she wants to educate and feed her children well.

loans.use: To purchase new tyres for the 'matatu' (van used for public transport)

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Âgé de 51ans, Mr Kodjo vit avec sa femme et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Seul le dernier de 16ans est scolarisé. Après son apprentissage en couture, il a ouvert son atelier en 2011 avec 04 apprentis en charge. Il coud, fait broder les habits et revend des produits de mercerie. Avec son second crédit sollicité à WAGES, il va s'approvisionner en produit de mercerie. il espère à l'avenir créer d'autres points de vente et être en mesure de subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Aged 51, Mr. Kodjo lives with his wife and their three children in Lomé. Only the youngest, aged 16, is still enrolled in school. 

After his apprenticeship in sewing, Kodjo opened his workshop in 2011, supervising four apprentices. He sews, embroiders clothing, and sells sewing notions. With his second loan requested from WAGES, he is going to stock up on sewing notions. He hopes in future to create other sales venues so that he can support his family appropriately.

loans.use: to buy sewing notions.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 38-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. She owns a small general store in which she offers  biscuits, bubbles and chocolates to the kids of her hometown. She has successfully built her business with the support of BRAC Pakistan. She is in her 5th loan cycle. 

Previously, she took a loan to purchase various goods for her general store that allowed her to fulfill the clients' demands more professionally and efficiently, and she earned a reasonable amount of profit to cover her household expenses. Currently, most of the inventories have been sold out due to a lot of demand from her customers, but she does not have sufficient capital to buy new inventory.

Musarat applied for a new loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase a stock of biscuits, bubbles, chocolates and further grains, rice and cleaning products, including soaps and shampoos. It will help her to meet the demands of her customers without failure. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, bubbles and chocolates to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
From the village of Angadanan, Jocelyn, 41 years old and married, has operated her retail store business for four years. She is doing her best to lift her family out of poverty with the business and is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase an additional stock of goods including canned goods, noodles, eggs, curls, biscuits and soft drinks.

Jocelyn believes that her patience and hard work will help her achieve her goals in life and improve her family's standard of living someday.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, curls, biscuits and soft drinks

loans.name: Olouwacheyi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OLOUWACHEYI est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui font des tontines ensemble. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Moussilatou Adjokè, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 49 ans. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Moussilatou Adjokè est veuve et mère de deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à sa charge. Moussilatou Adjokè vit seule avec ses enfants. Moussilatou Adjokè a très peu fréquenté l'école. Moussilatou Adjokè assure seule les charges du ménage. Pour ce faire, Moussilatou Adjokè vend des mèches depuis huit ans dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Moussilatou Adjokè vend aussi des bijoux. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Moussilatou Adjokè ensemble avec les membres du groupe OLOUWACHEYI désire obtenir un deuxième financement. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group OLOUWACHEYI is composed of three persons, who are friends participating in the same tontine together. The group's representative, Moussilatou Adjokè, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 49 years old. This is the second time this group has requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of boosting their businesses. Moussilatou Adjokè is a widow and mother of two children, of whom one is in school, and both are in her care. She lives alone with her children. 

Moussilatou Adjokè has had very little schooling. She is alone in ensuring that the household expenses are covered. To do so, she has been selling hair extensions for eight years in her region. Concurrent to this business, she also sells jewelry.

With the goal of bolstering her business and responding better to the demands of her customer, Moussilatou Adjokè together with the other members of the group OLOUWACHEYI would like to obtain a second loan. The last loan was indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and jewelry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two sewing machines (one serger and one coverstitch machine).

loans.name: Sonagnon 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SONAGNON 3 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui vivent dans le même quartier.  C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Fali est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Fali est veuve avec huit enfants. Aucun de ces enfants n'est scolarisés et quatre sont encore à sa charge . Fali vit seule avec ses enfants. Fali n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Les charges du ménages sont assurées par elle. Afin de répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Fali vend des boules d'akassa (pâte fait à base de farine de maïs) à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'années. De façon secondaire, Fali vend du maïs et du haricot. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Fali sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe SONAGNON 3, un cinquième crédit. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group " SONAGNON 3" is composed of three persons, who are friends living in the same district. This is the fifth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their businesses. The group's representative, Fali, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is a widow with eight children. None of these children are in school, and four of them are still in her care. She lives alone with her children. 

Fali did not go to school. She is alone in ensuring that the household expenses are covered. To meet the needs of her family, she has been selling 'boules d'akassa' (made from cornmeal) out of her home for about twenty years. On the side, she sells corn and beans. 

Seeking to satisfy her customer and to increase her income, Fali together with the other members of the group SONAGNON 3 are requesting a fifth loan. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano es un grupo numeroso de mujeres que se unieron para ir mejorando sus vidas y las de su familia por medio del comité. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación para poder conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello ir aplicando las estrategias e ir mejorando sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien vende sábanas, colchas fundas, que ella misma confecciona gracias a la habilidad que tiene. Comenta que se ha hecho de muy buena clientela que sus confecciones siempre agradan a sus clientes. Y que gracias a este trabajo está pudiendo ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra.  Maria Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos como tela, hilos, etc. lo cual  la ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Cayetano is a large Communal Bank of women who got together to improve their lives and those of their families. The women are now taking the "Poverty Elimination Program" survey to determine each women's situation. Depending on the results of the survey, they will apply strategies to improve their lives.
Maria is one of the members of the Communal Bank. She sells sheets, pillowcases and bedspreads which she makes herself thanks to her sewing ability. She says that she has a good customer base because her products please her customers. Thanks to her job, Maria can help her family and give them all the things that she couldn't have.
Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, etc to fulfill her business plan. This will allow her to improve her income.

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread and other sewing supplies.

loans.name: Alogojesuston Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ALOGOJESUSTON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et font des tontines ensemble. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Codjo Philippe est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Codjo Philippe a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Codjo Philippe est âgé de 31 ans et est marié une coiffeuse du nom de Florentine. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Codjo Philippe et sa femme assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Codjo Philippe exerce comme activité la vente de tissus et du maïs de façon secondaire. Codjo Philippe s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Codjo Philippe sollicite à nouveau un crédit. Son ambition est de diversifier son activité.
texts.en:
The group "ALOGOJESUSTON" is composed of three persons, who are friends participating in tontines together. This is the second time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost their businesses. The group's representative, Codjo Philippe, is the one in the photo with his hand raised. He has a middle school education. He is 31 years old and married to a hairdresser named Forentine. The couple have six children, not all in school, but all in their care. 

Codjo Philippe and his wife jointly ensure that the different household expenses are covered. To support himself and improve his living standard,  he has had a business selling cloth, and corn secondarily. He gets his supplies from a market in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy his customer and to increase his income, Codjo Philippe is requesting a new loan. His ambition is to diversify his business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, assorted biscuits and basic kitchen items to sell.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
This is Jelyn, 36, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Larry, a security guard, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Jelyn operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Jelyn hopes that her business will flourish and dreams to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, as well as other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She loves her family and claims they are her greatest strength for getting up each morning and working hard to generate an income. She lives with her husband, 3 daughters and 3 sons in Punjab, Pakistan. 

She owns a general store, and she works very hard to meet her family's needs. She needs additional capital for the growth of her business. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, she will purchase a variety of goods including flour, rice, pulses (beans), soaps, soft drinks, tea packs, etc. for the general store, in order to satisfy her clients more professionally as well as to increase her savings for the better future of her children.

Rafia and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for her business.

loans.use: To buy flour, rice, pulses (beans), soaps, soft drinks, tea packs etc

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: El señor Diego de 32 años de edad, es soltero, vive en la Ciudad de Villarrica, , es Técnico en refrigeración, arregla heladeras, hace mantenimientos y carga de oxígeno a Split y aires acondicionados, posee clientela variada por su buen trato y la calidad de su trabajo, vive con su  madre que es artesana,  agradece a la Fundación y a Kiva por el crédito anterior, ya que con ello pudo construir un salón, con este segundo crédito que solicita quiere poder invertirlo en la compra de herramientas para su trabajo y con ello tener más seguridad en su trabajo, y así obtener más ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diego is 32 years old and unmarried. He lives in the city of Villarrica, where he works as a refrigeration technician. He repairs refrigerators and performs maintenance on air conditioning units. He has a varied customer base thanks to his good relationship with customers and the quality of his work.
Diego lives with his mother, who works as a craftswoman. He is grateful to the field partner and to Kiva for the previous loan he received because it allowed him to build a workshop. He wants to invest the money from this second loan in the purchase of tools for his job. This will increase his job security and his profits, which will allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 37 years old and she is happily married to Jon Ruel who works as a driver. God has blessed them with love. Life indeed is hard, but by the grace of God they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Marilyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community, and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or a single egg. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell them per piece for a higher price to make a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns about Php300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help, enabling her to add more products to her store.

Marilyn hopes to have a happy life and hopes her business will grow bigger. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, Yawa revend depuis 2001 des pagnes, des boissons et jus à domicile. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et sollicite son second prêt pour acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. A l' avenir, elle voudrait rendre pérenne son activité et assurer l'éducation de ses enfants. Notons qu'elle est mariée à un infirmier et maman de 02 enfants de 12 et 10ans tous scolarisés.
texts.en: To help out her husband in covering household expenses, Yawa has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), beverages, and juices out of her home since 2001. She gets her supplies from Lomé and is requesting her second loan to purchase some merchandise to satisfy her customers. For the future, she would like to make her business sustainable and to ensure her children are educated. To note, she is married to a nurse and is a mom with two children, who are 12 and 10 years old and in school.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth, beverages, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Koami

texts.fr: Revendeur de claies et de crédit de communication, Koami est un jeune de 31ans avec un enfant de 04ans en charge. Il sollicite un troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Son désir est d'étendre son activité et de pouvoir assurer les besoins de la famille. Il a démarré en 2003.
texts.en: A retailer of grid-work or screens and of communication credits, Koami is a young man, 31 years old, who has a 4-year-old child to support. He is requesting a third WAGES loan to purchase more merchandise to satisfy his customers. His desire is to expand his business and be able ensure that the needs of his family are met. He got started in 2003.

loans.use: to purchase grid-work and credits

loans.name: Annastasia

texts.en:
Annastasia is a lady of twenty-five years, married to Peter and a mother of one child. She sells rice, toothpaste and pasta and has been in this business for five years now. Annastasia gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Annastasia's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy supplies like rice and toothpaste in bulk. In future Annastasia wishes to be successful in all her endeavours.

loans.use: To purchase rice, tooth paste, spaghetti, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas oven, repair her electric mill and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Luchadoras está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales se encuentran mejorando su situación de pobreza.
 Mirian es una mujer muy trabajadora, que día a día está esforzándose mas y mas para poder ayudar a su familia y aumentar también sus ingresos. Mirian se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella hace, y que sus clientes gustan mucho. Ella sueña con poder tener algún día un puesto grande de comidas, y de esa forma seguir trabajando y creciendo con su negocio.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called the Luchadoras is in their first cycle in a program for women in which they work and where they help each other get ahead. They are organizing a survey to study the elimination of poverty through continual and hard work, also by the teaching and application of important behaviors in their daily lives in order to improve their current situation of living in poverty. 
Mirian is a hard working woman and every day she works more and more in order to help her family and increase her income. Mirian sells food goods that she makes herself and that her customers like a lot. She dreams of being able to have her own stand one day, selling food, and in order to see this through, she will continue working and growing her business. 
She is applying for this credit because she wants to invest in her business by purchasing the things she needs to make her food items such as vegetables, meat, condiments and more. She is thankful for this opportunity that she has been given and knows that it will help her out a lot.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, meat, condiments and more.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Renacer está en su ciclo número 19 del programa de comité, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, con ansias de ir mejorando sus vidas e ir superando su pobreza. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza,  y de esa forma conocer la situación de cada una de ellas.
Leoncia, una de ellas,  se dedica a la venta de comestibles en un colegio de la ciudad, gracias a los ingresos que ella tiene puede  ayudar a su familia, en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza  medio, pero a  través del esfuerzo y el sacrificio ella mejoró y se encuentra aplicando su plan de negocios que ella misma elaboró.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus alimentos, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Renacer group is in its 19th cycle in the group program. These women are the heads of their families and are anxious to improve their lives and overcome their poverty. They are completing a survey on the elimination of poverty in order to understand each woman's situation.
Leonicia, one of the group members, sells food at a school in the city. She is able to help her family with her income. In her last survey, she demonstrated an average level of poverty, but through her hard work and sacrifice she has improved and is applying a business plan which she herself designed.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies in order to keep making her food. She will buy items such as vegetables, meat, and condiments. This will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and more.

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Valientes se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. Todas las integrantes son de zonas bastantes alejadas y aisladas, donde es de difícil acceso y están tratando de ir mejorando y creciendo.
Mirna es la presidenta de este grupo, quien comenta que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación está luchando por su familia y para darle a ellos lo que necesitan. Ella se dedica a la costura, y es una modista excelente, que hace muy buenos trabajos, y sus clientes siempre están satisfechos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, con lo que podrá seguir dando a su familia lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Valientes (Courageous Women) was formed by neighbors in the city of Santaní. The members, who are trying to succeed and grow, are from fairly distant, isolated, and difficult-to-access communities. 

Mirna, the group's president, says she has been striving to give her family everything it needs. She is a seamstress and skilled designer, who does excellent work for her always satisfied clients. She has applied for this loan to
buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies so that she can continue to provide her family with what it needs.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Union y está en su ciclo número 10º del programa de comités. Están mujeres están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación económica de cada una, y conforme a ello trabajar.
Mercedes formar parte de este grupo, y comenta que es peluquera,  y que tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en el que trabaja atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes. Se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que ella es una persona muy atenta y amable, y eso gusta mucho. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y también poder dar trabajo a otras personas que necesitan.
La Sra. Mercedes Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  insumos para surtir su peluquería, como ser tintes, limas, ruleros, tijeras, shampoo y demás,  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The 'Union' group is in its tenth cycle in the program. These women are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty in order to know each member's economic situation and to work accordingly.
Mercedes is part of this group, and explains that she is a hairdresser. She has a small beauty salon where she provides very good customer service. She has built up a very good customer base because she is very kind and attentive. Her goal is to be able to continue expanding her business and to be able to give work to others who need it.
Mercedes is requesting this loan for the purchase of supplies to stock her salon, such as dyes, files, rollers, scissors, shampoo, and more. This will help her to solidify her business plan, which will allow her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy dyes, files, rollers, scissors, shampoo, and more.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a man of twenty-nine years, married to Margaret and a father of one young child. He operates a motorbike transport business in the Kangemi area, and he has been in this business for three and a half years now. Moses gets a monthly income of eleven thousand shillings.

This will be Moses' second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy motorbike spare parts. He wants to open a motorbike spare parts shop in future.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Katia

texts.es:
Katia tiene 40 años, está divorciada y vive en su propia casa junta sus 3 hijos. 
La actividad que tiene Katia es la venta de bebidas gaseosas de diferentes marcas y sabores. Tiene más de 06 años dedicándose  éste negocio y por el momento solo cuenta con el apoyo de su hija mayor quien atiende a los clientes cuando está fuera de casa.
Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos y el poder tener una ocupación, además el poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y contar con tiempo disponible para dedicarlos a otras actividades. Considera a su negocio rentable por la demanda que tiene y las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio.
Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.
Con el monto de 1200 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su tienda como gaseosas de distintas marcas, chicles y otros.
texts.en:
Katia, 40, is divorced living in her own house with her three children.  Katia’s activity is selling soft-drinks in assorted brands and flavors.  She’s been in this business for more than six years and at the moment only her older daughter helps her take care of customers when she needs to be away from home.

She likes the business because of the income and because she’s able to have an occupation while being able to be comfortable at home and have time available for other activities.  She considers the business to be profitable because of the demand it has and the profits it nets.  Therefore, she plans to expand her business.

This will be her second Kiva loan.  She therefore hopes for a small loan so she can continue towards reaching her objectives.  She will use the 1,200 new soles to buy stock merchandise for her store like assorted brands of soft-drinks, chewing gum and others.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise like soft-drinks and others.

loans.name: Iffat

texts.en:
Iffat is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband started clothing business four years ago. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them in the market at a profitable prize.

Iffat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his clothing supply, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Iffat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to support her husband's clothing business through increased clothing supplies.

loans.name: Dorian

texts.es: Dorian, con 26 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y no aún no tiene hijos. Hace varios años se dedica a laborar como obrero de construcción, actividad con la cual ha generado ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Adicionalmente y como actividad complementaria, realizó un curso de Barbería en una escuela de belleza de la ciudad y, hace 4 meses con sus ahorros, inició una barbería en el sector donde reside, aprovechando la ventaja de ser el único que presta el servicio en ese sector. Dorian es un hombre enérgico, activo, con visión y muchas ganas de salir adelante, por eso siempre está en busca de opciones que le permitan salir adelante, por eso se motivó para solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de una silla de peluquería y una máquina patilladora, así podrá ofrecer un servicio más ágil y podrá aumentar sus ingresos, al atraer más clientes con la prestación de un excelente servicio. Dorian sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, que sea reconocido en todo el sector y además quiere implementar la venta de productos de belleza, para así obtener mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su madre.
texts.en:
Dorian is 26 years old. He is unmarried and has no children yet. He worked for several years as a construction worker and this activity provided the income for the household expenses. As a complimentary activity, he took a barber course at a beauty school in his city. Four months ago he used his savings to open a barber shop in the neighborhood where he lives, taking advantage of being the only person providing this kind of service in the area.
Dorian is an energetic, active man, with vision and a desire to get ahead in life. He is always looking for options to move forward and this is why he is asking for a loan. He will invest the money in the purchase of a hairdresser chair and a trimmer shaver. This will allow him to offer a more agile service, increasing his profit by attracting more customers looking for an excellent service. 
Dorian's dream is to make his business grow, and be recognized in the neighborhood. He also plans to introduce the sale of beauty products to further increase profits. This will allow him to improve the quality of life for him and his mother.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdresser chair and a trimmer shaver.

loans.name: Eid Gah Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 49-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband also assists his younger brother by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Rukhsana is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and healthcare expenses.

Rukhsana wants to grow the business of her husband, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use the loan to buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. Rukhsana is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. 

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.


Note: Rukhsana raises her hand in the picture shown.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, cooking oil, detergent and soap to sell.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Amparo de 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo de  16 años, desde hace 4 años dedicada a la venta de mercancía (cosméticos, ropa interior, joyería; productos de hogar como ollas a presión, licuadoras, arroceras y venta de comestibles (Galletas, chocolates, lácteos, entre otros)), donde sus clientes son su familia y conocidos.
Desde que comenzó, viene trabajando sola todos los días y en sus tiempos libres cuidando niños de vecinos, lo que le generan otros ingresos mensuales.
Pide un crédito de 350.000 para la compra de surtido de mercancía, cambiando positivamente sus ventas puesto que como dice ella “tendré mas surtido, para vender más”
texts.en:
Luz Amparo is 44 years old. She is married and is a stay-at-home mom with a 16-year-old son. For four years she has made a living selling merchandise (cosmetics, underwear, jewelry), household products (pressure cookers, blenders, rice cookers), and selling food (cookies, chocolates, dairy products, among others). Her family and acquaintances are her customers.

Since she started, she has been working alone everyday and in her free time taking care of her neighbors' children, which generates additional monthly income. She is requesting a loan of 350,000 Colombian pesos for the purchase of a variety of merchandise to change her sales for the better since she says, “I’ll have more variety in order to sell more.”

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Andrés Marcelo

texts.es:
Andrés Marcelo carpintero y artesano desde hace 15 años, es padre de dos hijos, desde el 2005 estuvo trabajando con su hermano en un taller de guaduas (propiedad de los dos), pero fueron robados quedando descapitalizados y se vieron en la obligación de cerrar. El primero de octubre de 2011 decidió empezar su propio negocio que consiste en la fabricación  y venta de cocinas integrales, closets, módulos para hogar, interiores, exteriores y también realiza artesanías ecológicas de materia primas reciclables.
Desde que empezó este negocio trabaja con un amigo todos los días y en sus tiempos libres, ya que también labora en una microempresa de quesos de propia de su papa.
Anhela con la aprobación del crédito y así usarlo para mejoras locativas y compra de materia prima, y así podrá mejorar la imagen de su negocio y tendrá más materia prima disponible para trabajar
texts.en:
Andrés Marcelo has been a carpenter and artisan for the last 15 years. 

He’s the father of two children and worked with his brother in a bamboo cane shop (owned by both of them) since 2005 but they were robbed and left with no capital so were forced to close.  

On October 1, 2011 he decided to start his own business that consists of building and selling built-in kitchen cabinets, closets, interior and exterior modular home units and he also makes ecological crafts using recycled materials.  Since starting this business he works with a friend every day and in his free time since he also works in a micro-business producing cheese his father owns.

He hopes his loan will be approved so he can use it to make physical improvements to his locale and to buy raw materials to improve his business’ site and to have more raw materials to work with.

loans.use: to make repairs and buy raw materials (plastic, aluminum, cardboard)

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Gisela es miembro del grupo Jóvenes Emprendedores
Gisela es una de las socias de la alcancía .Ella tiene 19 años es soltera y vive junto a su familia, trabaja para poder ayudar a sus padres y pagar sus estudios de cosmetología, su mayor sueño en la vida es tener su propio salón de belleza, en la actualidad trabaja como cosmetóloga y se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, sus ventas las realiza en su trabajo y entre sus compañeras de estudio, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para comprar más productos y aumentar sus ventas. Gisela es nueva dentro del grupo y como tal esta agradecida por la confianza de muchas personas que la ayudan sin conocerla.
La foto adjunta pertenece a una de las socias. Gisela que esta con polo negro y pantalón jean celeste, ella vino al desembolso un poco tarde por eso se le tomo la foto a ella sola.
*Los niños son hijos de las socias quisieron salir en la foto con sus madres.
texts.en:
Gisela’s a member of the “Jóvenes Emprendedores” (Young Entrepreneurs) group.  Gisela is one of the communal bank members.  She’s 19-years-old living with her family. She works in order to help her parents and to pay her cosmetology courses; her greatest dream in life is to have her own beauty salon.  She currently works as a cosmetologist and sells beauty products.  Her sales take place at work and among her classmates.  The loan she’s requested will serve to buy more products and to increase sales.  Gisela is new to the group and as such is grateful for the trust of many people who help her even though they don’t know her. The inserted photo is of one of the group members. Gisela is wearing a black shirt and light blue jeans. She arrived to the disbursement office a little late to take the photo, so she had to take a solo shot.

*The children belong to the members; they wanted to appear in the photo with their mothers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a lady of thirty-five years, married to Ayub and a mother of three children. She runs a salon and has been in this business for four years now. Beth gets monthly income of twelve thousand two hundred shillings.

This will be Beth's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy one hair dryer worth KES 14000 and a blow dryer worth KES 4000. In the future she wants to open a classic salon in Nairobi.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and a blow dry machine

loans.name: Maua Group

texts.en:
Mwanaisha, who is in her late forties, is married with a daughter who is in school. She is doing fine with her family. For two years now, Mwanaisha has been managing two ventures, a tailoring business and clothes materials selling at the same shop. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good profit per month.

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania LTD. She will use the loan to restock more clothes material to resell, as well as making clothes. Mwanaisha dreams that one day she will be able to open a big wholesale shop selling clothes materials. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Maua Group", which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock more clothes material to resell, as well as to make clothes.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 42, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a construction worker, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Edna operates the buy-and-sell business for her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell it with a little profit. Her products are different underwear. Customers are attracted to buy, due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. She also has a small variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 7,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales weekly.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of underwear needed in her business.

Edna hopes that her business will flourish and dreams to have a happy life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of underwear needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman and a mother of four grown up children from CPG, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business, together with her husband, for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.

Rosalinda is asking for a loan to buy materials for the repair of the fishing boat, like plywood, paint, nylon and buckets. With this, her husband will be able to repair the boat thus allowing him to go fishing.

In the future, Rosalinda hopes of making their fishing business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy materials like plywood, paint, nylon and buckets for the repair of the fishing boat

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a welder by profession. His net income is inadequate to meet the family needs. He needs welding materials for his work.

Shehnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan amount to increase his supply of welding products including iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods and welding rods, so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns. Shehnaz hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase iron rods, iron sheet, soldering rods, welding rods for her husband's welding business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts (spark plugs, tires patches, rear-view mirrors) a display case and improve his working space.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es: María Haydee de 35 años de edad,  casada y del domicilio de Chichigalpa, con dos hijos uno cursando sus estudios primarios y el otro sus estudios secundarios que aún están bajo su cargo, es propietaria del  negocio de  una pulpería, donde vende productos alimenticios y básicos para el consumo del hogar como: arroz, azucar, firjoles, aceite, productos congelados, golosinas entre otros al igual que mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros, cosmeticos, shampoo entre otros, este negocio lo empezó hace varios años, con venta de golosinas y con el tiempo le surgió la idea de establecer una pulpería, aprovechando que en ese lugar de su casa donde habita no había un negocio cerca de ese lugar, donde ofreciera productos básicos y de mercadería en general realiza sus compras en mercado mayoreo, tiendas y proveedores que llegan a su negocio a ofrecer productos, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y también eventuales, los  gastos de la familia dependen del negocio que ella administra, para el sustento y manutención del hogar. María está solicitando préstamo para capital de trabajo invertir más en productos de la pulpería y mercadería en general.
texts.en:
María Haydee is 35 years old, married, and lives in Chichigalpa. She has two children to take care of, one in primary school and the other in secondary school.

She owns a small grocery store where she sells food products, household goods, and general merchandise like rice, sugar, beans, oil, frozen products, candies, children's, women's, and men's clothes, cosmetics, shampoo, and other things. She started this business many years ago by selling snacks. After a while, she got the idea to open a grocery store, taking advantage of the fact that there was not a business by her home that sold basic goods and general merchandise.

She makes her purchases in wholesale markets, stores, and from suppliers who come to her store to sell their products. Her sales are in cash and credit to regular and occasional customers.

The payment of her family's expenses, which include food and maintenance, depend on the business that she runs.

María requests this loan for working capital, to invest in more products for the store, and for general merchandise.

loans.use: to buy food products, household goods, and general merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single lady of forty-seven years, and she has two school-going children. She sells charcoal and cereals and also makes baskets. She has been in this business for eleven years, and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's fifth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy strapping rolls for making baskets. 

In the future, she wants to be a successful business woman and also feed her family well.

loans.use: to buy strapping rolls for making baskets.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El señor Julian es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella tiene un Taller de Motos, hace trabajos de mantenimientos y otros. Trabaja de lunes a sábado cuenta con casa propia, lugar donde tiene su taller.
El es una persona que trabaja duro por salir adelante y crecer para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que necesitan para el día a dia.
Solicita el préstamo  para compra de repuestos para poder seguir con sus ventas y teniendo todo lo que sus clientes le piden.
texts.en: Julian is from the city of Pilar and runs an auto-repair shop where he carries out maintenance work among other duties. He works from Monday to Saturday and he runs the shop from his own house. He is a person who works hard to get ahead and grow in order to help his family and give them all that they need from day to day. He is requesting this loan to buy auto parts to be able to keep up his sales and have everything that his customers ask for.

loans.use: to buy auto parts for his auto-repair shop.

loans.name: Hina

texts.en:
Hina, a 27-year-old hardworking woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband and three children. Her husband is a tailor. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. He wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. He will extend his business if he gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Hina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine for her husband to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of clients more professionally. He hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach his desired net income and be able to save for their future. Hina dreams of giving his children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a woman of sixty-five years. She is a widow, and her children are all adults. She sells groceries and charcoal in Mucatha on the outskirts of Kiambu town. Mary has been in this business for thirty years and gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy a crate of tomatoes and also charcoal. 

In the future, Mary desires to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a crate of tomatoes and also charcoal.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer felizmente casada y con un hijo de 17 años, residentes en la ciudad de Sonsón, decide desde hace mucho años iniciar con una tienda en un local que tiene en su vivienda y desde entonces viene generando ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos (mecato, galletería, Gaseosas, productos lácteos) y así surtir su tienda. Aclarándonos que con esto ella podrá continuar con su negocio y seguir generando ingresos para su familia, y ante todo poder disfrutar más tiempo con su familia que es la razón de vivir y trabajar de ella
texts.en: Claudia Patricia is happily married, has a 17-year-old son, and resides in the city of Sonsón. Years ago, she decided to open a store in her house, which, since then, has generated income to pay household expenses. She has applied for a loan to buy supplies (pastries, cookies, soft drinks, dairy products) to stock her store so that she can keep her business going, continue to earn income for her family, and, most of all, be able to spend more time with her family, which is her reason for living and working.

loans.use: to buy supplies (pastries, cookies, soft drinks, dairy products)

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El Señor Ramon  es de la Ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltero, cometa que es dueño de un local comercial, es decir una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día.
El es una persona muy trabajadora, que lucha por ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia, hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la terminación de su salón comercial y de esa forma poder ofrecer una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Agradece por esa oportunidad que esta recibiendo que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Ramon is from Curuguaty and is single.  He says that he is the owner of a retail space, which is to say a well-stocked general store.  He works there everyday starting very early in the morning. 
Sr. Ramon is a very hard-working person who strives to improve his life and that of his family.  Today he is requesting the loan in order to invest in the completion of his retail space.  It will then be more comfortable for his customers.  He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, that he is being granted.  It will be a big help for him.

loans.use: to finish construction on his retail space.

loans.name: Eternel Est Mon Berger Group

texts.fr: ETERNEL EST MON BERGER est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, Wanvèmi Matha (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 45 ans. Wanvèmi Matha ne vit plus avec son mari et n'a pas d'enfant. Wanvèmi Matha n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour se prendre en charge, Wanvèmi Matha mène comme activité depuis huit ans, la vente de maïs et de beignets par le système de distribution. Wanvèmi Matha achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la sixième fois que Wanvèmi Matha sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui lui permettra certainement et aux autres membres du groupe ETERNEL EST MON BERGER, d’accroître leur stock de produits et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en: ETERNEL EST MON BERGER is a group of three people whose members belong to the same tontine group. The representative of the group, Wanvèmi Matha (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 45 years old. Wanvèmi Matha doesn't live with her husband anymore and doesn't have any children. Wanvèmi Matha did not go to school. To take care of herself, Wanvèmi Matha has been managing a business for eight years, the sale of corn and of doughnuts through the distribution system. Wanvèmi Matha buys her products in a market in Benin. This is the sixth time that Wanvèmi Matha is requesting a loan from ALIDé, a loan which will certainly allow her and other members of the ETERNEL EST MON BERGER group to grow their stock of products and to better respond to the demands of their clientele.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is a married woman  from CPG, Bohol and the mother of three grown up children. Sylvia runs and operates a motorcycle transport business. She is asking for a loan to buy wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts. With this, they will be able to improve and maintain the good working condition of the motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy wheel tires, chains, nuts and bolts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits for resale and more clothes and shoes for her boutique.

loans.name: Romualdo

texts.en: Romualdo is a 60-year-old married man from Getafe, Bohol. He engages in raising chickens. He has been raising chickens for almost two years now. To be able to continue his livelihood activity, Romualdo has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy chicken feed and maintenance supplies for the chickens to grow healthy, so that they can be sold on within a particular period. Romualdo hopes that he will be successful in his poultry business, to have a good living condition and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and maintenance supplies

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a man of twenty-eight years, married to Eunice and a father of two children. He keeps pigs for sale and has been in this business for eleven years now. George gets monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be George's second loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy piglets and food for the small pigs. He will use the profits to feed his children, and in the future he wants them to get an education.

loans.use: To purchase to more piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a batch of books (textbooks and literature)

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es: Mary es una mujer de 40 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años y cabeza de hogar. Vive con su padre y su pequeño hijo. Durante 5 años trabajó en almacenes de ropa en el centro de la ciudad, pero se retiró y con la liquidación y unos ahorros decidió independizarse y compró un negocio de venta de frutas ubicado cerca al estadio. Ella es una persona luchadora, emprendedora y trabaja largas jornadas para obtener el sustento para su familia, ella abre su negocio de 5:30 de la mañana a 9:00 de la noche, pero pasa por una situación difícil pues, deja a su hijo al cuidado de su padre, que es un señor de la tercera edad, porque aún no tiene los recursos para pagar una guardería. Es por esta razón que solicita el segundo ciclo de crédito, ya que desea comprar un activo fijo (televisor LCD) con el fin de darle una mejor imagen a su negocio y atraer más clientes, esto le permitirá vender más y generar mejores ingresos para sacar adelante a su hijo y para tener la oportunidad de montar otro negocio adicional, un almacén de ropa en un local ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, así podrá  mejorar la economía de su hogar y brindar a su hijo una excelente educación.
texts.en: Mary is a 40 year old woman, a single mother of a 3 year old son and a head of household. She lives with her father and her young son. For 5 years she worked in clothing stores in the center of town, but she left and with the settlement and some savings she decided to go off on her own and she bought a business selling fruit close to the stadium. She is a fighter who is enterprising and who works long hours to obtain support for her family. She opens her business at 5:30 in the morning to 9:00 at night. She is going through a difficult situation because she leaves her son with her father who is elderly, because she doesn't have the resources to pay for a daycare. That is the reason she is asking for the second cycle loan, because she wants to pay a fixed asset (an LCD television) in order to give her business a better image and attract more customers. This will allow her to sell more and generate better income to get her son ahead and have an opportunity to open another business, a clothes store in a locale in the center of town. That way, she will be able to improve her household finances and offer her son an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy a fixed asset (an LCD television)

loans.name: La Candelaria Group

texts.es:
Doña Romana es una mujer alegre y emprendedora que se dedica a la reposteria desde un poco mas de doce años,ella dice que aprendió esta actividad ya que sus hijos eran pequeños y los gastos muchos quería poder apoyar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia así que inicio a elaborar pasteles,flanes, gelatinas para vender en su comunidad y obtener un ingreso extra para su familia. Durante estos años su negocio ha ganado popularidad entre la gente de su comunidad y actualmente trabaja sobre los pedidos que la gente le hace para sus fiestas, conviviós o reuniones, lo que mas le gusta de se actividad es que logro montar su propia fuente de empleo desde su hogar y aunque ya tiene tiempo con la actividad no ha perdido el gusto de la gente.

Las personas que han comido sus pasteles dicen que son los mas ricos de la comudad. 

ella tinene 47 años solo estudio primaria y esta casada con don carlos que se dedica al trabajo del campo 


un crédito de visión fund le ayudara a invertir en la compra de harinas, azúcar, huevos, mantequilla, levaduras, chocolate para continuar con su actividad. 

Doña Ramona es uno de los integrantes de un grupo llamado la candelaria el cual esta integrado por 8 personas trabajadoras, el cual  se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de La Candelaria y sus principal fuente empleo es el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar. 

ella desea que su negocio progrese y que sus pasteles sean del agrado de mas personas para ganar mas clientes así poder aumentar sus ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

los demas intregrantes del grupo son:
Francisca club de nutricion
Norberto tienda de abarrotes
Gerardo renta de tractor
Magdalena venta de articulos para el hogar y cosmeticos 
Beatriz venta de refrescos y dullces 
Ninfa venta de refrescos 
Yadira venta de comida
texts.en:
Romana is a cheerful and enterprising woman who has worked for a little more than twelve years making pastries. She says that she learned this activity because her children were little and she had a lot of expenses. She wanted to help her husband get her family ahead, so she started to make cakes, flan, and gelatin to sell in her community to make extra income for her family. During these years her business has gained popularity among the people in her community. RIght now, she works filling orders that people make for their parties, get-togethers or meetings. What she likes the most about this activity is that she was able to generate her own employment from home and she still has time with the activity and hasn't stopped liking being around people.

The people who have eaten her cakes say that they are the most delicious ones in the community. 

She is 47 years old and only went to primary school. She is married to Carlos and he does agricultural work.  

A loan from Visión Fund will help her to invest in buying flour, sugar, eggs, butter, yeast, and chocolate to continue with her activity. 

Ramona is one of the members of a group called La Candelaria. It is made up of 8 hardworking people and is located in the community of La Candelaria and its main source of employment is agriculture and planting and harvesting sugarcane.  

She wants her business to progress and for her cakes to be liked by more people to get more customers and increase her earnings and have a better quality of life. 

The other members of the group are:
Francisca , nutrition club
Norberto grocery store
Gerardo tractor rental 
Magdalena sale of items for the home and cosmetics 
Beatriz sale of beverages and candy 
Ninfa sale of beverages
Yadira sale of food

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, butter, yeast and chocolate.

loans.name: Hernando De Jesus

texts.es: Hernando, con 45 años de edad, es un hombre casado y padre de 2 hijos. Vive en una finca propia donde se dedica a las labores agrícolas y tiene cultivos de caña de azúcar, café y árboles frutales, actividad que aprendió de su padre cuando era joven. Para generar ingresos, él sale a vender los productos que cosecha y así logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. El titular es trabajador, apasionado por su familia y por su trabajo, esto lo motivó a solicitar su segundo ciclo de crédito como apoyo, con el que comprará insumos agrícolas (abonos, fertilizantes, fungicidas) para reabonar sus cultivos, especialmente el cultivo de café, con esto podrá cosechar productos de mejor calidad y venderlos a mejor precio en el mercado, para así obtener mejores ingresos. Hernando sueña con poder ampliar sus cultivos, ya que cuenta con el terreno para hacerlo y así poder brindar bienestar y una estabilidad económica a su familia, para seguir adelante.
texts.en: Hernando is 45 years old and is a married father of 2 children. He lives on his own plantation where he works growing sugar cane, coffee and fruit trees, a trade which he learned from his father when he was young. To generate income, he sells the products he harvests, and in this way he manages to provide for his family. He is hard-working and passionate about his family and his work. This has prompted him to request a second loan, which he will use to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizer, fungicides) to fertilize his crops, especially his coffee plants. With this help, he will be able to harvest a better-quality product and sell it at a better price at the market, thus increasing his income. Hernando dreams of growing more crops, since he has the land to do this on, and in this way provide well-being and financial stability for his family and continue moving forward.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies (manure, fertilizer, fungicides) to fertilize his crops.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Con un crédito obtenido por parte de Kiva el año pasado Rene pago a los jornaleron que contrató para realizar trabajos durante la cosecha de café. Para este año él solicita nuevamente un crédito pues comprará planta para resembrar una parte de su finca de café orgánico, también comprará fertilizantes y otra parte del crédito la utilizará para realizar algunas labores de limpieza.
texts.en:
With a loan obtained from Kiva last year, Rene paid the day laborers that he hired to work during the coffee harvest. 

This year he is requesting another loan to buy new plants to replant a portion of his organic coffee farm, he'll also buy fertilizers and use the rest of the loan to perform some cleanup work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Genia Lizeth

texts.es:
Genia es una joven de 28 años de edad la cual es comerciante y agricultora madre de 2 hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está en primaria. En compañía de su compañero de hogar se dedican a la agricultura: siembra hortalizas, maíz, frijol, café y elaboración de viveros de café. Ella solo tiene un grado de educación de primaria cursado hasta el 5 grado la cual no pudo terminar por la falta de apoyo economice por parte de sus padres. Ella también tiene una pulpería pequeña la cual es un medio más de ingresos la cual le ayuda para cubrir algunos gastos en el hogar como: alimentación, medicinas con algunas restricciones, vestimentas, entre otros.

Uno de los desafíos que las personas que se dedican a la agricultura tienen es la alza de los precios en cuanto a los insumos agrícolas que utilizan para dar asistencia técnica y mantenimiento a sus cultivos por lo cual ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un apoyo económico para poder comprar lo necesario y limpiar de plagas sus cosechas evitando que sean contagiadas con enfermedades y otras.

Sus sueños es ver a sus hijos crecer y verlos convertidos en profesionales, con carreras universitarias, con sus propios negocios o micro empresas que ayuden al desarrollo propio y el de sus familias.
texts.en:
Genia is a 28 year old young woman.  She is a merchant and a farmer.  She has two children, and one of them is in elementary school.  Her life partner is a farmer.  He grows vegetables, corn, beans, and coffee.  He also prepares coffee nurseries.

She only has a fifth grade education.  She was not able to finish because of the lack of financial support from her parents.  She also has a small grocery store, which is another means of income that helps her cover some of the household expenses like food, some medications, and clothing, among other things.

One of the challenges that people working in agriculture have is the rise of the prices of the agricultural supplies they use to take care of and maintain their crops.  That is why she has requested a financial support from COMIXMUL.  The loan is to be able to buy what she needs and to clear the pests from her harvests, avoiding contagious illnesses and others.

Her dreams are to see her children grow and become professionals with university degrees.  She wants to see them with their own businesses or small businesses that help with their own growth and that of their families.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en: Zahraa is a 24-year-old married woman who has been working as a tutor for the past 7 years.  She enjoys her work a lot and is working hard to improve and develop as much as she can.  She is applying for her second youth loan from Al Majmoua, Kiva’s partner, in order to prepare a special working place at her house.  This will help her students to enjoy their privacy and will help her father to develop his business.  Through her previous loan, Zahraa bought a laptop that improved her working tools and helped her students to enjoy their sessions.  In the future, Zahraa hopes to open her tutoring center outside her house.

loans.use: to prepare a special working place at her house for tutoring.

loans.name: Eleanora

texts.en:
This is Eleanora.  Her previous loan was a big help in her business, as she was able to buy more t-shirts.  She also sells different silver accessories and sweet goods.  Her business income helped her to send her children to school and to pay for everyday expenses.  She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more t-shirts (white and colored), and silkscreen.  She will also use the money to buy ingredients for her sweet products.  Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and to pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eleanora hopes that her business will be more successful and she dreams that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more t-shirts (white and colored), silk screen, and ingredients for her sweet products.

loans.name: Rasoolan

texts.en: Rasoolan is a 44-year-old housewife.  She is a mother of 6 children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband owns a vegetable shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family.  He sells a variety of fresh vegetables in his shop after purchasing them from the field.  Presently, he is interested in offering a greater variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings.  However, due to the lack of expenses, he finds it difficult.  Therefore, his wife, Rasoolan, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.  This will help her husband to purchase vegetables from the field and to sell them in the market at a profitable price.  With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future.  Rasoolan is very thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en:
Amna is a 24-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She has been supporting her husband financially for many years by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients.

Her husband drives an auto rickshaw for many years and remains away from home for some days every week.  In his absence, Amna takes care of her children very well and also manages her household tasks with great efficiency.  She is a mother of 3 daughters.  One of her daughters is going to a nearby school regularly.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband, who wants to replace the tires of his auto rickshaw.  This will help him drive his vehicle more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw tires.

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Goretti is a married, 55-year-old businesswoman.  She has been selling cereals (primary business) and fruits (supplemental business) for the past two years.  She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KSH which she uses to support her family. 

Goretti is applying for her second loan term with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loan.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of maize, beans, green grams, and peas.  With the expected profit from the business, she will buy more fruits for sell.  Her hopes and dreams are to provide her family with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, beans, green grams, and peas.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  tiene 45 años,  casada con tres hijos de las edades de 24, 18 y 13  años todos ellos estudiando,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Alto Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Maria  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 45 years old, married, with three children who are ages 24,18 and 13. All of her children are students. She sells grocery supplies from her store in the Alto Pampahadi Zone in the city of La Paz. This is her first loan from this institution. She is going to use the loan to buy merchandise in order to have a greater variety of goods for her business. She is going to buy groceries, sweets and sodas. She is asking for this loan because she has many customers. She can increase her sales by providing a larger variety of goods. In this way her business will grow each day and her income will improve. Her goal is to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of good for her store.

loans.name: Emisna

texts.es: La Sra. Emisna tiene 37 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 11, 13 y 18 años, ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de la Gurdia,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Emisna va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y hortalizas para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  la Sra. Emisna enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar la  sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de la misma para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo, la Sra. Emisna es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Mrs. Emisna is 37 years old. She has three children who are 11, 13 and 18 years old. She sells prepared lunches from a sales booth in the city of Gurdia. This is her first loan from this institution. She is going to use the loan to buy wholesale supplies, such as groceries and vegetables, that she uses to make her food.
