The reason that she is requesting this loan is that she doesn’t have the cash to buy supplies. The challenges that she faces in her business are the competition from the other vendors who make lunches. She is trying to reduce her costs and improve the flavor of her meals. She is going to buy utensils and increase the area of her business so she can accommodate more customers during the prime lunchtime hours. Mrs. Emisna is a hardworking woman. She is happy for the opportunity to have this loan.

loans.use: to buy the supplies she needs for the preparation of her meals.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years old.  He is married to his wife, Agnes. They have been blessed with three children, who are ages 1, 7, and 15.

Daniel runs a beauty salon and has been in this business for one year. Daniel's monthly income is KSH 83,500. He is requesting a loan of KSH 70,000, which he will use to expand his business. He plans to reinvest the profit back into the business.

loans.use: to add stock to his beauty shop

loans.name: Precentacion

texts.en:
Precentacion, 62, is a resident of Batasan, Philippines. She is a widow and has one child and grandchild. Despite her age, she continues to work to provide for her daily expenses.  
 
Precentacion operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers dresses and uniforms. She also does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials, including fabric, thread, and other items she needs in her business. 

Precentacion dreams of seeing her business grow and expand. She hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Ummar

texts.en:
Ummar is a 23-year-old Iraqi youth client who lives with his family of 4. Ummar and his 2 bothers take the responsibility for providing the family's income.

Ummar is a barber and has a small barber shop. He used to work with a very well-known barber years ago from whom he gained all the needed experience in this field. He established his business in 2011 and now he has an excellent reputation in the neighborhood. 

Ummar is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD in order to pay the annual rent for his barber shop. He is aiming to grow in this field and expand his business so that he may provide a stable career for himself and for his future children.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his barber shop

loans.name: Jeenny Amparo

texts.es:
Jeenny, necesita de un nuevo  préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar mercadería para su tienda, tales como: golosinas, dulces, sodas, pan, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a surtir mas su negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
El credito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos, las condiciones economicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares asimismo.
texts.en: Jeenny has asked for a new loan so she can buy goods like candy, cakes. pop, bread and other things for her store. This loan will help her stock her business more, which will increase her sales. Her last loan helped her increase her income, improving both her economic and her family situations.

loans.use: to buy candy, cakes, pop, bread and other things.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El año pasado Miguel solicitó un crédito a Kiva el cual utilizó para comprar fertilizantes para su finca de café y realizar algunas labores de limpieza en las mismas. Para este año solicita nuevamente de otro crédito pues comprará más fertilizantes y realizará trabajos para la siembre de nuevas plantas pues su meta es llegar a producir dentro de 3 años un total de 20 toneladas de café.
texts.en: Last year Miguel  applied for a loan with Kiva, which he used to purchase fertilizers for his coffee plantation and complete some work to help clean it up. This year he is again applying for a loan in order to purchase additional fertilizer and finish planting new seeds as his goal is to produce 20 tons of coffee within the next three years.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Haleema's Group

texts.en:
Haleema lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She has her hand raised in the photograph.  Haleema is a responsible mother to her five children and is an active BRAC Pakistan borrower. 

Haleema's husband has been in the business of selling milk since 2000.  His business is the sole source of income for the family. He purchases milk from the dairy farm and sells it at the local market. 

Haleema's husband needs to purchase more milk to continue his business, but he faces financial constraints. Therefore, Haleema, who is a member of a three-person loan group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. The loan will not only help Haleema's husband expand his milk-selling business but will also increase his net income and savings. 

Haleema desires to provide her children with a quality education. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase milk from the farm to resell

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 31 a year old married woman. She lives with her husband and father-in-law in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her husband and father-in-law work at a petrol station, and they both get small monthly income. 

Ekaterine graduated from teachers' college, and works as a teacher at the local public school. Unfortunately, a teacher’s salary is not enough to make ends meet for a family. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make living.  So, she decided to start her own business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Ekaterine’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo in a start-up program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  

With the loan of $5000, she will purchase stock of groceries and open a grocery shop. This will increase the income of her family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of groceries and to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Bajo Irpavi Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento  BAJO IRPAVI está  compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Silvia, tiene 50 años y ocho hijos ya la mayoría independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Bajo Irpavi de ahí el nombre del banco,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como refrescos, dulces, galletas, abarrotes y otros productos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería,  la Sra. Silvia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda más grande y surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio ya que esta es la unica actividad que le permite mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The BAJO IRPAVI business venture bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man. The president of the bank is Silvia. She is 50 years old and has eight children, the majority of whom are now independent. She works selling basic essentials in her neighbourhood store that is located in the Bajo Irpavi district (from which the bank takes its name).

This loan is her first cycle with the institution. She is going to use this loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business, such as beverages, candy, cookies, groceries and other products. Her reason for seeking this loan is the high demand that she is experiencing which is causing her to increase her sales so that she needs to restock her merchandise. 

Silvia faces challenges in her business, specifically the competition, since there are several stores in the district. She is going to use the earnings to purchase more merchandise to stock her store and continue growing more day by day. Her plans for her business are to continue selling and to have a larger and better stocked store. In this way she can make her business grow, since it is the sole commercial activity that enables her to support her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her neighbourhood store

loans.name: Diego Maquey

texts.es: El Sr. Diego tiene 23 años, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene a la  venta variedad de relojes,   su puesto se encuentra en la zona de Villa Tunari de la ciudad  de el Alto, este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, El Sr. Diego va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería, variedad de relojes al por mayor y así de esta  manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería para surtir su puesto, El Sr. Diego  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de producto y el deseo del Sr. Diego es el de terminar sus estudios, y poder ejercer su profesión, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Diego is 23 years old and works as as a retailer. He sells a variety of watches from his stall in the Villa Tunari zone in El Alto City. This is the first loan that he has received from the insitution. Diego is going to use the loan to buy merchandise (a variety of watches in bulk) and, in this way, increase his earnings. His reason for requesting this loan is so that he can buy merchandise to stock his stall. Diego faces challenges in his work, such as the demand for new products, and he will use the loan to offer a better service by stocking a better variety of products. Diego's wish is to finish his studies and to be able to work in the area he studied.  He feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given him by offering him the loan.

loans.use: to buy watches at wholesale.

loans.name: Daysi Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Daysi es una mujer que día a día lucha para salir adelante junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos los cuales en familia se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra de maíz, frijol y café. Con un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el sexto grado y 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura tienen ante sus clientes una credibilidad que los caracteriza como persona humildes, honestos y confiables en la venta de sus productos con precios competitivos en el mercado local y con algunos clientes que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto con calidad.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayuden a darle una seguridad y protección a sus cultivos de bichos como la roca, enfermedades como la roya, etc.

Sus metas son las de seguir incrementando sus cultivos de café sembrando una mejor variedad de grano que sea competitivo en el mercado y atractivo para el cliente e intermediario. sus sueños son los de seguridad fortaleciendo el patrimonio para sus hijos para que ellos puedan trabajar y tener una fuente de ingreso de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Daysi is a women who day by day struggles to get ahead. Along with her husband and two children, she farms corn, beans and coffee. She completed Grade 6 at school and has 10 years experience in agriculture. Her customers characterize her as creditable, humble, honest and reliable. They sell their produce at a competitive price in the local markets and to buyers who come to the area to find quality product.

Daysi has asked Cooperative Comixmul  for a loan to buy agricultural supplies which will help protect their crops from insects, blight etc. 

Her goals are to continue to increase her coffee crops, planting a greater variety of seeds so they can be competitive in the market and attract customers. Their longer term plan is to strengthen their estate for their children, so they can work and have a favorable means to make their living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, shorts, and underwear among other items.

loans.name: Mt Elgon Group

texts.en:
Siliviana is a married woman who is running a retail food shop, selling items like rice, maize flour, baking flour, beans, sugar, salts and other food items. She is running this project together with her husband, who in the previous month was involved in a motorcycle accident, but he is showing a good recovery.  

Siliviana is currently aged in her 40s and has five children: three sons and two daughters who are enrolled in school. She starts working from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit per month.

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the missing food items in her shop. She dreams that one day, she will be able to widely expand her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mt. Elgon, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing food items in her shop.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 34-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children, ages 13, 8 and 4, respectively. She engages in fishing. She sells fish and crab to earn a living. She has been into fishing for more than five years. 

Merlinda requested a loan of 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy materials used in fishing like fishing net and crab net to improve her catch and to increase her income. 

Merlinda would like to improve her fishing business to be able to provide her family with good food and a quality education.

loans.use: to buy materials used in fishing like fishing net and crab net.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old lady from Kakamega region, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. She supports three people in her family as she is a single mother of two children who are 12 and 6 years old, respectively.

Joyce runs a beauty salon and has been in this business for the last three years. Joyce gets a monthly income of 6,000 KES (Kenyan shillings). She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD., which she will use to purchase business assets to help her run the business successfully.

Joyce's dream is to run a successful business and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase business assets for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets, hog feed and vitamins

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. Jamil works hard to provide his family's income while his wife takes care of their children.

Jamil owns a small shop where he sells oil for automobile engines. He not only sells but also changes oil filters. He established his business in 2010 and now he has hired an employee. He grew fast in this field and gained good experience. Jamil is well known in the neighborhood with an excellent reputation.

Jamil is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy a motor generator and a piece of equipment specialized for his work. He is aiming to continue to grow in this field and expand his business so that he may provide his children a good career and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a piece of equipment specialized for his work

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en: Maqsooda, a 54-year-old hard-working woman, lives in Pakistan with her husband and five children. Her husband is a tailor. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs. He wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. He will extend his business if he gets a good amount of profit in the future. Maqsooda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine for her husband to stitch more dresses and to satisfy the needs of clients more professionally. He hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach his desired net income and be able to save for their future. Maqsooda dreams of giving the children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her husband

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 50-year-old lady from Homabay region in the western part of Kenya who supports six people in her family. She is married to Mr. Paul who is also a businessman and supports the family by providing income.

She has a retail shop, which has been in operation for the last six years. She earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase items like sugar, salt, cooking oil and other shop items. She will use her anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to expand her retail shop into a wholesale one and support her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like sugar, salt, cooking oil and other shop items

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 30-year-old motorcycle operator in Changamwe, Mombasa. He is a married man who has no children and his wife provides additional income. He has been in this business for the last four years and has done well.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET Ltd, to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase a second motorcycle for his business expansion and he will use the anticipated profit to service his loan. He hopes to have a successful life in future.

loans.use: to purchase a second motorcycle

loans.name: Anmar

texts.en:
Anmar is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 22 years old and lives with his parents and his two brothers. Anmar, his brother and his father all provide the family's income.

Anmar owns a barber shop, which he established in 2010. Through practice, Anmar mastered this field and has gained an excellent reputation in the surroundings thanks to his professional cuttings and his special respect for his customers.

Anmar is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy two new haircutting chairs, to renovate his barber shop and to buy an air conditioner. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits to provide himself and his family better living standards.

loans.use: to buy haircutting chairs, to renovate his barber shop and to buy an air conditioner

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old, married and has three children. He is in the motorcycle transport business based in Kangundo town and has been in this business for three years. Besides the motorcycle business, he also does farming. He currently makes a monthly income of 23,000 Kenya shillings.

This being his third loan from KADET LTD, he plans to use the amount to service his motorcycle and keep it in good condition. He also plans to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting on his farm. He will use the generated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to grow his transport business by buying more motorcycles as well as invest in dairy farming and supply milk to several places.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle and buy seeds and fertilizer .

loans.name: Lizett Heidy

texts.es: La Sra. Lizett tiene 30 años, se dedica a la venta de computadoras y accesorios para las mismas tiene su tienda en la populosa zona de Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Lizett va a usar este préstamo para la compra de impresoras y accesorios para computadoras,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la compra de este material, La Sra. Lizett enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona existen varias tiendas de venta de computadoras, y utilizara los beneficios en la compra de mas equipos de computación para equipar mas su negocio, La Sra. Lizett es una persona muy trabajadora esta es la única actividad con la que se mantiene,  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Lizett is 30 years old. She makes a living by selling computers and computer accessories. Her shop is in the highly populated area of Gran Poder in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first cycle with the institution. Lizett is going to use this loan to purchase printers and computer accessories. Her reason for requesting this loan is that she does not have enough money to purchase said items. Lizett faces challenges in her business, such as competition, since several computer stores already exist in the area. She will use the loan to purchase more computer equipment in order to stock her store. Lizett is a very hard-working person and this is the only job she has to support herself. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity you are giving her.

loans.use: to purchase printers and computer accessories

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 43 years old and married. For the past 10 years, she has been operating a retail store business. She usually earns about PHP 300 each day. Marivic is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan that she will use as added capital in the expansion of her business. She will buy stocks of easy to sell goods like eggs, vegetable oil, chips, assorted biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and many others. 

The amount she is borrowing will be a big help in making her business progressive. In this case, Marivic will then be able to give a comfortable life to her family and her business will be sustained as well.

loans.use: buy stocks of easy to sell goods like eggs, vegetable oil, chips, assorted biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and many others

loans.name: Cristituta

texts.en:
Cristituta is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in retail sales of food supplements to the people in her place. She has been in the business for more than 20 years now. She is also in the rice farming business. 

Cristituta is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional stocks to sell to her customers. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional food supplements to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an Iraqi youth client who is 20 years old and lives with his parents and his four brothers. Ali, his father and three of his brothers provide the family income and the youngest of them continues his education.

Ali owns a small café where men gather around, drink hot drinks and smoke the very famous Middle Eastern Nargileh. He established his business in 2010 and has gained much experience through practice. Ali gained the respect of his neighborhood thanks to his cheap and competitive prices.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. The aim of this loan is to buy an air conditioner and a motor generator and to install a sign for his café. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so to provide a stable career for himself.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and a generator and install signage for his café

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo porque requiere de iniciar la siembra de granos básicos, es por ello que solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le servirá comprar los insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue favorable porque aumento la producción y sus ganancias las utiliza para cubrir los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y se mantiene el mismo grupo familiar.
texts.en:
José needs more working capital because he needs to begin planting his crops, which is why he is requesting a new loan. The loan will help him to purchase farming supplies, such as compost, herbicides, insecticides, and pesticides. 

The previous loan was helpful because his production increased. He uses his profits to cover the household expenses. His economic conditions have improved and his family remains the same.

loans.use: to purchase compost, herbicides, insecticides, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Zuhriddin

texts.ru: Зухриддину 25 лет. Он женат. Его жена трудолюбивая женщина и помогает ему введению бизнеса. Зухриддин и его жена не имеют детей. Зухриддин более 6 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает овощи как картошка, морковь, лук и т.п. Зухриддин имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства, то есть купле продажей породных лошадей. Он постепенно развевает свой бизнес и становится конкурентоспособным на местном рынке. Зухриддин планирует развевать бизнес дальше и увеличить количество лошадей. Однако он не имеет конюшню и сарай для хранения овощей. Зимой у него нет условия для лошадей и поэтому он срочно должен до наступления зимы, построить конюшню и сарай. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, песок, кирпич и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zuhriddin is 25 years old, he is married. His wife is a hardworking woman and helps him in running of the business. Zuhriddin and his wife do not have children. He has been in the land cultivation for over six years. He mainly grows vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onions and other vegetables. Zuhriddin has an additional income from animal husbandry buying and selling pedigree horses. He steadily grows his business and becomes competitive on the local market. Zuhriddin plans to grow his business further and increase the headcount of horses. However he does not have a stable and a good shed to keep the vegetables. In the winter time he does not have proper conditions for keeping the horses and that's why he needs to build a stable and a shed very soon before the winter arrives. He is asking for a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD to buy building materials such as cement, wood, sand and brick. He waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, sand and brick to build a stable.

loans.name: Rokhilyam

texts.ru: Рохилям, 43 года, незамужем, имеет 1 сына. На протяжении 20 лет занимается торговлей мужской и подростковой одежды, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 20000 сом (KGS). Благодаря неустанному труду и терпению, Рохилям успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса, и ежемесячная прибыль составила 15000 сом (KGS). Рохилям очень приветливая и веселая, а также очень добрая, что дает ей хорошие возможности при продаже одежды покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса  и приумножения прибыли Рохилям обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 30 000 сом (KGS)  на расширение торговли. На доходы от кредита Рохилям хочет дать достойное образование единственному сыну.
texts.en: Rokhilyam is 43 years old, she is not married and has one son. During the twenty years she has been selling men's and teen's clothing, a business which she started with an amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her tireless work and perseverance Rokhilyam has successfully increased the size of her small business and her monthly income which amounts to 15,000 som. Rokhilyam is a friendly and happy as well as kind woman which gives her good opportunities while selling to her customers. With a goal to further grow her business and multiplying her profit Rokhilyam has come to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Parterns for a loan in the amount of 30,000 KGS to expand her sales business. Rokhilyam wants to give her only son a proper education using the income from the loan.

loans.use: to buy men's and teen's clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mignonmide Group

texts.fr: MIGNONMIDE est un groupe constitué de trois personnes dont la représentante (dont la main est levée sur la photo) est nommée Josephine. Les membres du groupe sont des amies du même quartier et qui s’approvisionnent au même endroit. Agée de 53 ans, Josephine est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Benoît et est mère de deux enfants. Parmi les enfants, un est scolarisé. Josephine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. N’ayant pas été à l’école, Josephine vend depuis quinze ans environs, des noix de palme, du vin de palme et du maïs dans un marché du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et de nourrir sa famille. Josephine s’approvisionne au Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que Josephine sollicite un financement auprès de ALIDé, afin d'agrandir son activité et d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu.
texts.en: Mignonmide is a group of three people, whose representative (the one with her hand raised in the photo) is called Josephine. The group members are friends from the same district who get their supplies from the same place. Josephine, who is 53 years old and married to a farmer called Benoit, is mother to two children, one of whom is at school. Josephine lives with her children and husband. She did not go to school and has for the past 15 years or so been selling palm nuts, palm wine and corn in a market in Benin; this enables her to take care of and feed her family. She gets her supplies in Benin. This is the fourth time that Josephine has requested a loan from Alidé so that she can build up her business and increase her turnover and income.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and palm wine.

loans.name: Hashem

texts.en:
Hashem is an Iraqi married client who is 50 years old and a father of four children. Hashem and his elder child provide the family's income.

Hashem owns a small store where he sells fresh fruits and vegetables. He has been operating this business since 2009. He has a hired employee and an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to his competitive prices and his unique way of showing respect to his clients. 

Hashem is requesting a loan of $2,400. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his shop. Hashem intends to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: María Edulfa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se reúne cada quince días en del Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 54 años, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad y estudia medicina en la universidad en Manta.

Doña María ha tenido que luchar muy duro para sacar adelante a su hijo y darle la mejor educación para su futuro, con la ayuda de sus padres hace mas de 19 años decidió emprender una pequeña empresa de fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en el campo de la construcción), en la actualidad trabajan con ella más de 12 personas a quienes les paga un sueldo semanal, los ladrillos entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta la localidad que luego los embarcan y llevan  a distribuir a otras ciudades.

Este crédito es para comprar madera y arcilla para la elaboración de los ladrillos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es tener un camión para entregar sus productos.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño de Tohalla” (Devine Child of Tohalla) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

Here is where María lives. She is 54, she is a single mother and she has one adult child who studies Medicine at the University of Manta.

María has had to work very hard to provide for her son and to grant him the best education for his future; she decided to start producing bricks (a product used in constructions) more than 19 years ago, establishing a small activity with her parents’ help. Nowadays, she pays the weekly wages of the more than 12 employees who work with her. She sells her bricks to traders coming to her community, and they then sell them in other cities.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy wood and clay to make bricks. She has been a member of this Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the support she receives through the loans.

She dreams of owing a truck to deliver her products.

loans.use: To buy wood and clay.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
To earn a living, Wilson engages in a charcoal-sales business in his community. He is 30 years old and married with two children. He aims to improve his business and make it profitable in order to generate sufficient income for his family's future welfare. 

Wilson is planning to acquire more stock of charcoal to retail in the market, however he has limited capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 so he can attain this goal. He hopes that his loan request will be granted in order to work out his plan. He also hopes that he will become successful and financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to acquire more stock of charcoal to retail.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio por lo que requiere de más capital de trabajo, es por ello que solicita un nuevo préstamo; este le servirá para comprar mariscos, pescados, y asimismo verduras, tales como: tomates, chiles, cebollas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior fue favorable, ya que le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtuvo mayores ingresos; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Blanca needs more working capital to invest in her business.  This is why she is requesting a new loan to buy shellfish, fish and vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

The previous loan was favorable and helped increase her inventory and income.  Her economic situation has improved and her family circumstances have remained unchanged.

loans.use: To buy shellfish, fish, tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 37-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse and five children. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop, where he works hard to provide for his family all by himself. In his workplace, he fixes damaged body parts of cars, motorbikes and auto rickshaws. He is well-known in his area since he not only fixes damaged body parts of vehicles, but also provides general blacksmith services. He is a very talented and hardworking person. He established his business in 1998 and grew with notoriety and experience.

Abida has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, to pay the annual rent for her husband's blacksmith shop. She hopes to grow her husband's business and help him increase his profits so that he can continue providing the best for his family.

Abida is very thankful to Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for her husband's blacksmith shop.

loans.name: Jose Alfie

texts.en:
Jose Alfie is a 34-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is the father of a 13-year-old child. He has a fishing business where he catches fish and sells them for a living. He has been in this fishing business for 10 years. 

Jose Alfie has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy a fishing net. This will enable him to improve his catch and also to augment his income. Jose Alfie hopes he can expand his business to be able to provide his family with good living conditions and to continue financing his child's education.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer de 42 años de edad , es madre soltera de 2 hijos, con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en un puesto ubicado en el mercado, anteriormente realizaba la misma labor pero de manera informal junto a otros comerciantes de la zona quienes fueron reubicados en el actual mercado de su localidad. Hace 8 años que empezó con esta labor y siempre ha contado con el apoyo de sus hijos quienes están al pendiente del negocio. Desde muy temprano recibe la visita de sus clientes, quienes en su mayoria son madres de familia  y encargados de restaurantes a quienes ofrece una buena variedad de productos como verduras, cereales, conservas y demás víveres  para la preparación de diversas viandas. Se siente muy contenta con su labor porque se entretiene mucho atendiendo a sus clientes con quienes tiene mucha empatía. Uno de sus grandes objetivos a largo plazo es reunir dinero suficiente para abrir un minimarket puesto que la ciudad donde vive crece constantemente y considera que la calidad y servicio serán una buena herramienta para obtener mayores ingresos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. En esta ocasión desea solicitar 3,000 nuevo soles para abastecer su negocio con mercadería al por mayor tales como arroz, azúcar, sal, aceite, entre otros.
texts.en:
Blanca, 42, is a single mother of two children and lives in a rented house.  She runs a food stall at the market where she sells groceries.  She used to do the same work on an informal basis, selling to other merchants in the area, but they all were transferred to the current town market.  Eight years ago she started her activity and has always been able to count on support from her children who take care of the business.

Early in the morning is when she receives her customers, many of whom are mothers of families and restaurant managers who come seeking a wide variety of vegetables, cereals, canned goods and other groceries to prepare their different foods.

Blanca is happy with her work because she stays busy attending to the customers with whom she has much empathy.  One of her long-term goals is to save enough money to open a mini-market in the city where she lives because it is growing constantly and she believes good quality and service are important tools for earning more income.

This is her first Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support that will allow her to get ahead.  She is requesting 3,000 PEN to stock her store with goods such as rice, sugar, salt, oil, etc.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments (ails,  cube maggi, Gombo séché, etc) et des légumes : tomate, aubergine, choux, etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame AMINATA (la 1èmefemme assise de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse de légumes  à  Kalaban Coro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 11 paniers de tomate, 6 sacs de choux pommés, un panier de  persil et de céleri.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako avec les forains de divers horizons. La revente se fait  au comptant à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame AMINATA espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The six women in the Danaya group are married with the majority of them living in polygamous households. They average 37 years of age with four children each. They all live in Kalaban Coro in the administrative division of Kati (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and their income-generating activities at Kalaban Coro market. The group members have small business selling condiments (garlic, Maggi stock cubes, dried gombo, etc.) and vegetables: tomatoes, aubergines, cabbages, etc.

With a view to expanding their businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Aminata (the woman sitting on the far right of the photo) is a significant vegetable seller at Kalaban Coro. She plans to use her loan to buy 11 baskets of tomatoes, six sacks of round cabbages, a basket of parsley and celery. She gets her supplies in Bamako from stallholders in various places. She resells for cash at Kalaban Coro to a customer base made up essentially of women. Aminata hope to make an average monthly profit of 50,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profits to reinvest in her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à  Kalaban Coro  dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de chaussures plastiques, de condiments et des fruits et légumes (tomate, aubergine, choux et haricot). 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (la femme assise au milieu) est une vendeuse de condiments et fruits et légumes de toutes sortes à Kalaban Coro. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  2 sacs de haricot. Elle s’approvisionne dans leur marché avec les forains des villages voisins. La revente se fait  au comptant  à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
The four women in the Benkadi group are married, with the majority of them living in polygamous households. They average 33 years of age with five children each. They all live in Kalaban Coro in the administrative division of Kati (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other through neighbors, relatives and their income-generating activities at Kalaban Coro market. The group members have small businesses selling plastic shoes, condiments, fruit and vegetables (tomatoes, aubergines, cabbages, and beans etc.). With a view to expanding their businesses, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first group loan cycle.

Mariam (the woman sitting in the middle of the photo) sells condiments, fruit and vegetables of all kinds at Kalaban Coro. She plans to use her loan to buy two sacks of beans. She gets her supplies in the market from stallholders from neighboring villages. She resells for cash at Kalaban Coro to a customer base made up essentially of women. Mariam hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profits to reinvest in her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eloy Rafael

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive el señor Eloy, tiene 38 años de edad, está soltero y vive en casa de sus padres. El está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos él puede financiar su trabajo.

Don Eloy se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de ladrillos, el tiene una pequeña empresa de fabricación de ladrillos (material utilizado en el campo de la construcción), con el trabajan dos personas a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual, ellos trabajan de lunes a viernes y si hay muchos pedidos hasta los sábados y domingos, los ladrillos entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta la localidad y luego los embarcan y llevan  a distribuir a otras ciudades.

Este crédito es para comprar arcilla para la elaboración de los ladrillos. 

Su sueño es seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño de Tohalla” (Devine Child of Tohalla) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

Here is where Eloy lives. He is 38, he is single and he lives with his parents. He has been a member of this Communal Bank since the beginning, and he likes it because thanks to the loans he succeeds in funding his activity.

Eloy engages in making and selling bricks (a product used in constructions). He owns a small bricks producing factory, two people work for him and he pays their salary on a monthly base. They work Mondays to Fridays and even Saturdays and Sundays if they have many orders to deal with. He delivers his bricks to traders coming to his community, and they then sell them in other cities.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy clay to make bricks. 

He dreams of continuing carrying out his activity.

loans.use: To buy clay.

loans.name: Estela Regina

texts.es:
Estela,  vive con su padre de 80 años de edad y sus hijos, todos dependen de su negocio. Ella, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, venta de chocolate por la mañana y   antojitos por la tarde, la agricultura lo hace en dos manzanas de terreno alquilado. 
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar cacao o chocolate, azúcar, café, asimismo insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
Su sueño es que sus hijos continúen estudiando y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Estela lives with her children and her 80-year-old father, who are all dependent on her business. She cultivates corn, and sells chocolates in the morning and corn snacks in the afternoon. She has two blocks of land where she farms her crops. 

Estela requires a loan to purchase cocoa or chocolate, sugar, coffee, and agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides, among other items. This investment will help to strengthen her business activities.

His dream is for her children to continue to study, and to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa, chocolate, sugar, coffee, and agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and pesticides, among other items

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Doña Fidelidad es una mujer feliz, luchadora, emprendedora y que a pesar de sus 52 años de edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos es casada y de su matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de los cuales en familia trabajan la agricultura. Ella se ha dedicado a esta actividad por más de 30 años inculcada por sus padres a muy temprana edad. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de su hogar con algunos vecinos, personas que lo comercializa en pequeña escala en el mercado local, bodegas y otros. Esta actividad les ha dado fruto por mucho tiempo y es el único medio de ingreso que ellos tienen para el sustento de su familia y su hogar cubriendo las necesidades básicas como ser alimentación, vestimenta, medicinas, etc. Que a diario se presentan.

Doña Fidelina solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, herbicidas, entre otros para su cultivo de maíz, frijoles y arroz.

Sus sueños a futuro es tener una amplia plantación la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación por sus hijos, sus nietos, y las próximas generaciones que puedan aprovechar el esfuerzo y la dedicación de ella y de su esposo
texts.en:
Fidelidad is a happy, hard-working entrepreneur who, despite her 52 years of age, still has big dreams.  She was unable to get an education because her parents could not afford it.  She is married and has four children who all work on the farm.

Fidelidad has been in agriculture for over 30 years as her parents taught her the activity when she was young.  She sells her produce near her home to neighbors and people who sell it on a small scale at the local market, stores, etc.  This is her only source of income, and has been for many years, and is what covers her family's basic daily needs regarding food, clothing, medicines, etc.

Fidelina is requesting support to buy fertilizers, herbicides and other supplies for her corn, bean and rice crops.

Her future goals include expanding her plantation and maintaining it so it will be in the family for many generations to come for her children and grandchildren.  She wants the future generations to be able to take advantage of her and her husband's hard work and dedication.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her corn, bean and rice crops.

loans.name: Ana Dinora

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital; este le permitirá comprar ropa tales como: blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, entre otros  y electrodomésticos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar la clientela, asimismo las ganancias las invierte en el consumo de los gastos familiares; con la inversión del crédito de Kiva, mejoro su situación económica y el grupo familiar se mantiene igual.
texts.en:
Ana needs to apply for a new loan to use as work capital in order to buy clothing such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc., and home appliances.

She used the previous loan to increase her clientele and profits which she used to cover household expenses.  The Kiva loan improved her finances and the family situation has remained unchanged.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. and home appliances.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre soltero de 31  años de edad, vive junto a su hijo de 11 años en el CaseríoYoxaja, Aldea Xojola Nahualá Sololá. 
El es hombre amble y trabajador quien tiene el deseo de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de banano y lo realiza en el mercado local.
El ha observado que en este tipo de negocio obtiene  un buen ingreso y ganancia semanal, por lo que de esta manera el puede sostener a su familia mediante lo que realiza. Hace varios  años que inicio esta actividad con el propósito de mejorar su forma de vida.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 4,000.00 para la ampliación de su negocio de compraventa de banano y así mejorar su servicio y sus ganancias.
Su sueño es conseguir más clientes en otros municipios y departamentos del país,  con el objetivo de mejorar sus ganancias para darle una vida de calidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Samuel, 31, is single and lives with his 11-year-old son in the Yoxaja rural community in Xojola Nahualá Sololá.  He is a kind, hard-working man who wants to provide for his family.  Currently he is involved in buying and selling bananas at the local market.

He has observed that this type of business brings in a good weekly income which allows him to support his family.  Several years ago he began this activity in an effort to improve his lifestyle.

Samuel is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 GTQ to expand his banana business and improve his customer services and income.  His dream is to attract more clients from other towns and departments in an effort to improve his profits and give his family a quality lifestyle.

loans.use: To expand his banana business.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, se le presenta la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo porque se encuentra en la temporada agrícola y requiere reforzar su actividad; esta inversión le permitirá comprar 8 quintales de abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros para utilizarlo  en la milpa y para el control de hierbas y plagas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener una cosecha más abundante libre de plagas para sacarlas  a la venta y para el consumo de su familia; hoy en día cuenta con mejores oportunidades  para apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Martin finds himself in need of a new loan since it is the growing season and he wants to strengthen his efforts. This loan will allow him to buy 8 quintals of fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and fungicides and other items to use in the cornfield to control weeds and pests. 

He used the previous loan to obtain a better harvest free from pests which he used to feed his family and to sell. Nowadays he has better opportunities to help his family with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 8 quintals of fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and fungicides among other items.

loans.name: Nusratby

texts.ru: Нусратби честная и порядочная женщина. Она уже 4 цикл кредитуется в ИМОНе. Ей 52 года. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Детям 28, 25, 23 и 20 лет. После смерти мужа она обеспечивала и воспитывала детей сама. Нусратби было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами, так как она в течение 25 лет работает в школе. Сейчас дети выросли и стали помогать ей. Нусратби очень любит свою профессию и является одной из лучших учителей. Ее ученики работают в различных сферах общества, и Нусратби гордится ими. Нусратби уже давно мечтает купить автомашину марки Тико, но так как ее зарплата маленькая и она не может сделать сбережения, она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 долларов США для покупки автомашины. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Nusratby is an honest and decent woman. She has already been given four cycles of credit by IMON. She is 52 years old. She is a widow and had 4 children. Her children are 20, 23, 25, and 28 years old. After the death of her husband, she provided for and raised her children alone. It was very hard for Nusratby to manage her families expenses, as she worked in a school for 25 years. Now her children are all grown up and have begun to help her. Nusratby really loves her job and is one of the best teachers in her school. Her pupils work in different spheres of society and Nusratby takes pride in them. Nusratby has dreamed of buying a Tico brand car for some time now, but as her salary is small and she is unable to have any savings, she has requested a loan. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1700 USD to buy a car. She awaits your kindness and relies upon your charity.

loans.use: To buy a TICO brand car.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is a 62-year-old farmer from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of five grown-up children. Erlinda has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now. She is also involved in a retail store business. Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and additional goods for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm and additional goods for the store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Soleh

texts.ru: Солеху 42 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Его дети еще несовершеннолетние. Его жена Шоира работает на поле. Солех для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью со всеми необходимыми средствами много лет работал в различных местах. 3 года назад он начал свой бизнес перевозкой грузов со своим мотороллером. Он перевозит товары бизнесменов, которые торгуют на местном рынке или людей, которые делают покупки на местном рынке. Солех хочет развевать бизнес, но его мотороллер имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ для покупки нового мотороллера. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Soleh is 42 years old. He is married and has three children in his care. His children are not yet grown up. His wife Shoira works in the fields. In order to provide his family with all the essentials, he has worked for many years in different places. Three years ago, he started his own shipping and transport business with his motorcycle. He transports businessmen's products, which are traded at the local market, or people, who shop at the local market. Soleh wants to develop his business, but his motorcycle is in bad shape. He is requesting a loan to buy a new motorcycle. He awaits your kindness and relies upon your charity.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle his transportation business.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana is 28 years old, married and a mother of two children, ages 1 and 3 years old. She currently does administration work and her husband works in the hospital. Together, they all live in a minority community in Kosovo. 

Mirjana has finally achieved her dream of owning her own home. They have managed to build a new house but they could not finish the facade and the bathroom. 
For this reason Mirjana is requesting a loan to pay for finishing the facade and the bathroom. This loan will help them to be able to finally move into their new house and improve their living conditions. 

She is hoping to have a better life for her children and offer them a better education. Mirjana is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To finish the facade and the bathroom of her house.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 26 years old. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. 

Her husband has a small rent-a-bike business. This is the only source of income for his family. Currently, he is interested to purchase a bike for his shop. Due to the lack of money, however, he finds it difficult.

Therefore Asma has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. This will help him to improve his business, which will gradually increase his net income as well. Asma promises to pay back the loan amount on time. She is so thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a bike for her husband's rent-a-bike business.

loans.name: Natia

texts.en:
Natia is 27 years old from the small town of Sagarejo in the Kakheti Region. She is a mother of two children (7 and 4 years old). Natia's husband works for Georgian Special Forces and gets a monthly salary. Besides that, the family owns a small vineyard and sells the grapes seasonally. 

Unfortunately, the existing income is not enough to make ends meet for the four-member family. So Natia decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan. But the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Natia’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 2,200 GEL, she will purchase second-hand clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community. She will set up a store and offer her customers a wide assortment and well-priced clothing for men, women and children. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Natia, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The start up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to set up a second-hand clothing store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and an additional pig and ducks to raise.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 46, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Danny, a driver, and is the mother of their child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marissa has food stalls where she sells fruit shakes and some street foods. She has stalls in three schools and she has more than ten employees. Her regular customers are her neighbors, the local community and students. She earns a minimum of PHP 15,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy ingredients of fruits shakes, fish balls, siomai, kikiam and hotdogs for her business.

Marissa dreams to expand and have stalls in other schools. She hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ingredients of fruit shakes, fish balls, siomai, kikiam and hotdogs for her business.

loans.name: Hisni

texts.en:
Hisni lives in the southern part of Kosovo with his four children and his wife. His children are between ages of 12 and 17 years old. Hisni's wife is a housewife. In order for Hisni to earn a living, he has been working as an auto mechanic for the last 13 years. Because he is a very professional and hard worker, Hisni has gained and retained many customers through the years. 

Even now, his business continues to grow and expand.  Now, for the first time he is asking for a loan to purchase as an auto mechanic's lift. This loan will help him to generate even more income and attract and serve more customers. He hopes to save money for his family's future so he can achieve his goal of offering a better living conditions to his family. Hisni appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase as an auto mechanic's lift

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a resident of the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. She has been engaged in a crab fishing business together with her husband for more than 12 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fishing nets. With this, they will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more crabs and fish to sell in the market. In the future, Angelita hopes to make their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fishing nets.

loans.name: Marizel

texts.en: Marizel is 36 years old, a single woman known as a lesbian in their village. She aims to become successful and financially stable in the future through her hog-raising business and small variety store to generate income. She plans to improve her piggery business but she has inadequate capital to do it. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to buy the needed hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 20-year-old married mother of one child, who has been working in preparing and selling mouneh (preserved food), at her house since three years ago.
Roula helps her husband in making their living, especially now that they have a small, beloved baby girl, whom they have to work hard to provide with the best living and education ever.

Roula is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy raw materials to start preparing and conserving them for the coming seasons.

Roula hopes to move her home-based business in the future to a wide store to display all of her products and increase her customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to prepare and preserve.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
This is Marcelina. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marcelina hopes to expand her business and have more networks, and she dreams of giving her children an education and a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more herbal medicines and food supplements needed in her business.

loans.name: Raul

texts.en:
Raul is 52 years old and a married man. He lives in a small village of Khulo District with his wife and three sons. Raul requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have a milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. They sell cheese at local markets. Besides this, they have a plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Raul requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Raul has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit Raul will renovate a flat to rent out. The rent will be an additional source of income for the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate a flat to rent out

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She is employed and earns a salary from the employment. She started raising chickens from the salary that she had saved. Now she owns a poultry and dairy farm business. She knew about Milango through friends, and since she wanted to commercialize her business, she decided to join so that she could access credit. 

She is 43 years of age, married, and a mother of four children. She has ambitions of owning more than 20,000 birds in the next five years. She now seeks a loan to buy poultry feeds, poultry baskets and medicine. Extra income that she will raise will go towards her personal savings.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds, poultry baskets and medicine.

loans.name: Afrim

texts.en:
Afrim is very grateful to all of the Kiva lenders for the previous loan he was given.  With this support he was able to repair and buy some new musical instruments and in turn has managed to improve his business due to the better quality sound he has been able to provide to his customers. 

Performing for celebrations and events is a seasonal job, based on weather and holiday schedules, so he also tried to save some money for when he cannot meet his family's daily expenses when business slows down. 

Now he is asking a second loan to renovate his bathroom that urgently needs it because it is very old and damaged. This loan will help him to improve the living conditions and environment for his family, keeping his family healthy. 

He hopes to continue to work as a musical performer in the future as he loves his work and hopes to be able to provide a more secure and stable life for his family. Afrim really appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for this second support!

loans.use: to renovate his bathroom.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi

texts.en:
Greetings from Pakistan! This is 47-year-old Allah Rakhi from Lahore. She is married and has six children. Her last-born attends primary school and is in class 5; the remaining children are doing jobs in different firms.

Her husband runs a retail business selling clothes for ladies and gentlemen. The business has been in operation for almost 10 years. He says the main challenges he faces are competition from bigger retailers who offer longer credit terms and also high import duties when bringing in goods from outside the country.

Allah Rakhi has requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 from BRAC Pakistan, in order to buy a variety of clothes to stock. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her more disposable income to buy food and pay rent and fees for the child in school.

In the future Allah Rakhi plans open more stalls around town and a clothes boutique. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the summer season to sell.

loans.name: Loyola Group

texts.en:
Yona, who is in his late 30s, is married and has three children, one boy and two girls. His children are in school. 

Since 2008, he has had a retail shop, selling different products like airtime, dried foods, rice, beans, sugar, soaps, soft drinks, juices, soda, etc. He is doing fine with his enterprise as well as with his family. He starts working at 8 a.m. and works until 10 p.m. daily and is able to make good returns. 

This will be his 10th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, he purchased more shop items like soaps and sugar. He usually purchases more sacks of rice during the harvest period at low prices and stores them up to resell later. With the profit received, he bought a plot of land and starting making bricks for house building. 

He will use this loan to replenish more items like rice, airtime, soft drinks, etc. He hopes to expand his shop by restocking more items.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group, "Loyola," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more items like rice, airtime, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all are in school. She has no additional family members. She operates a beauty salon at the market on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy hair treatments, relaxers, shampoo and rollers, etc. Her major business challenge is electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to open a retail shop for cosmetics and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include medication, school fees and food

loans.use: To buy braids, shampoo, hair treatments, oils and relaxers.

loans.name: Alaysa

texts.en:
This is Alaysa, 22, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Ronald, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alaysa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Alaysa hopes to expand her business and dreams that her whole family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nienta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nienta est constitué de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 35ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban Coro dans le cercle de Kati (2ème région administrative du Mali); Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de vêtements, des chaussures, des produits cosmétiques (crème, pommade, …) et des tisanes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Nantenin (la 1ère femme assise à l’extrême gauche) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures en plastiques à Kalaban Coro. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché en gros et effectue ses ventes au comptant à Kalaban Coro à une clientèle mixte. Madame Nantenin espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer les besoins du foyer en condiments. Madame Nantenin  ambitionne  d’acheter une parcelle à usage d’habitation pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Nienta group is made up of four married women, mostly from monogamous households.  They have an average age of 35 with four children, on average. They all live in  Kalaban Coro in the administrative circle of Kati (second administrative region of Mali). They met through ties of neighborhood and through their income-generating activities at the market of Kalaban Coro. The members of the group have small businesses selling clothing, shoes, cosmetic products (cremes and pomades) and herbal teas. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan. 

Madame Nantenin (the first woman seated at the far left) is an important seller of plastic shoes at Kalaban Coro. She buys her merchandise in the Grand Market wholesale and makes her sales for cash in Kalaban Coro to a mixed clientele. She hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA which will be used to reinvest in the activity and purchase the condiments needed by her household. Her goal is to buy a plot of land where her children can live.

loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Yrsalatkan

texts.ru: Ырсалаткан, 52 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей (2 дочери и 2 сына). С 1992 года занимается сельским хозяйством- животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 2 000 сом (KGS).  Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 7000  сом (KGS). Благодаря своему упорному труду и целеустремленности, Ырсалаткан на сегодняшний день имеет хорошее  хозяйство: 4 дойные коровы и 15 овец.Супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. Прибыль позволила Ырсалаткан размножить скот в домашнем хозяйстве и тем самым улучшить семейное благосостояние. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ырсалаткан обратилась в «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100 000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Ырсалаткан  планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Yrsalatkan is 52 years old. She is married and has 4 children (2 sons and 2 daughters). Since 1992, she has practiced farming - animal husbandry and crop farming, starting this business with 2000 som (KGS). Her monthly revenue from this business is 7000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work and determination, Yrsalatkan currently has an excellent farm: 4 dairy cows and 15 sheep. Her husband and daughter help her with the farm. The earnings have allowed Yrsalatkan to multiply the cattle in her household and thereby improve her family's well-being.  In order to further develop her agricultural business, Yrsalatkan requested a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle. Yrsalatkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the future expansion of the number of cattle on her farm.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 54 years old and married. She is a mother of seven children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a motorbike mechanic. He is the only earning person in the family. His customers appreciate his services. 

Currently he needs spare parts for his shop. However, he does not have enough savings to purchase spare parts for his work. 

For that reason, Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He will use the loan to purchase needed motorbike spare parts for his shop so that he can continue his work and respond quickly to customer needs. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns.
