She owns a small bakery, and she employs two workers. The employees help her very much to bake a lot of different kinds of bread. They must bake enough to provide bread for all the villagers who are used to buying their bread only from her bakery.

Her first loan gave her a chance to enlarge her business, and now she manages to bake and sell more bread than before. For Armenian people, bread is considered to be holy, and people must never throw it on the ground or spoil it. Because of this regard for bread, Narghush says that she loves her business very much. She works honestly, and she is very happy to provide people with warm, fresh and tasty bread.

She asks a loan, which she will use to buy a lot of flour, in order to bake enough bread for her villagers and to let her business grow.

loans.use: to buy a lot of flour, in order to bake enough bread for her villagers and to let her business grow.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a 38-year-old lady from Manyatta location in Kisumu city which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports one child who is 14 years of age. She is married to Mr. Fredrick who is employed and gives support to the family. 

She has a retail shop which has been operating for the last two years and gets a monthly income of KES 45,000. She is taking her third loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to boost her stock by purchasing items like bar soap, cooking oil and wheat flour. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock and pay school fees for her kid.

Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur and take good care of her family.

loans.use: To Increase her stock.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 27-year-old lady from a place called Rongo region, which is found in the Migori, Kenya. She is a mother and supports four people in her family. She is married to James, who is the founder of the business and supports the family. She has three kids who are 12, 9 and 7 years old.

Emily runs a hardware shop where she sells general goods. She has been running this business for the last 12 years and gets a monthly income of 25,000 KES. She is taking her second loan with KADET Ltd., which she will use to purchase more goods from her suppliers.

Emily will put the anticipated profit back into the business.

Her dream is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Garush

texts.en:
Garush lives in the village Ddmashen, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Unfortunately, his mother died several years ago and his father is very unhealthy. Garush is the only bread-winner in his family. 

From time to time, if there is such demand, he does the work of a tiler, but it is not a constant income for his family, with many problems. So, Garush is engaged in farming and agriculture and the only person that helps him very much is his wife, who takes care of their children and manages to support him with great help. 

Over time, the main source of income has become farming and agriculture. They cultivate potatoes and they breed on their farm two cows, two heifers, ten sheep, five piglets, and twenty chickens. They also manage to sell milk, cheese, macun (Armenian national dairy product), eggs, and sometimes mutton, as well. 

Garush asks for a loan of AMD 250,000 (Armenian drams) to get ready for hay-mowing activities. Garush and his wife send greetings and very much hope that this loan will significantly lighten their work this season.

loans.use: to get ready for hay-mowing activities.

loans.name: Leonor Cecilia

texts.es: Leonor tiene 48 años de edad, reside en la hermosa ciudad de Barranquilla, departamento del Atlántico, conocida nacionalmente como “Curramba la Bella”. Vive con su conyugue y tiene cinco (5) hijos, cuatro (4) varones y una mujer en edades de 18,21,22,27 y 30 años. Su conyugue se dedica al arreglo de bicicletas. Su actividad de negocio consiste en la elaboración de deditos, chorizos de butifarras, chuzos,y refrescos para su consumo, los cuales los vende en un sector estratégico del barrio donde confluyen muchos transeúntes, es una esquina muy popular llamada la redonda, este sector prácticamente es el centro de tres barrios circunvecinos, pues allí colindan estos tres barrios, y se ubican a los alrededores muchos negocios, que hacen de aquel lugar sitio obligado para el transito de muchas personas. Desde el año 1993 inició este negocio, es decir, tiene 20 años de funcionamiento; cuenta que lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes tenían una panadería, con ellos aprendió también a hacer galletas. El negocio lo abre todos los días de 8 a.m. a 9 p.m., sus ventas son de contado, y compra todos sus insumos en el mercado central de la ciudad. Este es su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo aplicará en la compra de harinas, queso, carnes frias, aceite, salsas, un horno y demás ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de deditos, chorizos de butifarras, chorizos y galletas.  Tiene como meta seguir creciendo en su negocio, para continuar apoyando a sus hijos menores en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leonor is 48 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Barranquilla in the Atlantico department, which is known nationally as Curramba la Bella.  She lives with her husband, with whom she has five children (4 boys and a girl), who are 18, 21, 22, 27, and 30 years old.  Her husband works repairing bicycles.  

She works making fried cheese sticks, sausages, skewered meat, and soft drinks for consumption.  She sells them in a strategic area of the neighborhood where many people pass by.  It is a popular corner called La Redonda.  This area is practically in the center of three neighborhoods since they come together there, and there are many stores nearby, which makes it a place many people have to walk by.  Leonor started her business in 1993, so it has been open for 20 years.  She says she learned from her parents, who had a bakery, and she also learned to make cookies.  Her busines is open every day from 8:00am until 9:00pm.  She accepts cash and buys all of her supplies at the central market in the city.

This is her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She is requesting the loan to purchase flour, cheese, fried meat, oil, salsas, an oven, and other ingredients necessary to make fried cheese sticks, sausage, skewered meat, and cookies.  Her goal is to continue growing her business so she can continue supporting the education of her younger children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, cheese, fried meat, oil, salsas, an oven, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Verónica Yenicia

texts.es: La cliente es de Portoviejo.  Empezó hace 3 años vendiendo corviches, ya que no tenía apoyo de nadie para mantener a sus hijos.  Los elaboraba en su casa y sus hijos los vendían.  Actualmente ya tiene su pequeño local en el cual atiende de 3 a 8 pm.  Es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 9 y 7 años; el mayor va al colegio y los menores a la escuela fiscal.  Desea invertir el crédito en la compra de mesas, sillas y la adecuación de un baño en su local.
texts.en: This client is from Portoviejo.  She started out selling ‘corviches’ [fish-filled, deep-fried banana balls] because she had no one to help her support her children.  She’d make them at home and her children would sell them.  She now has a small locale and she’s open from 3-8pm.  She’s a single mother of three children who are 16, 9 and 7 years of age.  The oldest attends secondary school and the younger ones attend the local public school.  She wants to use the loan to buy tables and chairs and to install a bathroom in her café.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and to equip the bathroom.

loans.name: Gabriel Emilio

texts.es: El cliente reside en el sector de Paraíso en Guayaquil.  Se ha dedicado a la venta de frutas y la compra de artículos de reciclaje desde tiempo atrás.  Trabaja solo desde las 5:30 am hasta las 9:00 pm.  Es soltero pero tiene una hija de 15 años que estudia en el colegio fiscal.  Tiene la esperanza de terminar su casa y también de ampliar su negocio.  Actualmente necesita el crédito para poder adquirir una computadora para su hija.
texts.en: This client lives in Guayaquil’s Paraíso sector.  He’s worked selling fruit and buying recyclables for a long time.  He works alone from 5:30am until 9pm.  He’s single but has a 15-year-old daughter attending public school.  He hopes to finish his house and also to expand his business.  He currently needs the loan to be able to buy a computer for his daughter.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has two children and has been farming for three years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is "seeing a calf sucking milk!" Her biggest challenge is "treatment of disease outbreaks." Animals on the farm have been given the name of Lelgina "the white udders."

Eunice was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "I was informed by another Juhudi Kilimo client of its good services to small-scale farmers on asset financing."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "how to make savings to repay loans."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Eunice replied "By selling milk from my cow, I will have enough money to meet my family's needs."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Eunice owns cow(s), poultry, and a bicycle but does not own  a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, solar power, and running water, but does not have electricity, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nibaldo Orlando

texts.es:
Nibaldo tiene 33 años de edad de estado civil unido tiene 3 hijos , vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Nibaldo se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol . Solicita el crédito para comprar  fertilizantes, abonos y semillas

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

El sueño es trabajar y tener mas dinero para dar el estudio a los hijos. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar y un rato ver la television.
texts.en:
Nibaldo is 33 years old, and he has a partner and 3 children. He lives with his family in the city of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

He is a member of the BRUNIQUILDE communal bank, which is located in the Calabi district, in the canton of Ventanas, where the members dedicate themselves to agricultural work.  

Nibaldo works in agriculture, planting corn and beans. He is requesting the loan to buy fertilizers, soil amendments and seeds. 

He purchases supplies in the city of Ventanas every 15 days. With the help of the loan, he will be able to buy these supplies. 

His dream is to work and have more money so he can pay for his children's education. In his free time, he likes to relax and watch a little television.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, soil amendments and seeds.

loans.name: Lilia Esperanza

texts.es:
LILIA tiene 59 años de edad de estado civil soltera tiene 1 hijo , vive con el hijo en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

LILIA  se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insumos, fertilizantes urea, abonos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas o en San Carlos. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos agrícolas.

El sueño es comprar una television de 59 pungadas plasma y una lavadora. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar bingo.
texts.en:
Lilia is 59, single, and has a son. She and her son live in the city of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province. 

Lilia is a member of the Brunquilde Ventanilla Rural Communal Bank, which is located in Recinto Calabi in the Ventanas Region. The communal bank members are  farmers. 

Lilia grows corn and rice. She's applying for a loan so that she'll be able to purchase seeds, supplies, urea fertilizers, and manure. Lilia buys these items in Ventanas or San Carlos. 

Lilia's ambition is to buy a 59-inch plasma television and a washing machine. She likes to play bingo in her free time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, supplies, urea fertilizers, manure.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is 33 years old. She sells retail items. With this loan, she would like to buy more sugar, beans, salt and cooking oil to sell. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, beans, salt and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 35 years old and married with two children, aged 12 and 20 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since 2007 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take of her family.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Jariatu       Y

texts.en:
Jariatu is 25 years old and married, with three children between 3 years and 12 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. 

Jariatu's been in this business since the war ended. She sells soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits in her community. She says that the main problem to her business is a lack of capital to expand her business.

Jariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited, to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Jariatu would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes, and biscuits for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two horses that are needed to operate her extraction equipment.

loans.name: John Mario

texts.es: John a sus 44 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en una tienda de carnes desempeñando la labor de vendedor de mostrador, actividad que realiza hace varios años, adicionalmente trabaja los fines de semana como cocinero independiente, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su esposa. John es un hombre luchador, dinámico y muy dedicado a su familia, por eso siempre está buscando opciones que le permitan ser una mejor persona tanto a nivel personal, como profesional. Es así como se motiva para solicitar el crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el pago de un curso de capacitación en Cocina Fusión, ya que le apasiona todo el tema de la gastronomía y quiere complementar sus conocimientos para así obtener mejores ingresos, que le permitan brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una excelente educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
John, 44, is married with two children.  He currently works in a butcher shop as a counter salesperson, an activity he’s been doing for several years.  In addition, he works weekends as an independent cook earning income to move his wife and children forward.

John’s a dynamic, hardworking man who is very dedicated to his family which is why he’s always looking for options that will lead to his being a better person both personally and professionally.  This is what motivates him to request the loan to pay for a Fusion Cuisine course because everything about gastronomy excites him and he wants to add to his knowledge so that he can earn higher income to provide his family better quality of life and an excellent education for his children.

loans.use: to pay for a cooking class.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Age 26 and a resident from Bovel district of Battambang province, Sopheap is married and a mother of two dependent kids, one school-aged and one younger child.  She and her husband are vegetable growers who plant Chinese cabbage called “Bok Choy”. This is the business that she has had for six years. Sopheap has never been with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) before.  She now forms a group of two to apply for a new loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on labor costs and insecticide for her vegetable garden. She hopes that she can double her income and improve her lifestyle so she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy insecticide for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en: Sinoun is a 41-year-old villager from the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. She has five children, four of whom still rely on her. Three of them are in school and one is too young for schooling. Her main source of income is from wholesale fruit trading. She has engaged in her current business for 20 years, earning about 28,500 KHR per day. Sinoun, who has been with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) for the past two cycles, has fully repaid her past loan with success. She has been able to afford a decent motorbike to support her business and to buy a cow for raising extra income. Now, she is seeking a new loan to buy custard apple and mango for resale. She hopes that she can increase her income in order to keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy custard apple and mango for resale.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tol's Group

texts.en: A woman in her late thirties from the Kampong Cham province, Tol is married and has four children. Her main source of income is from one hectare of rice cropping. She has additional income from her husband's occupation as a motor-taxi driver. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years, earning about 34,500 KHR per day. Tol and the other three borrowers are new to VisionFund (a Kiva partner). Now, she is seeking her first loan to buy insecticide and a good fragrant rice seed to replant. She really hopes to have a higher income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and a good fragrant rice seed to replant.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Khieng

texts.en: Khieng, age 50 and a resident of Kampong Cham province, is a single woman who struggles to make a living off of two hectares of land with her rice farming and pig-raising business. She has been involved in her current business for ages and is able to earn up to 31,500 KHR per day. Khieng, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is applying for a new loan as a first-time borrower to buy pig’s feed and to pay the labor costs for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from both of her businesses and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of labor for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Saruon

texts.en: Saruon, a citizen from Kampong Cham province, is 47 years old and has three children. For her family, rice cropping and soybean planting are the main source of income to provide for daily food consumption. She has been involved in this business for ages. Saruon is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has repaid her original loan completely. Her past loan had a positive impact and has enabled her to improve her livelihood. For this new loan, she is seeking 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy a good soybean for replanting and she will also use a portion to buy insecticide and herbicide for her crops. She hopes to minimize the loss due to pests and gain a triple yield for a high income.

loans.use: To buy insecticide and herbicide for her crops.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en: Mupa lives in Kaloleni near Mariakani, Kenya. She is 59 years old. Mupa is married and has ten children. For the last eight years she has been running a retail shop in her neighborhood. She started her business from the savings that she had made from selling charcoal and farming. She wants to grow her business into a wholesale shop in the next five years. The major challenge that she faces in running the shop is her customers not paying their debts on time. She knew Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy five bundles of flour, one sack of sugar and 50kgs of cooking oil. The extra income that she will raise will go towards paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy five bundles of flour, one sack of sugar and 50kgs of cooking oil.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 35 years old. She is married and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For eight years now, she has been buying and selling chickens. She also runs a tire puncture repair business, alongside the chicken sales business. In the next five years, she wants to operate a large garage. The major challenges that she faces are high transportation costs, and credit customers who don't pay their debts.

She knew about Milango through an employee. Now, she is seeking a loan to buy chickens. The extra income raised from the loan will be used to pay school fees for her children, and to improve the standard of living of the family.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David sells building blocks. This has been his business for the last four years. He has employed five people who help him in the running of the enterprise. 

David now seeks a loan to buy working tools for his employees. He does not have any other source of income, and his family depends on the business for survival. He knew about Milango through friends, and he joined them. The major challenge that he faces in the business is the high cost of transportation.  

The 37-year-old father of four wants to give his children the best education that is available.

loans.use: to buy working tools.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 28 years of age and lives in Mombasa. She is married and she has three children. She runs a retail shop in the area where she lives and this has been her major activity for the last three years. She has one employee who helps her run the business. 

She wants a loan to buy two bundles of flour, cereals and bags of maize for resale. The major challenge that she faces is price instability and inflation. She heard about Milango through her friends and she decided to join to be able to access credit. She has had previous loans with Milango which she repaid without difficulty. The extra income that she will raise from loan use will go towards school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of flour, cereals and bags of maize.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
María tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora con grandes deseos de superación, actualmente desempeña el rol de ama de casa y a la vez tiene 26 años de tener su negocio de venta de lácteos como queso, crema, quesillo y  ademas recientemente ha incluido venta de chocolate. Su puesto de trabajo esta ubicado en el mercado municipal  y gracias a la experiencia y calidad  que maneja en sus productos es muy reconocida y preferida por sus clientes.
       
Los productos lácteos como el queso, la crema y el quesillo los compra en un cantón, y el resto del producto la importa de Nicaragua.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 216 libras de quesillo y 400 botellas de crema. Con la inversión, incrementara el inventario disponible para ampliar su negocio; ya que es muy reconocido la calidad de productos que ella comercializa. Abastecerá la demanda de los clientes, ya que es muy preferida por una gran cantidad de clientes gracias a que doña María ofrece productos de alta calidad.

 En un futuro pretende, tener un negocio mas grande para abastecer a todos los clientes y ademas diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
María, 45, is married with three children.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s currently in the role of a housewife and at the same time has been selling dairy products like cheese, cream and soft white cheese for 26 years and has recently added selling chocolate.  Her work stand is located in the municipal market and thanks to her experience and the quality of the products she carries she’s very well-known and preferred by her customers.  She buys the dairy products like the cheese, cream and soft white cheese in a canton and the rest of the products she imports from Nicaragua.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 216 pounds of soft white cheese and 400 bottles of cream.  With this investment her available stock inventory will increase to expand business since the quality of the goods she sells is very well-known.  She will meet customer demand since she’s preferred by a large number of customers because María offers high quality products.  In future, she intends to have a larger business to supply all the customers and also to diversify her products.

loans.use: to buy cheese and cream.

loans.name: María Reyna

texts.es:
María tiene 40 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 17, 14 y 9 años respectivamente. Es ama de casa; pero  a demás es una mujer emprendedora que toda su vida a luchado para salir adelante,  desde corta edad se dedico a las ventas específicamente a las ventas de verduras en el mercado, esta tarea  la aprendió  de su abuela  quien le heredo un local en el mercado pero  por circunstancias de la vida ella y su esposo decidieron viajar a estados unidos para ofrecer mayores oportunidades de desarrollo  a sus tres hijos, los  2 años que vivió en estados unidos trabajando de ayudante de cocinero  con grandes dificultades por el idioma le sirvieron para darse cuenta de que en El salvador se puede salir adelante y es como decidió hace  4 años regresar a El salvador y comenzar nuevamente con sus negocios, estableciendo una pequeña librería en su casa  ya que en la comunidad no existe ninguna otra.

La mayoría de la mercadería la compra en la capital del país, por que se encuentra mayor variedad de productos pero   tiene que transportarse en autobús aproximada mente una hora  para realizar las compras.

El préstamo será utilizado para surtir de mercadería nueva la librería;  ya que quiere poner a la venta otros productos que son llamativos a los clientes, como ropa, zapatos, cuadernos, etc. Surtirá su negocio ofreciendo una gama amplia  de productos  para tener siempre sus clientes satisfechos  y con esto generar más ingresos. Mejorarando   la calidad de vida familiar  ya que  al mantener surtido  su negocio generar mayores ganancias por ventas  y esto  les dará  a ella  y su familia de disponer  de efectivo  para las necesidades básicas  al menos.

El sueño a futuro de la señora es adquirir un terreno  a orilla de calle para construir un local amplio para incrementar su negocio y así darles la oportunidad a sus hijos de  continuar con sus estudios de educación media y superior.
texts.en:
María, 40, is married and has three children who are 17, 14 and 9 years old respectively.  She’s a housewife but also an enterprising woman who has striven her entire life to get ahead.  She started selling in the market when still very young, specifically vegetables.  She learned this task from her grandmother who passed down a market stall to her but due to life’s circumstances she and her husband decided to travel to the United States looking for better development opportunities for their two children.  The two years she lived in the United States she worked as a cook’s helper but the great difficulties she had with the language served for her to realize that it’s possible to get ahead in El Salvador so four years ago she decided to return to El Salvador and start her businesses once more.  She opened a small bookstore at home since there is no other in her community.

She buys most of her merchandise in the national capital because a wider variety of merchandise is found there.  However, she has to take an approximately one-hour bus ride to do her purchases.

The loan will be used to stock the bookstore with new merchandise because she wants to put up for sale products that are attractive to customers such as clothes, shoes, notebooks, etc.  She will stock the business with a wide range of products in order to always have her customers satisfied and to generate more income this way improving her family’s quality of life because by keeping the business well-stocked her sales will generate higher profits which will give her and her family available cash to cover basic needs at least.

Her future dream is to buy a piece of land at street level to build a spacious locale to enlarge her business thus offering her children the opportunity to continue with their secondary and higher education.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, a 44-year-old hardworking woman, lives in Pakistan with her family. Her husband is a driver. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Shehnaz is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. She is a tailor and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Shehnaz has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and to be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine to stitch up more dresses.

loans.name: Lot's Group

texts.en:
Lot is 59 years old and a married mother of two children residing in Thmor Koul district, Battambang Province. She is a farmer who does rice cropping as the main source of income while her husband works for others for a fee to earn additional income. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years and now she is able to earn up to 31,700 KHR per day. 

Now, in a group of two, Lot is a leader. She is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) who has repaid back her past loan completely. The past loan enabled her to support her business promptly. Now she is applying for 1,200,000 KHR while her joint member is seeking 600,000 KHR. As a leader she will spend her loan portion to pay for her plowing fee and to buy potash to boost her cash-crop. She highly believes that she can earn more income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy potash to boost her cash-crop.

loans.name: Mavatey

texts.en:
Mavatey, 40, is a parent of two children who are still in school. She and the rest of her family are residing in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. 

To overcome the family’s hardship she does rice farming on a one hectare area and sell sweets in local school. She has involved in this business for 20 years. Mavatey has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking for this first loan in order to pay for the university’s tuition fee of her son who is studying in a local university specializing in Management. She hopes this loan will provide financial support for her son’s education on time.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition fee of her son.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Samnang is a 39-year-old mother of two children. One of them is still in school and depends on her. She and her husband are working for others, for a fee, as a main source of her family’s income. She has been doing this work for one year, and it has returned her about 37,300 KHR per day.

This is Samnang’s second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid the previous loan, and it has helped her to provide a decent home for her family's living. So now, she requested a new loan, which she will use to renovate her home. With this loan, she hopes to provide a house with the standard living conditions, and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To renovate her home

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en: Hajran is a 22-year-old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a taxi driver by profession. He drives the car in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the car's engine, because it causes a lot of pollution and consumes too much oil for its working. That is why Hajran requested a loan of Rs 30,000. She will use the loan for her husband, who will buy a new engine for the car. Hajran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the taxi that her husband drives to earn a living

loans.name: Roqia

texts.en:
Roqia had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Twelve years ago she began sewing shoe uppers. She receives orders from a shoe-making factory and she earns enough to contribute to the family's income. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to complete the orders of her customers on-time. That is why she applied a loan of PKR 30,000, through Kashf Foundation. Roqia intends to use this loan to purchase leather and cloth material in large quantities, with some spools of thread and needles. She is in her fifth loan cycle. 

Roqia is hopeful of getting an increase in her earnings and she wishes to spend part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase leather and cloth material in large quantities, with some spools of thread and needles.

loans.name: John Magok

texts.en: John is a client of Finance Sudan. He is a 22-year-old, single man. He has been in the retail business for about three years. He has a shop, where he sells items like sodas, water, juices, flour, cooking oil, eggs, and many other mixed retail goods. He is borrowing a loan of 3,000 Sudanese Pounds, to enable him to expand his shop, by increasing the inventory. He says in future he wants to upgrade his shop into a wholesale, and to marry and settle down to look after his business and family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at his shop, like juices, flour, cooking oil, and eggs

loans.name: Khudoiqul

texts.ru: Худойкул 50-летний мужчина, проживающий в городе Сарбанд на юго-западе страны. У него есть жена и четверо детей. Жена занимается торговлей. Она на рынке города продает овощи. Старший сын уехал на заработки в другую страну. Сам Худойкул до этого дня работал на разных работах, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Теперь он хочет заняться собственным делом и работать на себя. Худойкул решил купить микроавтобус и предоставлять услуги перевозки пассажиров по маршрутной линии города Кургантюбе. Он накопил сбережение на сумму 700 долларов США, остальную недостающую часть он просит в кредит. На сумму кредита и сбережения Худойкул хочет купить микроавтобус марки Газель и приступить к деятельности. Худойкул планирует в день совершать 8 рейсов и работать с восьми утра до восьми вечера. Сейчас он нуждается в поддержке.
texts.en: Khudoiqul is a 50 year-old man, living in the city of Sarband in the south-west of the country.  He has a wife and four children.  His wife is involved in sales.  She sells clothing at a market.  The oldest son left to work in another country.  Before today, Khudoiqul worked various jobs in order to provide for the family.  Now he wants to get involved in his own business and work for himself.  Khudoiqul decided to purchase a minibus to provide passenger transportation services along a route in the city of Qurgantube.  He saved an amount of 700 US dollars and is requesting to borrow the remainder of the money.  Khudoiqul wants to use the loan and his savings to purchase a Gazel minibus and start his business.  Khudoiqul plans to do 8 trips per day and work from eight in the morning until eight in the evening.  Now he needs support.

loans.use: to purchase a Gazel minibus in order to start his own business of transporting passengers

loans.name: Hidoyat

texts.ru: Хидоят жительница города Душанбе. Ей 56 лет. Она замужем и является матерью четверых детей. У Хидоят среднее образование. Она работает уборщицей в компании. Старшая дочь занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев и хорошо зарабатывает. Муж Хидоят работает чайханщиком на свадьбах и мероприятиях. А сын студент, он учится в Аграрном Университете в факультете Гидромелиорации. Он перешел на второй курс и теперь необходимо заплатить за обучение в этом курсе. Сейчас на руках у Хидоят нет достаточной суммы, поэтому единственное решение она видит в получении кредита. Хидоят очень хочет чтобы ее сын получил высшее образование и в будущем стал хорошим специалистом.
texts.en: Hidoyat is a resident of the city of Dushanbe.  She is 56 years old, married and a mother of four children.  Hidoyat has a secondary education.  She works as a janitor at a company.  Her oldest daughter is involved in sewing women's national dresses and has good earnings.  Hidoyat's husband works as a tea server at weddings and events.  Her son is a student and studying in the Hydroland department of the Agrarian University.  He started his second year of studies and now needs to pay for this year's tuition.  Currently, Hidoyat does not have enough money, and this is why she sees obtaining a loan as the only solution.  Hidoyat wants very much to have her son get a higher education and become a good specialist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university education

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика умная и целеустремленная женщина. Ей 23 года. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Она после окончания средней школы в 2008 году поступила в Государственный Педагогический Университет. Она учится в факультете Иностранных языков на 5 курсе. Она с 2011 года параллельно с учебой работает в средней школе. Она преподает английский язык. Малика в свободное время читает зарубежную литературу и смотрит интеллектуальные телепередачи. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Malik is a smart and ambitious 23 year old woman. She is not married and lives with her parents. After graduating from high school in 2008, she began studying at the State Pedagogical University and is currently in her fifth year in the Foreign Languages department. She has been teaching high school English in addition to studying at the university since 2011. In her spare time, Malik reads foreign literature and watches intellectual programs on TV. She has to pay her tuition at the university but she does not have the money and has asked for a loan to cover the cost. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition at the university

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Marta tiene 58 años, es madre soltera de su única hija con quien vive en su casa hecha de material noble. Marta se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y niños en un puesto alquilado en el mercado de su localidad. Opto por este rubro aconsejada por su hermana ya que lo considera algo sencillo y adecuado para su edad y porque no hay riesgo de perder la mercadería que vende porque no son productos perecibles.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida y viandas para reuniones sociales y es donde aprendió a trabajar con bastante esmero y a administrar sus ganancias. Diariamente recibe la visita de sus fieles clientas  a quienes ofrece distintas prendas de vestir como polos, blusas, pantalones, ropas interiores y la mejor variedad de prendas para niños. Mensualmente realiza un viaje a otra ciudad para comprar mercadería al por mayor y personalmente selecciona  las prendas que al regreso pondrá en venta para su negocio. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 3,000 nuevo soles para la compra de mercadería al por mayor y abastecer su negocio con mas modelos de pantalones para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
Marta is 58 years old and is the single mother to one daughter, with whom she lives in her house made of high-quality materials. Marta works selling items of clothing for women and children in a rented stall in her town's market. She decided to go into this work on her sister's advice, because she considers it to be simple and appropriate for her age, and because there is no risk of losing the merchandise she sells because they aren't perishable products.

She previously worked selling food for social gatherings, and that was where she learned to work with great care and to manage her earnings. 

She receives visits daily from her loyal customers, to whom she offers different clothing items like polos, blouses, pants, and underclothes, as well as the best variety of children's clothing. She travels to a different city on a monthly basis to buy merchandise wholesale and she personally selects the clothes that she'll be able to sell upon her return.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to keep moving forward. In addition, she promises to make her loan payments in a punctual manner. On this occasion, she is asking for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy clothing wholesale and to stock her business with more styles of pants for women, men, and children.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 28 years old, married to Cyrin and a mother of two children. She sells groceries in Kangemi and has been in this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 30000 KES.

This will be Judith's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy grocery in bulk. She wants to educate and properly feed her children.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 22 years old. She is married to a house builder. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past four years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs, such as potatoes and cooking oil, for sale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Marie. She is single, and has four children, aged 19, 16, 13, and 7 years old. 

In 2001, Marie established her commercial business. She began her business as a means to raise revenue, working seven days a week and ten hours a day. She earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Marie would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy cartons of slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly income by approximately SLL 500,000. 

In the future, Marie plans to run a standard footwear store or to be an agent for one of the many footwear companies. She is very hard-working and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of slippers to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 24-year-old lady from Kakamega region, which is found in the western part of Kenya. She supports two people in her family.

She has a tailoring shop at her local market. She has been doing this business for the past seven years and gets a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use it to purchase materials for making new clothes, and other textile products. She will use the anticipated profit to add more materials. Her dream is to expand her business and become stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making new clothes.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en:
Josiane is 26 years old. She is married with one child, age two. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for the past two years. 

With the loan she would like to buy more potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a home for her residence.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Verediyana

texts.en:
Verediyana is 52 years old. She is a widow and takes care of four children between ages 24 and 30. Only three go to school. 

With the loan she would like to buy corn and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more corn and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Almakhan

texts.ru: Алмахан,50 лет, вдова, имеет 3 детей. На протяжении 13 лет занимается торговлей женской одежды, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 5000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее целеустремленности и емкой работе, Алмахан успешно увеличила размеры своего небольшого бизнеса, и ежемесячная прибыль составила 6000 сом (KGS). Алмахан очень приветливая и веселая, а также очень добрая, что дает ей хорошие возможности при продаже одежды покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса и приумножения прибыли, Алмахан обратилась в микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 70 000 сом (KGS) на расширение торговли. На доходы от кредита Алмахан хочет обучить детей и сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Almakhan is 50 years old, a widow and has three children.  She has been involved in selling women's clothing for 13 years, having started this business with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her drive and careful work, Almakhan successfully increased the size of her small business, and her monthly profit now amounts to 6,000 som (KGS).  Almakhan is very friendly and happy, and also very kind, which allows her to have good opportunities in selling clothing to customers.  In order to further develop her business and increasing profit, Almakhan requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to expand her sales.  Almakhan wants to use the earnings from the loan to educate her children and to make repairs at home.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Opelia

texts.en:
Opelia is 22 years old. She is married and has an infant daughter, but she lives with her mother, brother and sister. The family lives in a suburb of the capital city, Tbilisi. There are two employed members in the family: Opelia’s sister, who is working at the local bakery, and her husband, who manufactures furniture. Both of them get a small monthly income, which is not enough for covering the everyday expenses of the six-member family.

To provide more income for the family, Opelia decided to start a new business, and she chose to start a pharmacy. Unfortunately, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, because they require a stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program, created by Kiva and Credo, enabled Opelia to get a loan of 3,000 USD and start her business. With the received loan, she will purchase medicines, baby food products, and other products, and start a pharmacy on her street. Opelia will work as an apothecary herself, and hopes that the project will be profitable because there is not any other drugstore in her community.

Opelia is a very enthusiastic young woman, with a great desire to get ahead. This loan will be a great support for the family, as Opelia will be able to generate an income and improve the living conditions for her family members.

loans.use: to start up a pharmacy on her street

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Ramatu from Tombo, Western rural area in Freetown. She is a married mother and blessed with three children between the ages of 7 years and 22 years. Two of her children attend school. 

Ramatu runs a cookery business at home; she sells rice and pure water. She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business ten hours per day and six days per week. Ramatu says that the main challenge to her business is that sometimes if the food is not finished, she will run at a loss.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and renovate her house. 

In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking items like rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 40 years old and married with four children, aged between seven and 18 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to make her daily living. 

She's been in this business since just after she got married and sells fish within her community. She says that at present she is facing insufficient capital to run her business

Fatmata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take good care of her family. In the future, she would like to become an agent of a Fishing Company. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Patient

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Patient from Tombo, western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of one year and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. In 2006 she established her garden business. She began her business because her mother was a gardener so she was trained in that; she needs to generate income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Patient requires a loan in order to buy more garden seeds and waxed cotton for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, Patient plans to expand business more than even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garden seeds and waxed cotton for resale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 25 years old and married with one child who is four years old. She runs a general merchandise business in the Tombo Western Area Rural district of Sierra Leone. She started this business because she wants to strive for her family's welfare.

She's been in this business since 2006 and sells soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits within her community.  She says that the main problem with her business is slow purchasing power during the rainy season.

Cynthia requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan can help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Uma from Tombo Western Area Rural in Freetown. She is married and blessed with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 17. Two of her children attend school. 

Uma runs a food stand business at home; she sells rice, tomato paste and cooking seasoning. She has been running this business since 2003. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Uma says that the main challenges of her business are price inflation and insufficient finance to expand her business.

Uma has requested a loan in order to buy more food items like rice, tomato paste and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, tomato paste and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Rugiatu

texts.en:
Rugiatu is 45 years old and married with four children, ages 4 to 21. She runs a fish business in Tombo in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She started her business within her community just after the Sierra Leone civil war ended in 2002. She says that she is facing a challenge with transportation.

Rugiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business income and change her family's welfare. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: Dato

texts.en:
Dato is 49 years old and a married man, from a small village of Samtredia district. He lives with his wife, Nino, their son, an infant grandson and his mother. Dato's mother is provided with a retirement pension, and his son works as an artisan at the local brick workshop, earning 200 Gel in a month. Dato is very actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two milking cows, a calf and a pig. Besides the animals, they have 300 nut trees. Dato is a very hardworking man and does his best to insure a good harvest. The harvested nuts are sold at local markets.

Because the existing income is seasonal and is not enough for the family, Dato decided to start a new business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests, because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Dato applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved as part of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Credo and Kiva designed to enable the rural poor to start or restart businesses. With a loan of 3,000 GEL, Dato will build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse has been built, he will be able to grow tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. This will increase the income of their family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh was born in 1973; he is married and has five children. He is a government employee, and has a mini-market. 

Saleh has been selling foodstuff for 13 months. He started his project by buying an empty storage and turned it to a mini-market by buying foodstuff to re-sell. He is planning to expand his work by trading new products in the future. 

Now he is requesting a loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, and other foodstuff for his mini-market.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, oil and other foodstuff for his mini-market.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Mariakani, Kenya. For four years now she has been running a grocery store. She sells commodities such as vegetables and fruits. She is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She also owns some rental houses that provide income for her. 

She wants to make her grocery store grow to be able to open other branches of the business. She knew of Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy two crates of tomatoes, a sack of kale, and cabbages. The extra income that she raises from the loan will pay her children’s school fees and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy two crates of tomatoes, a sack of kale, and cabbages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Malindi Kenya. She is married and blessed with three children. She runs a food stall in Gongoni, a settlement a few miles from Malindi, Kenya. She learned of Milango through friends. She now seeks a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and beans. Her husband supports her in the business. She has an ambition of owning a restaurant. The challenges that she has to deal with in the business include lack of funding and competition from other, more established traders. Some customers also do not pay their debts on time. The extra income that she raises from the business will go toward paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and beans.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 45 years old and married with six children. She runs a firewood business in Tombo, a town in the Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She started her business to generate a permanent source of income.  

She's been in this business for four years and sells the wood at her house. She describes her major hardships as inadequate funds to run her business and transportation problems.  

Marie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more firewood to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, she would like to change her business to a standalone food store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to expand her business

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Zainab from Tombo, a town in Western Area Rural District of Sierra Leone. She is married with four children between the ages of 7 and 15. Her children are currently attending school. In 2010, Zainab established her local food business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Zainab requires a loan in order to buy more ground nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future; Zainab plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is 43 years of age, and she is a single mother of two.  

She has been running a grocery store for more than ten years now. She sells vegetables and fruits in her store, where she has employed one person to help her run the business. She has an ambition of growing the business from retail to a wholesale kind of business in the next five years. 

Lydia knew about Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she could have access to credit to fund the business. She now seeks a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits for resale. The challenges that she has to deal with in the business include competition and her customers not being faithful in paying their debts. 

The loan will improve her living standards as a result of the extra income that she will raise.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. She runs a retail shop, where she sells commodities like sugar, rice, flour and bread, among others. She has one employee who helps in the running of the business.

She knew about Milango through friends, who invited her to join so that she could access credit and grow her business. She seeks a loan to buy a sack of rice, sugar and flour, for resale at her shop. The major challenges that she faces include price fluctuations and inflation effects. The extra income that she raises from the loan use will help her to pay school fees for her children, and make their standard of living better.

loans.use: to buy inventory, including a sack of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson lives in Mariakani area in Kenya. He runs a capentry shop that has been in operation for five years now. He has had Kiva loans before - which he repaid without any challenges - and now he seeks a loan to buy 30 pieces of timber, which is his raw material. 

He wants to be a leading furniture seller in his town. He doesnt have any other source of income. The extra income that he will raise will improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to buy 30 pieces of timber.

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 47 years old and divorced, with five children between the ages of 18 years and 30 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. 

She's been in this business 15 years and sells fish within her community. She says that, at present, her business is doing well because, out of the profit, she is able to take care of her family.

Mabinty requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and put a roof on her house. 

In the future, Mabinty would like to expand her business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale.

loans.name: David Ricardo

texts.es:
David tiene 42 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Posee mucha experiencia en la actividad productiva que realiza (agricultura); ya que toda su vida se ha dedicado a dicha actividad, la aprendió de sus padres y lo sigue haciendo con su papá 

Camina 600 metros a pie  hasta llegar al rio grande donde se embarca en una canoa; para cruzar el rio luego camina 1 kilómetro hasta donde aborda un autobús o pick up para llegar a la ciudad, donde compra los insumos para su cultivo 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar  fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas para su cultivo de maíz. De esta forma, le dará a su cultivo los insumos necesarios para que se desarrolle y al final obtener una cosecha satisfactoria.

Su primera proyección, es instalar  su propio servicio de energía eléctrica y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
David is 42 years old, in a relationship, and has one child. He has a great deal of productive experience in agriculture. David has dedicated his entire life to this trade, which he learned from his parents. He continues to work with his father.

David walks 600 meters until he reaches a large river that he must cross by using a canoe. When he reaches the other side, he must walk an additional kilometer in order to catch a bus or pickup truck that will take him to the city where he can buy farming supplies.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and fungicides for his corn crop. This money will enable him to provide his crops what is needed to develop so that he can obtain a satisfactory harvest in the end.

His main goal is to make improvements to his home and to have his own electricity source installed.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and fungicides for his corn crop.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
Rupisha is an active and energetic married lady. She is 43 years old and is a permanent resident of Bolangir town of Odisha, India. The lady sitting third from the left with a raised hand in the photograph is Rupisha. She resides with her husband and one son of 20 years and four daughters of 18, 16, 14 and 10 years in a small mud house.

In the year 2010, she, along with five other like-minded women of her locality, formed a group named “Maa Durga” for availing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to develop her business. To engage herself and earn some income, Rupisha started a dry food-making and selling business five years ago with her own investment. 

The local name of the dry food is “badi”. Traditionally, the badis have been prepared by grinding the urad pulse (split black gram dal) in a sil-stone (traditional stone grinder, operated manually). Badi is a food item which can be eaten with rice, even by roasting it in fire. It is also a food item that tastes very good when it is fried with onion and garlic and is eaten with overnight-cooked water rice (pakhala). So, it is very popular in Odisha. 

Rupisha prepares six/seven types of badi and supplies at wholesale to the retailer twice a week. From this business, she earns a monthly income of 7,000 INR. With this small income, she barely manages her family's expenses. So, she wants to increase the volume of her business to earn some extra income. 

To acquire maximum output, Rupisha wants to purchase a grinder for grinding split black gram dal and purchase two quintals (200 kilograms) of black gram for stock. This will save her time and energy, and also reduce the purchasing cost of black gram. Rupisha is confident enough to have a business of her own and hopes to construct a house. 

The other five group members are Bishakha, Sukanti, Malti, Sobhagini and Kunti, managing businesses of tailoring centre, vegetable vending, badi/papad-making and selling, furniture works, and tiffin centre respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a grinder for grinding split black gram dal, and also purchase two quintal of black gram.

loans.name: Kha

texts.en:
Kha is 44 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family consisting of eight children. She supports her entire household via cassava farming, soybean farming, and working for others for a fee. This is the business that she has had for 25 years. 

Kha is the first cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now seeking 1,200,000 KHR in order to buy potash, insecticide, and to pay for a weeding fee. She hopes that she can gain high yield better than before so that she can increase more income and renovate her house to a better condition.

loans.use: to buy potash, insecticide, and pay for a weeding fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dy's Group

texts.en:
A mother of one child residing in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Dy is a farmer who grows rice on a two hectare area. The current business, which she has had for about two years, has returned her about 15,400 KHR per day. After offsetting her daily expenses, she can manage to save about 7,800 KHR per day. 

This is the first micro-loan for Dy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is applying for 1,000,000 KHR while her joint-borrowers are seeking 600,000 KHR each. In her group of three, she is the leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her cash-crop and pay for her transplanting fee. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner and improve her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy potash for her cash-crop and to pay for her transplanting fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sinan's Group

texts.en:
Sinan, 36 and a villager from Kampong Cham province, is a married mother of two children. For her, one hectare of rice cultivation is the main source of her family’s income. Her husband also helps her to earn additional income via working at construction site. The current business has returned her about 21,900 KHR per day.

Sinan and two other fellow group members are in the same group as the first-time borrowers applying for 200,000 KHR each. As a group leader, Sinan will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to boost her crop output. She hopes that she can make more income and expand her rice farming business on a bigger scale.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to boost her crop output.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Moeun, a parent of six children (two of whom are in school), is 48 years old and a villager from Sangke district of Battambang province. To support her family for the daily basic needs she grows rice and her husband works for others for a fee. This is the business that she has had for 10 years. Moeun has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for past five cycles and has fully repaid back the loans. 

Her past loan enabled her to improve her lifestyle in a good condition and keep her children in school. Now she is seeking a loan for 600,000 KHR while her co-borrower is seeking 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for her plowing fee, buy rice seed, pay for her transplanting fee. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her business better than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for her transplanting and plowing fees.

loans.name: Chhengleang's Group

texts.en:
Chhengleang is a villager in a rural area in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. As a 49-year-old mother, she has to support two out of three children as they are still in school. To overcome her family’s daily expenses she grows rice on one and a half acres of farmland, while her husband works as a village leader. She has been with this business for 20 years. 

Chhengleang has been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) for the past one cycle already. She has successfully repaid back to her past loan and it helped her to improve her business to better than before. Now she leads a group of four members to request the new loan. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield to sell at a good price to support her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Mariakani, an area a few miles from Mombasa, Kenya. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last six months. He was introduced to Milango by a group of his friends at a time when he wanted to access credit and expand his business operations. He seeks a loan to buy mangoes, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and lemons for his business. He also supplies charcoal for those who use it for cooking in food cafes. 

In the next five years he wants his business to be stable enough to support itself. He is married and blessed with three children, all of whom are adults. The loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy mangoes, bananas, potatoes, tomatoes, and lemons.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia, 48, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a farmer and is the mother of their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Nelia maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Nelia hopes that her business will flourish, and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 60 years old. She sells sorghum and banana juice. She has been selling these products for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. With the profits from the business, Cecile will reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Theodette

texts.en: Theodette is 26 years old. She is married to a businessman. They both sell foodstuffs. Theodette has been in the business for the past year. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes to sell. With the profits from the business, she will reinvest in the same business with an intention of becoming a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 37 years old. She is married with four children. She has been selling beans, potatoes and sorghum for the past five years. She has requested the loan to buy more potatoes and beans for sale. She plans to use the profits for putting aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and beans for sale

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 28 years old. She is married and together with her husband has two children. She has been in the business of selling foodstuffs for the past five years. With the loan, she plans on adding more beans and corn and sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, corn and sorghum for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 62 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have two children. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and beans for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes and beans for sale

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 31 years old. She sells cattle and has been in the business for the past four years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows and goats for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house. She aims to make her business prosper in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Albertine

texts.en:
Albertine is 46 years old. She is married to a house-builder and they have two children. 

With the loan, Albertine would like to buy more beans and potatoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make savings and to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy more beans and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mauricio De Jesús

texts.es: Mauricio, a sus 21 años de edad, vive con sus padres y es soltero. Actualmente se dedica a estudiar, ya que por falta de experiencia laboral le ha  sido difícil conseguir oportunidades de empleo, por lo tanto depende económicamente de sus padres. Es un joven enérgico, activo, con visión y ganas de pogresar, por ese motivo quiere prepararse  para ser todo un profesional en el área de gastronomía, que es el tema que lo apasiona. Por esa razón solicita su primer ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en el pago de un curso de capacitación en Cocina Fusión, ya que esto le permitirá abrirse oportunidades en el campo laboral como chef profesional y, de esta forma podrá obtener los recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar y ahorrar para cumplir en un mediano plazo, el sueño de montar una pizzería en un local propio, que le permita manejar su propio tiempo y crecer, tanto a nivel personal, como profesional, de esta forma podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar un mejor bienestar a sus padres.
texts.en:
21-year old Mauricio is single and lives with his parents. At the moment he is a student as it has been difficult for him to get a job due to his lack of work experience. He is financially dependent on his parents.

Mauricio is an energetic, active young man with vision and the desire to get ahead. He wishes to do all he can to be a professional cook, a field he is passionate about. For this reason he is seeking his first loan so he can pay for a training course in Fusion Cooking.  This will open up work opportunities as a professional chef. Mauricio would then be able to contribute to household finances and save some money to complete his studies in the medium term.

His dream is to open his own pizzeria so that he can manage his own time and grow, both on a personal and a professional level. He will be able to improve his quality of life and better support his parents.

loans.use: To pay for a course in Fusion Cooking

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a pool table to provide his services to customers in nearby villages.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Sarah from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with one child, age seven years. Her child is going to school. After the war, Sarah established her used clothing business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of sufficient capital to run her business.

Sarah requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. In the future, Sarah plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Gyavira

texts.en:
Gyavira is a 33-year-old man who lives in the rural area of a major town. He has a family of three children whom he takes care of. Gyavira  has a 'shamba' (field)  of banana trees where he reaps his bi-weekly income that sustains his family and also meets his loan obligations. He says he has managed to send two of his three children to school using the money he earns from the 'shamba'.

Of recent he complains of the bacterial wilt that has somewhat retarded his output and yields. He however hopes to use the loan extended to him to mulch his 'shamba' with dry grass now that it’s a dry spell to reduce evaporation that leads to loss of soil moisture.

He extends thanks to Ugafode for the support through provision of interest-subsidized loans to farmers.

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Kai

texts.en:
Kai is 45 years old and married with two children, ages 12 years and 20 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to earn her daily living. Her husband is not working at present.
