She's been in this business since just after she got married and she sells fish within her community. She says that at present her business is doing well because out of the profit she was able to take of her family.

Kai requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack is a 41-year-old man who lives on the outskirts of a main town. He has a family of four children whom he takes care of, along with two others who are orphans from his elder brother who succumbed to death a few years back.

Isack is a cattle keeper who rears crossbreeds that he mixes with local varieties of cattle. He also does extensive banana farming on a section of his farm land of about 12 hectares.

Isack says he managed to use his previous loan to employ veterinary personnel that have helped improve his varieties through crossbreeding and also increase his daily milk output to 25 litres a day. He says he earns more from banana harvesting an activity he started way back in 1986 to boost his family income. He says he intends to use the loan acquired to buy natural fertilizers to improve his banana 'shamba' (field).

His main challenge with banana agriculture is the banana bacterial wilt that has struck the area recently, destroying  big chunks of his possible output. He commends Ugafode for helping him improve his yields. He is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick lives in Mariakani, Kenya. He prepares local wine (palm wine) and sells to his customers. He has ambitions of growing his business to be a successful bar. He also sells water to the local residents. He learned about Milango through friends who asked him to join. He now seeks a loan to buy 60 litres of palm wine for his business. He also wants to buy a cow and a donkey which will help him to supply water to people. 

The major challenge that he faces is bad debts and competition. He is married and blessed with three children. The extra income that he raises will help him pay school fees for his children and give them a better life in future.

loans.use: to buy 60 litres of palm wine

loans.name: Bob

texts.en:
Bob  runs a transport business as he has done for the last seven years. The 32-year-old father of two seeks a loan to fuel his vehicle back to the road. He does not have any other source of income and this business is what his family solely depends on. He has ambitions of of owning car hire company in the next five years. 

The major challenge that Bob faces is the high price of fuel. He learned about Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy fuel for his vehicle. The extra income that he will raise from the loan will help him pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy fuel

loans.name: Adriana Mireya

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Divino Niño de Tohalla se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 22, 20, 16 y 12 años  de edad,  los  dos menores  estudian en colegio. Su esposo tiene una granja avícola.

Doña Adriana realiza el crédito para ella y también para su marido el cual tiene una granja donde cría de pollos,  mientras él se encarga de esto ella por su parte tiene un almacén en el cual vende balanceado, granos, en si todo tipo de alimentos de aves y chanchos, así como también medicinas y químicos utilizados en la agricultura y cría de animales, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 que regresa a su hogar ya que este almacén lo tiene en un local que arrienda en el centro de la ciudad donde vive, lleva más de un año con su negocio y  sus ventas cada vez son mayores.

Este crédito es para comprar alimentos, balanceados y medicinas para animales, para su negocio y para la granja de su marido. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Su sueño es cada día mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
“Divino Niño de Tohalla” (Devine Child of Tohalla) is a Communal Bank that meets every fortnight in the Montecristi Canton, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; here is where the famous straw hats come from.

Here is where Adriana lives. She is 37, she is married and she has four children aged 22, 20, 16 and 12. The two youngest children go to school. Her husband owns a poultry farm.

Adriana is requesting a loan for herself as well as for her husband, who owns a poultry farm breeding chickens. While he engages in this activity, she runs a store where she sells balanced feed, grains and every kind of chicken and pig food, as well as medicines and chemicals used in agriculture and animal breeding. Every day she starts working at 8 am and goes back home at 6 pm, as her store is located in a locale she rents in the center of her home town. She has been engaging in this activity for more than one year and her sales increase on a constant basis.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy balanced feed and animal medicines for her shop and for her husband’s farm. She has been a member of this Communal Bank since the beginning, and she likes it because she has started her activity thanks to the loans.

Her dream is to improve her activity on a daily basis.

loans.use: Comprar alimento, balanceados y medicinas para animales.

loans.name: Roberto Narciso

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 46 años de edad de estado civil casado tiene 3 hijos, vive con la familia en la Ciudad de ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es Integrante de la VRC BRUNIQUILDE, se encuentra ubicada en Recinto Calabi, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Roberto se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos, fertilizantes, abonos y semilla ademas comprar un poco de pollos.

Las compras de los productos las realizará en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días. Con La ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los insumos.

El sueño es trabajar para comprar mas terreno y seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Roberto is 46 years old, is married, has 3 children and lives with his family in the city of Ventanas in the province of los Ríos. He is a member of the Bruniquilde communal bank, which is located in the Calabi precinct, part of the Ventanas canton. The members make a living from agricultural work. 

Roberto makes a living from agriculture, from planting corn. He is asking for the loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure and seeds, and also to buy a few chickens. The products will be purchased in the city of Ventanas every two weeks. He will be able to buy the supplies with the help of the loan.

His dream is to work to buy more land and to keep planting. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, manure and seeds, and also to buy a few chickens

loans.name: Edis Yojana

texts.es: El trabajo persistente de Edis y su cónyuge lo realizan diariamente para lograr poco a poco construir opciones de éxito futuro para su hijo, hoy en la edad de 10 años. Ellos tienen un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas y refrescos, ubicado en un corredor de mucha actividad peatonal, donde ofrecen al público perros calientes, hamburguesas, salchichas y papas fritas, asados y combinaciones de estas acompañadas de gaseosas, te u otras bebidas frías, que su clientela pide de acuerdo al gusto de cada uno de ellos. Su trabajo lo realizan de lunes a jueves desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 12:00.m. y de viernes a domingo desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 2:00 a.m.; aunque la competencia es muy alta, el negocio de Edis se sostiene por la calidad de sus productos, los precios competitivos y atención esmerada que profesan a sus clientes. En este negocio trabajan Edis, su cónyuge y un empleado. Su meta mas adelante es lograr instalaciones locativas de excelencia y poco a poco se prepara con su esposo para ello. Hace un año lo presentamos a KIVA para su primer credikiva, sin embargo, no fue financiado por limite de tiempo; ahora lo estamos presentando nuevamente para que sea su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará de contado un congelador nuevo, y en mayor volumen, insumos para las comidas rápidas, como salsas, empaques y refrescos, pues necesita atender bien a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y por eso cualquier esfuerzo que realice trabajando, está dirigido a producir cada vez más ingresos, con el fin de alcanzarlo.
texts.en:
Edis and her husband have regular jobs that they do every day so they can slowly build a successful future for their 10-year old son. They sell fast food and soft drinks in a busy pedestrian street where they serve hot dogs, hamburgers, fries, sausages, cooked meat etc. to the public as well as soft drinks, tea, and cold beverages--whatever their customers ask for.

They work Mondays to Thursdays from 4pm to midnight, and Fridays to Sundays from 4pm to 2am. Although there is a lot of competition Edis's business is doing well because of her competitive prices and conscientious service. Edis, her husband, and one other employee work in the business.

Her future goal is find more excellent locations for her stands and she and her husband are slowly working towards this. A year ago she asked for a loan from Kiva but it wasn't granted because of time restraints. Now she is asking once again for her first loan to buy a new freezer on account and larger volumes of supplies for the fast food such as sauces, packaging, and soft drinks which she needs for her customers. Edis's dream is to have a house of her own and to this end she is prepared to put in as much effort and hard work as is needed.

loans.use: buy a new freezer and larger volumes of supplies for the fast food such as sauces, packaging, and soft drinks

loans.name: Benkadi   Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI   II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Massoukou un des villages de  préfecture de Dioila, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide, du mil. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Molobaly la première personne à droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice de 135. 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The members of this group called BENKADI II are married women with an average age of 40 and have on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Massoukou, one of the villages of the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali. 

They work together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the intention of better organizing their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are peanuts and millet. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Molobaly, the first person on the right, standing, intends to buy farm inputs, tools, and pay plowing fees to maintain one and a half hectares of millet and peanuts. Her crops are sold at the level of the town of Marka Coungo, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 135,000 F CFA more or less each growing season. 
.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, weeding and tools.

loans.name: Djiguiya  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe  DJIGUIYA  I sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sokourani un des villages de  Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre  l’arachide, du mil et du sésame. Elles sont à leur quatrième  collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt,  Nadjition la deuxième personne à droite  dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 ha de mil et d’arachide 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Marka Coungo après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle réalise un bénéfice de 55 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of this group called   DJIGUIYA  I are married women with an average age of 41 and have on average four children. They mostly live in polygamous families in Sokourani, one of the villages of Dioila, Koulikoro region, second administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the intention of better organizing their activities at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are peanuts, millet and sesame. They are on their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this loan, Nadjition, the second person on the right, standing, intends to buy farm inputs, tools, and pay plowing fees to maintain about one hectare of millet and peanuts. 

Her crops are sold at the level of the town of Marka Coungo, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. She makes a profit of 55,000 F CFA, more or less, each growing season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding and tools.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 30 years old and married with two children,  1 year and 12 years old. She runs a general merchandise business in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. 

She's been in this business since 2008 and sells sodas, milk, cigarettes and biscuits with her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is lack of capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy purchase more sodas, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sodas, milk, cigarettes and biscuits for resale

loans.name: Bonifride

texts.en: Bonifride is 36 years old. She is a widow with two children. Both of the children go to school. She sells rice, cooking oil and potatoes; it is from this standpoint that Bonifride is requesting a loan to buy more of those products to sell them in a large volume. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 40 years old and married with four children between the age of 10 years and 20 years. She runs a general store in Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business since 2006 and sells sets of pans and pots within her community.  She says that the main problem for her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more sets of pans and pots and a  variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her expand her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more sets of pans and pots and a variety of food containers for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 57 years old. She sells bananas and has been running the business for the past 12 years. She has requested the loan to buy more bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for sale

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en: Emerance is a mother of one child aged one. Her husband works as a businessman. She sells 'andazi' and has been in the business for eight months. With the loan, she would like to buy more 'andazi' (balls of fried dough) for resale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more 'andazi' (balls of fried dough) for sale.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 45-year-old Ramatu, from Tombo, a western rural area in Freetown. She is married to a fisherman and blessed with three children between the ages 6 years and 25 years old. Two of her children attend school. 

Ramatu runs a pharmacy business within a busy market area. She sells malarial drugs, pain tablets, and blood syrup. She has been running this business since 2009. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Ramatu says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and insufficient financing to expand her business.

Ramatu has requested a loan in order to buy medical drugs to expand her drug store. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to increase her business. In the future, she plans to build a clinic. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy medical drugs to expand her drug store.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is married and has three children, one of whom goes to school.

With the requested loan proceeds, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and potatoes for re-sale purposes. The profits from her business will be saved for future use.

loans.use: To purchase additional rice, sugar and potatoes

loans.name: Yainkai

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 35-year-old Yainkai from Tombo Western, a rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children between the ages of five and twelve years old. Two of her children attend school.

Yainkai runs a food production business from her home (i.e., she sells cooked food at her house). She has been running this business since 2008. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Yainkai says that her main business challenges are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Yainkai has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items such as rice, palm oil, and seasonings. The extra income she expects to generate from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to expand her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase additional cooking items (e.g., rice, palm oil, and seasonings).

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is 51 years old. She is married and has ten children, all of whom go to school.

For the past 12 years, she has been in the business of selling bananas. With the requested loan proceeds, she would like to buy more bananas for re-sale purposes. The profits she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan will be saved for future use.

loans.use: To purchase additional bananas for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 28-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western, a rural area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children between the ages of two and ten years old. Two of her children attend school.

Kadiatu runs a food stand business from home; there, she sells food items such as rice, tomatoes, and seasonings. She has been running this business since 2007. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Kadiatu says that her main business challenges are price inflation and insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items such as rice, tomatoes, and seasonings. The extra income she expects to generate from this loan will allow her to educate her children and to expand her business. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase additional food-related items (e.g., rice, tomatoes, and seasonings).

loans.name: Elmer Yovany

texts.es: Elmer, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Hace diez años el aprendió a realizar trabajos de reparación de vehículos. Presta el servicio de enderezado y pintura. Este negocio lo tiene establecido en un local donde alquila. Para mantener el negocio ha podido invertir dos préstamos anteriores. El préstamo actual es el tercer ciclo y es por 20,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar materiales como pintura, lijas, flex etc. Para enderezar y pintar vehículos que tiene pendientes de sus clientes. Su meta es prosperar económicamente en su negocio y poder terminar de construir una vivienda para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elmer, 28, is single, has three children and lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro. Ten years ago, he learned how to repair vehicles. He offers repair and painting services. He has this business established in a place that he rents. In order to maintain the business he has had to invest in two previous loans.

The current loan is the third cycle and is for 20,000 lempiras, with which he will buy materials like paint, sandpaper, buffer pads, etc. This is to repair and paint his customers' vehicles, which he has pending. His goal is to prosper economically in his business and be able to finish constructing a home for his children.

loans.use: to buy materials for the painting of vehicles including paint, buffer pads, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Altagracia Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Altagracia, 37 años de edad, es originaria  de la ciudad de León, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Empezó su negocio hace 7 años el cual ha sido su única fuente de ingreso. Anteriormente se dedicaba al trabajo doméstico. Ella sale a vender sus tortillas de manera ambulante en los mercados, estaciones de buses y en su vecindario.
Una de sus metas es que sus productos se comercialicen en toda la ciudad de León. El préstamo lo solicita para comprar materia prima como: maíz, leña y cal.
texts.en:
Altagracia, 37, is a native of the city of León. She is married and has three children. She began her business, which has been her sole source of income, seven years ago. Before that, she made her living doing domestic work. She works as a street vendor, selling her tortillas in markets, bus stations, and her neighborhood.

One of her goals is for her products to be sold throughout the city of León. She is seeking a loan to buy necessities for her business like corn, wood, and lime.

loans.use: to buy corn, wood, and lime.

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman lives in Kongowea, Kenya. He has a vegetable farm and a photography business. He has had previous loans with Kiva which he repaid without difficulty. 

He knew Milango Financial Services through friends and he seeks a loan to buy film, batteries, frames, and photopapers for his business. Suleiman wants to grow his business, to be able to employ and serve all the people in his area. 

The major challenges that he faces include competition and inadequate capital. The income from the loan will help him improve his living standards and also take his children to school.

loans.use: to buy film, batteries, frames, and photopapers for his business.

loans.name: Ormecinda

texts.es:
La Señora Ormencinda se encuentra realizando su tercer crédito en el grupo de crédito Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive por el sector del Arenal en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Ormecinda es oriunda del vecino país del Perú, se encuentra desde hace 12 años en el país país, tiene 46 años de edad, está separada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 28, 26 y 24 años, todos sus hijos son solteros, su primer hijo es especial y vive en este país ya que sus dos últimos hijos trabajan y viven en el Perú, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Ormecinda se dedica a la venta de Bon Ice (helados) de domingo a domingo en su tiempo libre, pero desde hace 2 años también se dedica a la atención de un pequeño bar y restaurante, en el cual labora de domingo a domingo sin horario. 

Su nuevo crédito va a  invertir en la remodelación de su local, en la compra de mesas y sillas que aun le hacen falta. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ormencinda is now on her third loan with the credit group Mujeres Triunfadoras [Triumphant Women]. She lives in the Arenal section of the city of Cuenca, a place with a cool climate. It was designated as a World Heritage Site in 1999 due to the beauty of its architecture. The cuisine is varied and captivates the palates of all who visit. The people are friendly, gentle, and maintain the culture and traditions of their towns. 

Ormecinda is a native of the neighboring country of Peru. She has been in this country for the last 12 years. She is 46 and separated, but she has three children who are 28, 26, and 24, all of whom are single. Her eldest lives in Ecuador and her younger two sons live and work in Peru. She doesn't have her own house, so she rents one. 

Ormecinda makes her living selling Bon Ice (ice cream), every day of the week in her free time. For the last two years, she has also been running a small bar and restaurant, where she works every single day without a fixed schedule.

Her new loan will be to in invest in remodeling her business's location as well as to buy tables and chairs that she needs.

Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and remodel her business's location.

loans.name: Betsi Maritza

texts.es:
La Señora Betzi es una socia muy alegre, carismática quien forma parte del grupo de crédito Mujeres Triunfadoras hace 10 años, tiempo en el cual ha sembrado una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras y amigas del grupo. Vive por el sector del Arenal en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Betzi tiene 45 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos de 23, 19 y 18 años, su primera hija está estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, su segunda hija le ayuda en el negocio ya que pasa en casa, y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Betzi se dedica a realizar las tareas de su casa, pero también a tiene una papelería y abacería desde hace tres años, labora en ella de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de útiles escolares y víveres para su negocio. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Betzi has been a lively, charismatic member of the Mujeres Triunfadoras group for ten years. In that time she has formed very good relationships with her companions and other group members. She lives in the Arenal neighbourhood of the town of Cuenca, a place known for its cool climate. Since 1999 it has been World Heritage Site because of its beautiful architecture. The local food is very varied and enjoyed greatly by all who visit. The local people are friendly and kind, and even today maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Sra. Betzi is 45 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their three children aged 23, 19, and 18. Her older daughter is studying at university in Cuenca, her second daughter helps with her business which Betzi runs out of her home, and her son is a college student. Betzi's husband is a businessman. They don't own a house so live in rented accommodation.

Betzi is a housewife but she has also run a stationery store and a grocery store for three years where she works every day without a fixed schedule. She plans to use the loan money to buy school supplies and stock for her business.

Her goal is to own a house.

loans.use: Buy school supplies and groceries

loans.name: María Virginia

texts.es:
La Señora María es un socia fundadora del grupo de crédito Mujeres Triunfadoras, grupo en el cual le gusta mucho por la amistad, compañerismo y lealtad de todos sus miembros, vive por el sector del Arenal en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, es desde 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad gracias a la belleza de su arquitectura, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, tres de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo de 11 años estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña María desde hace 36 años se dedica a la venta de periódico y billetes de lotería, este trabajo le gusta mucho y labora de domingo a domingo desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de periódicos y billetes de lotería  para continuar creciendo en su pequeño negocio.

Su sueño es comprarse un terreno y construir su casa.
texts.en:
María is a founding partner of the village bank Mujeres Triunfadoras [Women Achievers]. She likes this group a lot for its friendliness, companionship and loyalty of all of its members.

She lives by the Del Arenal district in the city of Cuenca, a place with a cold climate and a World Heritage Site since 1999 thanks to the beauty of its architecture. Its food is varied and captures the palate of those who visit it, its people are kind, gentle and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

María, 55, is a single mother of four children, three of whom are married and live independently. Her 11 year-old studies in a school in the city. She does not have her own house; she rents. María has been making her living selling magazines and lottery tickets for 36 years. She likes this work a lot and she works every day from 5 in the morning until 7 at night.

She will invest the money of her loan into the purchase of magazines and lottery tickets to continue growing in her small business. Her dream is to buy herself land and build her house.

loans.use: to buy magazines and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 32 years old and married, with one child who is one year old. She runs a domestic product business in Tombo, a western, rural area in Sierra Leone.

Aminata's been in this business since 2007 and she sells glass cups, knives, and food containers within her community. She says that the main problem with her business is its improper location.

Aminata requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone Microfinance Company Limited to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. 

In the future, Aminata would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is 37 years old and married with four children, ages 4 years and 17 years. She runs a fish business in Tombo, Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She started this business to get her daily living. 

She's been in this business since 2003 and sells fish within her community. She says that at present, her business is doing well because out of the profit, she was able to take of her family.

Salamatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more fish for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Ana Rosa vive con su madre en la comunidad de La Choza desde hace 15 años, lugar donde tienen 3 has, se dedican al cultivo de hortalizas y verduras como ser cebolla, zanahoria, lechuga, acelga, perejil, etc. La zona donde ella viven es vitícola, pero implantar viña implica una mayor inversión inicial y hay que esperar 3 años para que empiece a cosechar y obtener ingresos y como la sra. Ana es de escasos recursos no puede implantar un viñedo, por ello se dedica al cultivo de verduras y hortalizas porque estos cultivos requieren menor inversión y se pueden cultivar 2 veces al año, sin embargo solicita el crédito para la compra de materia orgánica, fertilizante y urea; de esa manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos y ofrecer un mejor estatus de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa has lived with her mother in La Choza community for 15 years. She has three daughters. 

They grow vegetables such as onions, carrots, lettuce, chard, parsley etc. 

She lives in a wine region but to grow grape vines is a large initial investment and you have to wait three years to begin harvesting and to get an income.
 
Ana has few resources and cannot grow grape vines. This is why she grows vegetables because these plants require a smaller investment and can be harvested twice a year. 

She is requesting a loan to buy organic matter, fertilizer and urea. This way she can increase her income and improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic matter, fertilizer and urea.

loans.name: Charima Rosalinda

texts.es:
Charima es una joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y cogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, esparrago, entre otros.

Debido a los pocos recursos económicos Charima tuvo la necesidad de trabajar, y es por ello que cada día en la mañana trabaja en un pequeño negocio de venta de celulares, con el cual apoya a sus padres con los gastos de la familia. 

Charima está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una computadora, ya que se ha matriculado para poder estudiar una carrera, de esta manera podrá tener una herramienta necesaria para poder cumplir con los trabajos. Asi ella podrá seguir esforzándose por superarse cada día y poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional”.
texts.en:
Charima is a young 19 year old girl. She lives in the city of Ica, which is characterised by a hot dry climate, as well as developing agriculture, particularly the growing of cotton and asparagus, among others.

Due to having few economic resources, Charima had to work, and this is why every morning she works at her business selling mobile phones, with which she helps her parents with the family bills.

Charima is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have offered she will be able to buy a computer. She has registered to be able to study for a career, and in this way she will have a necessary tool to be able to complete her work. She will be able to continue pushing herself by getting better every day and so be able to make her biggest dream a reality: to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Allan Eliet

texts.es:
Allan  es originario de la ciudad de León, tiene una hija, él se dedica  a la venta de pan a domicilio el cual tiene 4 años ejerciendo esta actividad a él en este negocio le ha  ido muy bien, Tanto así que cuando el inicio vendiendo pan con una bicicleta, hoy en día el distribuye su pan en una motocicleta, el cual el recorre la mayoría de los barrios entregando su producto.
 Está solicitando préstamo para comprar a lo inmediato una motocicleta que posea un mayor espacio, seguridad de su producto y comodidad para su  persona. Cuando cancele este préstamo tiene como planes futuros realizar mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Allan is from the city of León and has one daughter. He makes a living delivering bread to homes. He has been doing this work for four years and he has been very good at this business - so good that when he started, he sold bread with a bicycle. Today he distributes his bread on a motorcycle, which he takes to the majority of the neighborhoods to deliver his product.

He is applying for a loan to buy a motorcycle immediately that has more space, security for his product and comfort for himself. When he pays back this loan he has future plans to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 40 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual tiene un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo posee un clima variado y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente el cultivo de algodón, uva, entre otros. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar, ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos  y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Día a día Maritza trabaja en su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos y también venta de golosinas a las afueras del cementerio de su ciudad, ella labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente y con el fruto de sus ingresos apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque desea superarse cada día.

Maritza está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en los corrales de los cerdos y poder comprar mayor mercadería para su negocio, de esta manera ella podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad  su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hija”.
texts.en:
Maritza is 40 years old and lives in the city of Ica, a place which has warm and comfortable weather, but at the same time, variable weather, and where there is a lot of agriculture, especially cotton production and grape growing among other crops. Maritza learned how to work from a young age because her parents had a low income, and that is why she was only able to study up to 5th grade of secondary school.

Maritza work day to day in her small business of rearing and selling pigs and also sells candy outside the cemetery in her city. She works around 9 hours a day and serves around 15 customers per day. She uses the income to support her parents with the household expenses. She feels that she is making progress because she is very polite to her customers and, above all, because she makes an effort to do better every day.

Maritza is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she has been able to improve the pig pens and has been able to buy more merchandise to stock her business. In this way, she will be able to continue working and fighting to make her greatest dream come true: “for her daughter to be able to study a profession.”

loans.use: to buy pigs and to repair their pens.

loans.name: Maria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad de clima variado, gastronomía muy deliciosa y sus pobladores son muy alegres, Maria es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de las adversidades, es por ello que cada día trabaja muy duro en su humilde empleo como obrera, en una empresa textil de su ciudad. Con el fruto de su trabajo saca adelante a su pequeño hijo de 10 años de edad, el cual es lo más importante que tiene en la vida y es por ello que lucha cada día para poder brindarle una vida mejor.

Maria está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá mejorar sus instalaciones sanitarias ya que actualmente no están terminadas de construir, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y seguir luchando para poder salir adelante y hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”Darle una profesión a su hijo y terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old. She lives in the city of Chincha, a city with varied weather, a delicious cuisine and cheerful inhabitants. Maria is a woman who really wants to get ahead, despite adversities. That is why every day she works very hard at her humble job as a laborer in a textile company in her city.  With te fruits of her labor she gets her 10 year old son ahead. He is the most important thing in her life. That is why she fights day to day to be abel to offer him a better life.

Maria is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help she will able to improve the bathroom facilities that that haven't finished being built yet. This way, she can offer a better quality of life to her son and keep fighting to get ahead and make her biggest dream come true: give her son an education and finish building her house.

loans.use: to finish construction of a bathroom.

loans.name: Matilde Florentina

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 61 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Jayanca, la cual se encuentra ubicada al norte del país y tiene un clima muy cálido y acogedor. Matilde vive al lado de su esposo, a quien ama mucho a pesar de las adversidades por las cuales han atravesado. 

Luego de mucho esfuerzo y ahorro Matilde logro iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra y sobre todo poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Matilde trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día y atiende alrededor de 15 clientes de forma diaria; Matilde cree que está creciendo con su negocio porque tiene muy buena sazón.

Matilde está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá construir y mejorar el baño de su vivienda, lo cual le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder tener una buena salud, así ella podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Matilde is 61 years old. She lives in the city of Jayanca, located in the northern part of the country. It has a very warm and pleasing climate. Matilde lives with her husband, whom she loves very much, despite adversities they have gone through. 

After a lot of hard work and savings, Matilde was able to start her business selling food. With it, she has extra income and above all she can help her husband pay the household expenses. Matilde works around 5 hours a day and serves around 15 customers a day. She thinks she is growing with her business because she is a very good cook.

Matilde is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her, she can build and improve a bathroom in her house. This will allow her to have a better quality of life and be able to be in good health. This way, she can make her biggest dream come true: having a great restaurant.

loans.use: for construction and improvement on a bathroom.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 10 lengths of African print cloth, 20 pairs of shoes, and 10 dozen outfits for children.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Alberto, tiene 60 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 9 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece a Taulabe, Comayagua. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura. El  tiene cultivos de café cerca a su casa y vende el café en pergamino y en uva. Es su única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar. Sus clientes son de la misma zona donde vive. Ha decidido solicitar este préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y mantener limpia su finca. Su plan es invertir para mejorar su finca y sembrar más cultivos y de allí poder mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Alberto, 60, lives with his wife and nine children. They live in a village that is part of Taulabe, Comayagua. 

He has worked as a farmer for his entire life. 

He grows coffee close to his house and sells the coffee berries as well as dried coffee. 

This is the only source of income for him to sustain his family. His clients are from the same area as him. 

He is requesting a $750 loan to buy fertilizer and to keep his farm clean. 

His plan is to invest to improve the farm and sow more crops and in this way improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to give proper maintenance to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer joven de 20 años se casó muy joven de cuyo matrimonio nacieron sus 2 hijos que en la actualidad tienen  5 y 2 años respectivamente, a quienes desde hace algún tiempo ha tenido que educarlos sola pues frente a ella se atravesó un obstáculo muy difícil de superar que fue la muerte de sus esposo que era igual de joven que ella. Ahora es viuda pero lucha para Salir adelante con sus hijos con quienes vive en el Pacto una parroquia del Cantón Quito ubicado en la Provincia de Pichincha en la República del Ecuador. Pacto está ubicado en el noroccidente del Distrito Metropolitano de Quito, su historia inicia en la época preincaica y su nombre se deriva de acuerdos realizados entre partidos políticos importantes. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y ganadera, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Costa como de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Gloria ayudaba a su esposo en los cultivos de caña de azúcar desde hace 3 años, ahora se dedica a esta actividad para poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Los conocimientos adquiridos de la escuela primaria le ayudan mucho para negociar y comercializar sus productos. Sin embargo, ella quiere crecer con su negocio para ofrecer a sus hijos un mejor estilo de vida, es por esto que quiere incrementar sus cultivos comprando semillas e insumos para ampliar el área de los cultivos de la caña y así vender más y a mejores precios para que sus clientes la recomienden y pueda incrementar las personas que compran su producto. Para esto Gloria requiere un préstamo que lo ha solicitado en Fundación Alternativa en donde le han asesorado y brindado la confianza y seguridad necesarias para poder dar este paso de crecimiento laboral. Gloria agradece a quienes a través de Kiva aportan con su préstamo para apoyarle, pues es muy valioso para ella recibir la ayuda ya que su sueño es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria is 20 years old and married very young. She has two children who are five and two years old. She has for some time had to raise her children by herself, because she has had to overcome the death of her husband, who was as young as she. Now she is a widow, but she is working hard to get ahead and provide for her children. She lives with her children in the parish of Pacto, which is in the canton of Quito in the province of Pichincha in the Republic of Ecuador.

Pacto is located in the northwest of the Metropolitan District of Quito. Its history began in the Pre-Incan period and its name comes from agreements reached among important political parties. Its economy is based on agriculture and livestock, due to its climate and geography. The agricultural products of the area come from both the coastal region and the highlands region, and the people of Pacto make their livelihoods from these activities. Although far from the city, families in the area have undertaken all kinds of economic activities to provide for their needs and for those of their communities.

Gloria helped her husband for three years with their sugarcane crops, and she now grows sugarcane to provide for her family. She says that the education she received in primary school has helped her a lot with negotiating and selling her products. Gloria would like to grow her business to offer her children a better life, and it is for this reason that she wants to increase the size of her crops. She plans to buy seeds and other agricultural inputs to increase the size of her sugarcane fields. She wants to sell more of her product at better prices so that her customers recommend her, and so that she can increase the number of people who buy her product. For this reason, Gloria is requesting a loan from the field partner, who she says has provided her the advice, confidence and security necessary to be able to take this important step in growing her business. Gloria says she is grateful to those who support her by contributing to her loan through Kiva, and that she values this help very much, because her dream is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other agricultural inputs to increase her crops.

loans.name: Maria Adelina

texts.es: María,  tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija y vive en el municipio de Choloma. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas de maíz. El negocio lleva 7 meses de existencia y está ubicado en un local prestado en la comunidad. Ella antes se dedicaba al aseo de una clínica. El préstamo que Maria solicito es por L.5, 000 y los invertirá en la compra de sacos de harina de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas y vender. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener materia prima en su inventario. Tiene como meta crecer con el negocio y llegar a comprar una maquina industrial para aumentar la producción.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old, is married, has a daughter and lives in the city of Choloma. She makes a living from selling corn tortillas. She has had this business for 7 months and it is located in a borrowed space in the community. Previously she made a living from cleaning a clinic. 

The loan that Maria asked for is for 5,000 Honduran lempiras, and she will invest them in the purchase of sacks of corn flour to make and sell tortillas.  This loan will help her to keep raw material in her inventory. She has the goal of growing with the business and succeeding in buying an industrial machine to increase production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn flour to make and sell tortillas

loans.name: Nataly

texts.es: La Sra. Nataly de condición humilde, madre de un solo hijo, de estado civil casada. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a la producción de papa y su esposo es taxista, necesitan el crédito para compra de fertilizantes químicos para la producción de uva que hace 1 año recién empezó con esta actividad, pues gasto en la Construcción de su casa que ahora les puede dar una comodidad a su hijo quien estudia y necesita un lugar donde pueda realizar sus tareas. Este crédito ayudara al desarrollo de su actividad económica que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos futuros y mejorar de esa manera su estatus de vida, pues podrá hacer crecer a su familia de manera cómoda y oportuna.
texts.en:
Nataly, a humble person, is the mother of one son and is married.

For the past nine years she has grown potatoes and her husband is a taxi driver. 

They need the loan to buy chemical fertilizers to grow grapes. They started this one year ago. 

They have spent money on home construction which now gives them more comfort and their son can study and has a place to do his homework. 

This loan will help them with their economic development and allow them to have higher incomes and in this way improve their lives. Thus will allow their family to grow in a comfortable and opportune way.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Angeles  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito los Ángeles está formado por 4 socias y 3 socios quienes se dedican a diferentes negocios los cuales son la fuente de ingresos para salir adelante con sus familias y poderles entregar un mejor futuro. Viven por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos, cuenta con grandes paisajes en donde se puede disfrutar de la naturaleza, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gastronomía es muy variada la cual cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carmen, se encuentra realizando su segundo crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Los Ángeles,  le gusta esta forma de créditos por el compañerismo la amistad y la unión del grupo, también por las charlas educativas que reciben en cada reunión.

La Señora. Carmen tiene 23 años, es casada y ha concebido un hijo de 11 meses de nacido. Su esposo tiene una mecánica donde realizan herrerías, por el momento no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una casa de un familiar.
 
Doña Carmen pasa en casa al cuidado de su hogar y de su hijo que aun esta pequeño, pero también está estudiando Imagen Radiológica y le va muy bien en sus estudios. 

El dinero de su crédito es para comprar hierro para el negocio de su esposo.

Sus metas son culminar sus estudios, llegar a ser profesional y ayudarle a su esposo para que crezca en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Los Ángeles loan group is formed by 4 female members and 3 male members who make a living from various businesses that are the source of income to get ahead with their families and to be able to give them a brighter future. They live in the downtown area of the city of Cuenca, which is bathed by four rivers and has great landscapes where one can enjoy nature. Its architecture is a mix of colonial and modern and its cuisine is quite varied, which captivates the palate of those who visit. 

One of the members of this group is Carmen. She is receiving her second loan alongside her friends and companions from the Los Ángeles loan group.  She likes this kind of loan because of the companionship, friendship and unity of the group, and also because of the educational lectures that they receive at each meeting. 

Carmen is 23 years old, is married and has an 11-month-old son. Her husband has a workshop where he does iron work. They don't own their own house at the moment so they live in the house of a relative. Carmen stays at home to take care of her house and her son who is still small, but she is also studying Radiological Imaging and her studies are going very well. The money from the loan is to buy iron for her husband's business. Her goals are to finish her studies, to become a professional and to help her husband so that he grows in his business.

loans.use: to buy iron

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Marangatu  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comités, es de la ciudad de Concepción, una zona un poco alejada de la zona de la ciudad y aun se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
Carmen es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles que ella misma prepara y de esa forma está teniendo los ingresos para su familia y de esa forma poder darles todo lo que necesitan para poder seguir creciendo.  Es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que no se deja abatir por los inconvenientes.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para sus alimentos, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a su familia todo lo que desean. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Marangatu is on its first cycle, located in the city of Concepcion, an area located a bit outside of the city that is growing. It's an area with difficult access, and that's why the members of this group fight to keep growing and give their place of residence a better environment to grow slowly.  Carmen is one of the members, she sells food that she prepares herself and this way she is getting income for her family and can provide them with everything they need to continue growing.  She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman, that doesn't allow herself to give up by challenges.
She requests a loan to buy ingredients for her food and this way continue to provide for her family everything they want.  She is thankful for the opportunity as it will be much help.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food such as meat, vegetables, condiments and other.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en:
Donald lives in the Malindi area in Kenya. He runs a food café. This has been his business for the last two years. He sells cooked food to the customers who visit his café. He has employed someone who runs the café on his behalf. 

He has ambitions of growing the food café into a restaurant. The major challenges that he faces include competition from other businesses and taxation, which cut into his income. 

He knew about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy rice, flour, potatoes and sugar. The income that he raises will pay school fees for his children and give them a better life in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, potatoes and sugar.
